Title: Business Intelligence Engineer
Description:
3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Engineer or in a similar role.
 Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines.
 Experience with visualization tools (Quicksight, Tableau, etc).
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related technical discipline.
 Hands-on experience and advanced knowledge of SQL and Python (or any scripting languages).
 Experience defining and driving a BI roadmap.



 Job summary
  Want to work on one of Amazon’s fastest growing advertising businesses? We are looking for a self-motivated Business Intelligence Engineer to provide proactive insights and create self-service tools to anchor worldwide decision making. If you love working in a fast-paced environment and want a role that will give you a chance to create your roadmap, solve challenging problems and guide strategic decisions to support a business in hyper-growth phase, then this job is for you!
 
 Open to hire in Seattle, Toronto or New York.
 
 About Amazon Ads
  Amazon Ads helps brands create experiences that delight customers and deliver meaningful results. With 300+ million worldwide active customer accounts, and first-party insights based on shopping, streaming and browsing signals, brands can craft relevant campaigns that enhance customer experiences. Our solutions on Amazon.com, services like Twitch, IMDb TV, Alexa, Amazon Music, and partnerships with third-party publishers and exchanges make Amazon Ads the ultimate amplifier for brands to reach the right audiences in the right places, both on and off Amazon.
 
 About our team
  Sponsored Display is Amazon’s first self-service display advertising offering. It empowers any advertiser – regardless of budget size, advertising experience, or technical expertise – to set up display campaigns that show ads on key placements across Amazon retail website and apps, devices (Kindle, Fire Tablet, Fire TV, Echo), third-party websites and mobile apps.
 
 Our team is responsible for building and taking this startup offering to market, with the goal of empowering millions of advertisers to independently plan and execute campaigns. We move quickly to release new features, utilize innovative machine learning models and deliver billions of ad impressions across the globe every single day, all within tens of milliseconds, enabling advertisers to discover and engage audiences throughout their shopping and entertainment journeys.
 
 About this role
  As a Business Intelligence Engineer in this role, you will lead efforts to define key business metrics, design and implement scalable BI solutions, and maintain and improve existing dashboards and reports. This role will support and drive impact across all levels and teams throughout the Sponsored Display and partner organizations.
 
 The ideal candidate will be highly analytical, resourceful, customer-focused, and collaborative. They will have a strong understanding of the business and the ability to translate business requirements into analysis, collect and analyze data, and make recommendations back to the business. The candidate for this role will be required to continuously learn new systems, tools, and industry best practices to help design new studies and build new tools that help our team automate and accelerate analytics.
 
 Core responsibilities include:
 

 Engage with leadership and diversified customer groups to understand the needs and recommend business intelligence solutions.
 Partner with Data engineering team to define the data elements and data structure that the team should leverage to enable capabilities.
 Design, implement, and support platforms that provide business teams ad-hoc access to large datasets (e.g. data visualization tools for non-tech business users)
 Interface with business customers, gathering requirements and delivering complete reporting solutions.
 Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
 Participate in strategic & tactical planning discussions.
 Standardize data and report consumption across all customer groups.
 Make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve the operational and quality metrics.

 #adptjobs #adpt




Master’s degree in BI, Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance or related field required.
 3+ years in relevant experience as data scientist, data engineer, software engineer, business intelligence engineer, or equivalent.
 Experience in data mining, SQL, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.
 Analyst in a company with large, complex data sources and cross functional collaboration.
 Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets
 Expert-level proficiency in writing complex, highly-optimized SQL queries across large datasets.

 Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Title: ITSM Business Analyst with SECRET or RELIABILITY government clearance
Description:
Meet our professionals
CGI Global - We are CGI_EN



Position Description:
CGI is a leading IT Consulting firm awarded Great Place to Work 2022 that has Canadian roots and a global reach!  Are you motivated by the opportunity to delight your clients by providing with innovative solutions to sophisticated technical problems? CGI is more than just an IT consulting company; we are a global organization offering a world of opportunities. Become part of an outstanding culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, influence decisions, achieve your full potential, and chart your own career.  These are exciting times for CGI, and we are looking for hardworking individuals to innovate with us. If you have a groundbreaking spirit and thrive on innovation where you can influence the direction of technical strategy, now is the time to join our team! Our benefits include a share purchase program, profit sharing, wellness credits, training and development programs and flexible work schedules.  We are constantly growing and are always on the lookout for motivated people like you to join in on the CGI dream on a permanent full-time basis.  Currently, we are looking for a Business Analyst to become part of CGI with experience and good knowledge of ITSM functionality and data. Secret/Reliable Clearance required. 


Your future duties and responsibilities:

   Ability to deliver on the following typical tasks and activities associated with role:
   


Participate in project management activities (e.g. SCRUMs) and perform as SCRUM Master when requested by Contractor PM
Lead requirements gathering and refinement and development of detailed requirements
Work with business sponsors very early in system development to define ITSM end-user roles and permission sets for system
Facilitate and co-lead business functionality prototyping sessions with ITSM Tool specialists (especially customer-facing sessions)
Establish acceptance test criteria with customer
Participate in definition of ITSM Tool related UAT and PROD sanity tests and ensure traceability of requirements to sprint “releases”
Organize client-facing meetings and coordinate communications with client regarding development and test tasks
Perform business analyses of functional requirements to identify information, procedure, and decision flows
Evaluate existing procedures and methods, identify and document items such as database content, structure, application subsystems
Develop data dictionary and define and document interfaces of manual to automated operations within application subsystems, to external systems, and between new and existing systems
Identify candidate business processes for re-design, prototype potential solutions, provide trade-off information and suggest a recommended course of action




Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

   Candidates for the System Analyst role require:
   


More than 5 years of relevant experience
Must hold a Government issued clearance such as Enhanced or Secret Clearance
Very good knowledge of ITSM functionality and data
Very good writing skills for functional and technical requirements, test cases, and process 
documentation
   

Good client-facing skills

 #LI-BL1
  


Skills:

Database
 Microsoft Project
 Microsoft Visio
 SQL



What you can expect from us:
Insights you can act on  While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.   When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today — one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.  At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.   Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI — where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Title: Senior PSI Funding and Data Analyst
Description:
Job Information




Job Requisition ID: 29073
Ministry: Advanced Education
Location: Edmonton
Full or Part-Time: Full Time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week
Regular/Temporary: Regular
Scope: Open Competition
Closing Date: July 12, 2022
Classification: Program Services 4




 About Us


 The Government of Alberta is committed to a diverse and inclusive public service that reflects the population we serve to best meet the needs of Albertans. Consider joining a team where diversity, inclusion and innovation are valued and supported.


Education and growth are integral to our Province’s future and building an even better and stronger Alberta. Alberta Advanced Education is focused on accessible, affordable, and quality advance learning opportunities for all Albertans. Through funding, scholarships, apprenticeship programs, and research, we help Albertan’s maximize their potential and explore the many ways to learn, grow, and educate Alberta.


The PSI Funding & Analytics unit, as part of the PSI Funding & Capital Planning Branch, performs a wide variety of tasks, with the majority of the work related to a few main functions:

Leveraging internally and externally available financial data sources to create an understanding of how Alberta post-secondary institutions compare to one another and to the rest of the country.
Supporting funding decisions by ensuring they are based on evidence and Alberta’s unique post-secondary education system.
Updates and monitors financial policies relating to post-secondary institution activities under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Advanced Education.





Role


 Are you a mastermind in financial analytics, accountability, and integrated thinking? Are you known to think outside of the box and come up with innovative and efficient ways to analyze problems while having everyone smiling? Read on, this opportunity may be for YOU!


The Senior PSI Funding & Data Analyst plays a leading role in understanding how post-secondary institutions finances relate to funding, program objectives, and other provinces. You will use your creative problem solving and ability to integrate information to create ways to analyze data from a variety of sources to provide a deep financial understanding of the financial operations of Alberta’s post-secondary system. Your curiosity, analytical mindset, accounting expertise, and systems thinking will enable you to integrate information effectively to inform funding decisions, policy direction, and communicate to colleagues across the Ministry.


You will have strong communication and collaboration skills which allow you to form solid relationships with colleagues across the Ministry as well as our partners at the post-secondary institutions. These relationships will help you to act as a bridge between the Ministry and the post-secondary when it comes to financial analytics, accountability and financial data matters.


Key Responsibilities:

You will perform a variety of analysis using large and diverse data sets and create information products for senior executive to answer a variety of questions.
You will clearly communicate policies and guidelines relating to financial matters to others in the Ministry.
You will provide advice, analysis and guidance on institutional borrowings and dispositions to senior leadership team.
You will leverage the Ministry’s repository of information sources to analyze and evaluate financial operations of post-secondary institutions.
You will assist the department in the development of funding model options using evidence and criteria unique to Alberta’s funding practices.


 
Key Relationships:
Your work will require you to engage, collaborate with staff across the ministry at all levels. You will liaise with



Program areas to understand information needs and their datasets that can be leveraged to increase the Ministry’s understanding of institutions in a meaningful way.
Corporate Finance, Governance Services, Legal and Legislative Services, Policy, other ministries, Statistics Canada, and relevant communities of practice.





Role Cont...


 What do you need to get there?

Data validation, statistical analysis, and quantitative and qualitative research methods.
Demonstrating strong analytical skills and sound judgment to manage high-profile functions involving sensitive information.
Planning for and delivering results, from concrete deliverables to process improvements, managing resources effectively, and ensuring attention to detail.
Using analytical tools such as Microsoft Cubes and having expert level knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Accounting principles and best practices including Public Sector Accounting Standards.
Ministry and post-secondary financial reporting systems and related information management systems.
Asking the right questions to deepen the understanding of issues so that innovative responses can be developed.
Demonstrating flexibility, adapting to changing conditions while staying focused on positive culture and long-term outcomes.


 
This is a highly integrative role, working to ensure accountability activities across the ministry are mutually supportive and that they balance program area perspectives with broader department policy goals and government direction. To be successful in this role, you will need well-developed analytical, reasoning, evaluation, judgment, project management, problem solving, mentorship, and leadership skills. The ability to collaborate with staff and a broad range of clients is essential to successfully influence processes and decisions. When it comes to competencies, your strengths will need to lie in Systems Thinking, Creative Problem Solving, Drive for Results, and Develop Networks.


To demonstrate your strength in these required competencies, clearly provide examples of how you have exhibited each of them in the past in your cover letter.




 Qualifications


 Requirements:

A University Degree in a relevant field and a minimum of 4 years’ related experience. Related experience or education may be considered as an equivalency on a one-for-one basis.


 
Assets:

Experience in data analytics, financial analysis, and data modelling
Highly advanced excel skills
Analytical tool experience
Experience related to Alberta’s adult learning system
Experience with public sector accounting standards
Possess or are pursuing an accounting designation





APS Competencies


 Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in-depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.


This link will assist you with understanding competencies:


Critical Competencies:

Agility – Demonstrated ability to manage and adapt to change. Ability to manage human, financial and physical resources within an operating environment.
Drive for Results – Leadership skills, including demonstrated ability and comfort with decision making responsibilities, coaching and teaching, and the ability to inspire and build confidence in others.
Develop Self and Others – Proven ability to foster partnerships and to achieve organizational goals within an organization.
Build Collaborative Environments – Strong track record in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Develop Networks – Ability to foster a climate of cooperation amongst, and build solid relationships with public agencies, government, committees and other partners.
Systems Thinking – Effective leadership abilities combined with a strong commitment to operating within a team environment and the ability to motivate and inspire other to achieve common goals.
Creative Problem Solving – Excellent analytical and decision-making skills.





Salary


 $2,683.10 to $3,507.06 bi-weekly. ($70,028 - $91,534 per year)




 Notes


 There is one permanent position available located in Edmonton. This position is 36.25 hours per week, 8:15 am – 4:30 pm Monday- Friday.


Applicants are advised to provide a cover letter summarizing information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.


This competition may be used to fill future vacancies across the Government of Alberta, at equal or lower classification and salary.


What we offer:

Working for the Alberta Public Service –
Comprehensive benefits plan:
Pension plan:
Health Spending Account:
Leadership and mentorship programs
Professional learning and development
Positive workplace culture and work-life balance
Opportunity to participate in flexible work arrangements such as working from home up to two days per week and modified work schedule agreements
Research Alberta Public Service Careers tool –





How To Apply




If you are not currently an employee with the Government of Alberta, the first step in applying for a job is creating your candidate profile within our online application system,


Existing employees should access the Career tile in 1GX to submit their application in order to be recognized as an internal applicant.


Once you have created your candidate profile, visit the Alberta Public Service job site to apply for jobs at:


Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies. In your resume, please include dates (including months and years) associated with all education and work experience. Please also indicate whether your work experience was casual, part-time or full-time. For example: January 15, 2006 - June 25, 2009: Assistant (PT three 8 hr shifts/week).


Resources for applicants:

 
It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS)




 Closing Statement


 This competition may be used to fill future vacancies, across the Government of Alberta, at the same or lower classification level.


We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.


If you require further information on this job posting or a copy of the role profile, and/or require a disability-related accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact Zooha Baig at Zooha.Baig@gov.ab.ca.


If this competition is closed as per the closing date noted above, please continue to check

Title: SAS analyst developer
Description:
Primary Locations: Montreal, Quebec
Attendance: Hybrid

Employee Status: Regular


 Schedule: Full-time


 Do you love challenges?
 Do you like to analyze business needs with the goal of resolving issues that are often quite complex?
 Are you passionate about data? Do you know how to build solid partnerships with business and technology sectors?

 Come join the Advanced Analytics Delivery team! This dynamic and innovative team works on data valorization projects. Join us and be part of a team that will define data analytics of the future.
 Being an SAS Developer in our team means helping other developers, analysts, IT solution architects and business sectors to manage the corporate SAS platform and implement analytics solutions for all Bank sectors. You’ll be part of a team that aims to learn continuously in order to ensure innovative management of data systems.
 Day-to-day tasks:
 Your main challenges

 Conduct various analyses, make recommendations to address business issues in an efficient and sustainable way, and implement them according to the highest of quality standards
 Provide leadership to help users understand and make the best choices
 Certify or modify existing applications and programs based on the needs of users, business imperatives and technology requirements
 Help maintain and upgrade the SAS platform, access management and data security
 Help migrate the SAS platform to the AWS Cloud and integrate SAS Viya into the Horizon advanced analytics ecosystem
 Analyze requests for changes to systems, assess their impact on existing applications, and suggest and carry out the appropriate changes
 Ensure the integrity of computerized data and system stability

 More specifically, you will:

 Analyze, program, and/or optimize the SAS code
 Ensure the technical feasibility of requested changes and understand the business field and industry requirements
 Analyze and review the logic and documentation of existing systems under your responsibility, as needed
 Investigate and resolve problems of varying complexity for application or infrastructure systems
 Monitor control mechanisms to ensure they satisfy user needs and business imperatives
 Establish communication mechanisms with other delivery teams and the business sectors
 Manage adequate and optimal use of software and infrastructure resources
 Meet user requests and help them further their knowledge of SAS

 Requirements

 University degree or academic equivalent in a related field and 5 years of relevant experience
 Experience in SAS program development and support
 Knowledge of the SAS Viya platform, an asset
 Experience with databases
 Knowledge of Unix and Linux
 Knowledge of the banking industry and modelling, desirable
 Knowledge of programming statistical models, an asset
 Knowledge of Agile and DevOps methodologies, desirable
 Knowledge of data protection, desirable
 Leadership, professionalism and interpersonal skills
 Bilingualism, spoken and written (English and French)


 Your benefits
 Upon hiring, you'll be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family:

 Health and wellness program, including many benefits
 Flexible group insurance
 Pension plan
 Employee Share Ownership Plan
 Employee and Family Assistance Program
 Preferential banking services
 Community involvement program
 Telemedicine
 Virtual sleep clinic.

 These are just some of the many benefits we offer.
 Being part of the National Bank team means being able to reach your full potential thanks to the many career development opportunities in different sectors, on different projects and with different teams.
 Due to the current pandemic, our entire team is currently working remotely.
 People first
 We're a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people. Our mission is to have positive impact on people’s lives.
 Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that's accessible to all employees.
 We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodation, feel free to let us know during our initial conversations.

 Are you ready to live your ambitions?

Title: Credit Analyst
Description:
To view a full list of White Cap Canada Career Opportunities, please visit Brafasco Jobs, Careers | NCA and Brock White Jobs
  

Why Brock White?


 We offer a Competitive Pay + Comprehensive Benefits available on your first day of employment
 Shift: 40hr work week, Monday to Friday - 8hr Day Shifts
 Evenings and Weekends Off
 Company matching RRSP
 Paid training and orientation
 Team Environment
 Internal Learning Centre for Career Development.
 Opportunities for Career Growth.
 Tuition Reimbursement.
 And MORE!!!


   J
  ob Summary


   Monitor assigned portfolio of customer accounts to minimize risk and maximize responsible for account collection by performing account analysis, review paying habits of customers and make recommendations regarding account status.
  


 Major Tasks, Responsibilities, and Key Accountabilities


 Provides analysis and reporting in support of Credit Services.
 Compiles and analyzes Credit Services productivity metrics, providing support in periodic process improvement/redesign reviews to improve A/R portfolio efficiency.
 Conducts regularly scheduled and periodic portfolio risk, receivables efficiency, and receivables delinquency analysis.
 Conducts regularly scheduled and periodic aging analysis on product lines.
 Sets up new accounts and ship to for A/R and maintains customer records in related systems.
 Conducts periodic departmental quality audits and improve departmental efficiency through workflow process analysis, process documentation and policy update recommendations.
 Works with other departments to identify efficiency and reporting enhancements.
 Performs tax maintenance and validation. Researches and pulls certificates for Tax department.
 Generates weekly credit line review reports and maintains ownership of weekly credit line review process.
 Conducts credit review for new and existing customers and obtains references.
 Conducts special projects related to tax expiration reports, response time issues with IT and vendors, etc.


 Nature and Scope:


 Demonstrates skill in data analysis techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information and inconsistencies/anomalies in more complex research/data.
 Nature of work requires increasing independence; receives guidance only on unusual, complex problems or issues. Work review typically involves periodic review of output by a supervisor and/or direct customers of the process.
 May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support or professional personnel.


 Work Environment:


 Located in a comfortable indoor area.
 Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
 Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about.
 On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.
 Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.


 Education and Experience


 Typically requires BS/BA in a related discipline. Generally 2-5 years of experience in a related field OR MS/MA and generally 2-4 years of experience in a related field. Certification is required in some areas.



About White Cap Canada Inc.:


A position at White Cap Canada isn’t your ordinary job. You’ll work in an exciting and diverse environment, meet interesting people, and have a variety of career opportunities. The White Cap family is committed to Building Trust on Every Job. We do this by being deeply knowledgeable, fully capable, and always dependable, and our associates are the driving force behind this commitment. White Cap operates nearly 400 branches across the U.S. and Canada with approximately 7,000 employees. In Canada, White Cap includes the Brafasco, NCA and Brock White brands. Together serving as a one-stop shop providing concrete accessories and chemicals, tools and equipment, building materials and fasteners, erosion and waterproofing and safety products to professional contractors by meeting their distinct and customized supply needs in non-residential, residential and infrastructure end markets. Why White Cap Canada: Comprehensive Benefits Package, Team Environment, RRSP Matching Plan, Internal Learning Centre for Career Development, Competitive Salary, Opportunities for Career Growth, Wellness Program AND Tuition Reimbursement!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Description: 
 
 Business Intelligence Analyst



 About BonLook



 BonLook offers an innovative sales experience and stylish products with unwavering quality. Since its inception, the company's goal has been to make prescription eyewear accessible and a must-have fashion accessory with unparalleled value. Initially launched online, the company has 36 stores in Canada and over 350 employees. Today, BonLook defines itself as the ultimate destination for a wardrobe of trendy frames, designed and created in Montreal.
 


 Why BonLook ?



 Participate in the success of a local company founded by entrepreneurs who saw the potential to develop an entire industry.
 To evolve in a company whose products are conceived and designed in Montreal in a head office located in the heart of the Saint-Henri district on the banks of the Lachine Canal.
 Work in a company whose organizational values are applied daily: joy, excellence, innovation and transparency.
 Participate in a culture of diversity and inclusion in all areas of the company.
 Develop professionally by having access to training on optics via our internal platform and the coaching of our optician trainers.
 Access to a competitive total compensation package and a generous employee discount for you, your family and your friends.



 Mandate



 Our Business Intelligence team is looking for a BI Analyst specialized in web data and visualization. We are looking for someone who is passionate about data, curious and resourceful to support the various departments of the company. Your sense of initiative and innovation will lead you to develop dashboards, performance indicators, and decision support tools.
 

   Reporting to the Digital and Business Intelligence Director, the BI Analyst will have the opportunity to benefit from a variety of expertise to support you in your work, improve your knowledge and develop your expertise. You will also be called upon from time to time by your colleagues to assist in the production of reports and analysis on other subjects, or to collaborate on other projects.
 


 Main responsibilities



 Based on business needs, identify sources and data required for report development;
 Coordinate integration activities with technical experts;
 In collaboration with the various departments, develop dashboards and performance indicators to make relevant information available to the various teams;
 Maintain, support and evolve existing dashboards and reports;
 Ensure data quality and investigate anomalies;
 Manage access to the various reports;
 Write all documentation related to the tasks performed
 Support the immediate team in all other analysis and project tasks;



 Requirements



 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in a data analysis function;
 Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (analytics, e-commerce, marketing)
 Experience in report creation and visualization (data import, modeling, visualization)
 Proficiency in Tableau or other visualization software (PowerBI)
 Experience in using databases and SQL language
 Experience in data extraction and transformation (ETL)
 Knowledge of Python and Airflow (asset)
 Bilingual (French and English)



 Since its inception, BonLook has been committed to making a difference and promoting diversity and inclusion. We believe that diversity in the workplace empowers employees to reach their full potential. BonLook encourages people of all genders and cultures to apply for our roles. We provide equal employment opportunities for everyone.

Title: Associate Analyst, Engineering, Facilities & Validation
Description:
Those who join Emergent BioSolutions feel a sense of ownership about their future. You will excel in an environment characterized by respect, innovation and growth opportunities. Here, you will join passionate professionals who advance their scientific, technical and professional skills to develop products designed-to protect life. 

 ASSOCIATE ANALYST, ENGINEERING, FACILITIES & VALIDATION (CANADA) 
6 Month Term Position 

 Emergent BioSolutions is currently seeking an Associate Analyst, Engineering, Validation & Facilities (EFV), at our Winnipeg Facility. The select candidate will have a degree or diploma in Business Studies/Administration, Finance, Information Technologies, Data Science or in another related discipline and will have 1-3 years of relevant work experience. Advanced experience with Smartsheets, Microsoft Office, including Excel, PowerPoint and Visio is essential. Must be detail oriented with strong analytical skills and have the ability to work independently or as part of a team. In addition, this individual will possess a strong work ethic and a commitment to excellence and innovation. 

 THE COMPANY 

 Emergent BioSolutions is dedicated to one simple mission—to protect and enhance life. 
As a global specialty pharmaceutical company, Emergent offers specialized products to healthcare providers and governments to address medical needs and emerging health threats. 

 We value the diversity that each employee brings, and while we look for people who share our Core Values, we thrive on difference as well. With hundreds of talented employees working around the globe, Emergent is a growing organization with a wide variety of scientific, technical and professional career opportunities worldwide. 

 THE OPPORTUNITY 

 Provide data-driven insights through business intelligence systems to support decision-making within the Engineering, Facilities, and Validation (EFV) department and align capital and resource allocation within the business budget. The Analyst will also coordinate initiatives for financial planning and business intelligence systems. 

 DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES 

 Provide analytical support to the EFV department by developing & maintaining Smartsheet dashboards and workflows 
Update and maintain visibility dashboards, track budgets and budget forecast using Smartsheets, SAP & Integrated Financial Planning Software. 
Provide recommendations based on data analytics to support business decisions. 
Create workflows to visualize and streamline processes. 
Monitor & report finance & quality metrics to leadership. 
Support continues improvement initiatives by developing proper workflows, templates and standard work to streamline 
Support resource planning initiatives 
Support roll-out of standard suite of tools within organization & for sites; act as an SME & coach to ensure platforms are successfully integrated into business 
Play a key role in the equipment life cycle and administration improvement by 
Performing administrative updates in SAP to reflect current equipment status 
Supporting facility resource planning and scheduling 

 The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work performed by those in this job. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties, and other duties may be assigned. 


EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:
 Degree or Diploma in Business Studies/Administration, Finance, Information Technologies, Data Science, or a related discipline. 
1-3 years’ relevant work experience 
Advanced experience with Smartsheets, Microsoft Office, including Excel, PowerPoint, Visio essential 
Detail Oriented with strong analytical skills 
Ability to work independently or as part of a team 
Excellent oral and written communication skills 
Efficient time management skills 


ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
 Citizenship/Permanent Resident or Valid Work Permit. 
Successful Completion of a Criminal Record Check. 

 Interested? Please visit www.emergentbiosolutions .com under the career section to apply today! 

 As part of our team, you'll join talented and inspiring colleagues whose sense of purpose complements your own. We offer highly diverse career opportunities, a supportive culture, competitive salaries, flexible work arrangements and an extensive benefits package. Information submitted will be used by Emergent BioSolutions for activities related to your prospective employment. Emergent BioSolutions respects your privacy and any use of the information submitted will be subject to the terms of our Privacy Policy .

Title: Sales Analyst - Mississauga, ON (hybrid model)
Description:
At Henkel, you can be a game changer and craft your career. Unleash your entrepreneurial spirit by bringing your ideas to life within a global team. Our leading brands and technologies, along with our high-performing businesses will provide you with countless opportunities to develop your skills and explore new paths. Your career at Henkel will contribute to a more sustainable future, while you grow within our vibrant, diverse culture of trust and belonging. If you're up for challenging the status quo, join our team of pioneers and make your mark on the future with us. 
  
Do you dare to make an impact?

YOUR ROLE 

Responsible for supporting Sales/Marketing department within Beauty Care Hair
 Professional business unit by providing sales, promotion, new product forecast and performance analysis.
 Analyzes data from internal and external sources, presents conclusions and recommendations.
 Evaluates innovation and promotion effectiveness
 Responsible for promotional forecasting
 Assists in assessing marketing and e-commerce efforts to provide supportive analytics regarding ROI and market gains.
 Reviews profitability of the customer assortment and identify trends and opportunities to drive sales.
 Analyzes standardized sales reports to track attainment of growth objectives, e.g., sales results, historical growth, market growth trends, sales exceptions and product use.
 Masters corporate guidelines while demonstrating strong leadership and ownership skills.
 Ad-hoc analytical projects as assigned.




YOUR SKILLS 

Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience
 5+ years’ experience in a Sales Analyst role
 Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
 Strong analytical skills, able to interpret and exploit syndicated data
 Strong communication skills (presentation and written).
 Strong problem-solving skills.
 Systems proficiency (Business Intelligence, SAP, Microsoft office…)
 Time management - able to prioritize multiple tasks

Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel’s request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.  All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Operations
Description:
Company Description
  Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization
 When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.
 CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:

 Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
 Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
 Accelerated exposure and responsibility
 Global career development opportunities
 Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
 A flexible/hybrid work environment combining in office collaboration and remote working
 A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance

 If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.



 Job Description
  We are hiring a Senior Analyst on the Data Operations Team. In this role, you will combine your passion for asset management with your expertise with data management to build and support investment data operations. Your focus will be to provide daily production support for a group of datasets used across the Fund by Investment Departments and Core Services. You will also contribute to the development of daily processes, including Playbooks, reporting, notifications, and data quality checks. You will work collaboratively with Data Engineering and Data Quality Teams in addition to business users to deploy appropriate levels of data operations.
 The Opportunity:

 Address daily data exceptions on a timely basis: review the daily data quality report, provide override suggestions, and communicate with portfolio management and other impacted teams
 Act as key contributor on the process of ingesting new datasets on CPP Investments’ cloud environment; provide detailed technical and business requirements including data transformation and mapping logic and data structuring.
 Manage and enhance investment data infrastructure through initiatives such as improving metadata and data integrity
 Institutionalize knowledge of data used in the investment processes
 Work with technology teams to design and implement data related tools and analytics, in addition to operational processes.
 Stay current with new vendor product offerings and how they might be used by the data operations team.
 Stay current with trends in the data and analytics space (e.g. data visualization techniques, Big Data, etc.)




 Qualifications
  Consider applying if you have most of the following:


 A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or other quantitative discipline.
 Familiarity with financial data vendors such as Bloomberg, S&P and Refinitiv and their product offerings
 Solid programming skills (ie. Python, pyspark, SQL) with professional programming experience in a data context is a must (e.g. data extraction, data manipulation, data analysis, etc.)
 Good understanding of key financial data concepts such as financial statement data, pricing and market data, ESG data and security master data.
 Strong analytical skills; detail oriented
 Knowledge of visualization techniques would be an asset
 Strong communication skills both written and verbal
 Ability to work under pressure to deliver within time-sensitive deadlines
 Demonstrated interest in financial markets; ability to interpret economic news and market conditions; a CFA is a plus
 Passionate to learn new technology
 Successful candidates must be team players and exemplify CPP Investments’ guiding principles of high performance, integrity, and partnership

 Additional Information
  Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-RK1
 #LI-Hybrid
 At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.
 We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.
 Our Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity:
 In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
 Disclaimer:
 CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

 Mandatory Vaccine Policy
 All employees in the Toronto, New York, San Francisco, Mumbai, Sydney, Hong Kong, and Sao Paulo offices will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Accommodations to this policy will be made for medical or other protected grounds. Please contact us to discuss any accommodation needs.

Title: Senior Revenue Recognition Analyst
Description:
Senior Revenue Recognition Analyst
The Revenue Recognition Team is seeking a Senior Accountant to support the world-wide revenue recognition activities to ensure that all internal and external reporting commitments are met in a timely manner. This role will collaborate with various cross-functional teams including Billing Operations, Sales, and Deal Desk to ensure consistent application of rev rec policy.Essential Responsibilities
 Review contracts to ensure revenue is recognized in compliance with ASC 606 Calculate POC revenue on professional services engagements Perform the month-end/quarter-end close activities related to revenue recognition Prepare journal entries including SSP allocation in compliance with our policy Maintain deferred revenue schedules for assigned entities Partner with Billing Operations and Finance to research and resolve revenue fluctuations Prepare GL account reconciliations Participate in SOX testing as needed Prepare materials for internal and external audit requirements and respond to audit inquiries Ad hoc projects and analysis to answer business questions and opportunities Continuous improvement mindset to identify improved revenue recognition processesBasic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in finance and/or accounting Experience with Revenue Recognition (ASC 606) is strongly desired Experience working in technology, specifically software and cloud related businesses, an asset Excellent data analysis skills Excellent Microsoft Excel skills Experience working with SAP and SFDC, an asset Team player with good interpersonal skills Proactive approach to problem solving Strong work ethic and follow-through Detail oriented
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $35.00-$40.00 per hour
Additional pay:

Bonus pay

Overtime pay

Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Senior Revenue Recognition Analyst: 5 years (required)
finance and/or accounting: 1 year (required)
Revenue Recognition (ASC 606): 1 year (required)
SAP and SFDC: 1 year (required)

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
At IMCO, our talent is among the best! IMCO offers a uniquely stimulating and rewarding environment where you can help build and drive organizational transformation, all while seeking to challenge yourself, learn, and grow your career.
 


   We offer a culture of collaboration and passion, creating unwavering value for the clients we serve. Our vision is to be the partner of choice for Ontario’s public sector funds and build a high-performing, value-based Asset Management firm in the heart of downtown Toronto.
 


   If you are ready to drive best-in-class service, and join a collaborative, motivated, and fun team of professionals, we’re ready to offer you a great place to work with exciting opportunities for growth and development.
 


   If you want to use your expertise to drive strategic business outcomes, then we want you at IMCO!
 


 IMCO is looking for a highly motivated Senior Business Systems Analyst, Data Analytics Applications to join our team!
 


   As a key member of our IT Investment Applications team, the Senior Business Systems Analyst will work as a trusted liaison with business partners across the firm for data management and analytics. This role is responsible for understanding organizational objectives, conducting analysis, eliciting business and systems requirements, designing specifications, facilitating testing, implementing solutions, and supporting production operations. The overall responsibility of the position is to deliver value-added solutions while ensuring adherence to IMCO’s procedures and supportability of all investment applications.
 


   As a Member of Our Team You Will be Responsible For:
 



     Conduct analysis, elicit business requirement and document detail specifications and requirements
   


     Design efficient and effective solutions that support corporate priorities
   


     Implement solutions to support the total portfolio data analytics requirements from stakeholder teams
   


     Liaise with data engineers to evaluate solution options and alternatives
   


     Involve in process design meetings and translate into process documentation
   


     Lead process walkthrough with team members and SMEs
   


     Provide operational support for Investment, Investment Operations and Data Operations teams
   


     Apply analytical and technical skills to investigate applications, data, and system issues
   


     Facilitate IT design and development to optimize data integrity and extensibility
   


     Create and enhance data feeds from upstream sources to downstream data and analytics consumptions
   


     Partner with stakeholders to design and develop solutions to support corporate strategies and objectives
   


     Participate in designing and implementation of organization data architecture and technology infrastructure
   


     Evaluate data models and workflow between source investment applications (such as Accounting Book of Record, Risk, Custody applications) and centralized data depository
   


     Assess, research, and work closely with stakeholders, vendors and IT members to onboard new investment functions and improve workflows
   


     Think creatively to design solutions with a forward-thinking approach to accommodate future opportunities
   


     Disseminate knowledge of design, coding, and analysis techniques with other staff in collaborative manner
   


     Lead discussions with stakeholders to ensure full understanding of objectives, priorities, and requirements
   


     Ensure adherence to IMCO’s processes and procedures, and the overall supportability of all solutions with proper documentation and training
   


     Build business cases for systems implementations and enhancements
   


     Manage the testing process to ensure visibility, traceability, and execution to deliver high quality solutions
   


     Design test strategy, test cases and perform test validations
   


     Deliver effective support, investigate root causes, recommend changes, oversee execution, and maintain accurate documentation
   


     Strive to improve environment stability by working with others to set up and maintain production configurations. Continuously improving service levels with all business users
   


     Understand operational risk, controls, and systems performance management in all initiatives
   


     Participate in RFI, RFP and IT Due Diligence processes
   


     Represent IT team to plan and execute DR/BCP
   



   What do you need to succeed?
 



     5+ years experience in developing and supporting technology applications in capital markets and asset management industry
   


     Solid understanding of trading lifecycle, investment workflow and operational processing requirements for all asset classes and instrument types
   


     Experience with investment applications, data, business processes, and business continuity
   


     Learn new processes and systems efficiently with attention to details
   


     Ability to collaborate effectively across multiple stakeholder groups
   


     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with logical mindset and technical aptitude
   


     Demonstrated ability to use of analytics skills to analyze data and operational workflow
   


     Display sense of ownership and take initiation to solve business problems
   


     Ability to comprehend complex business requirements and create detail artifacts
   


     Strong working knowledge of trading lifecycle and investment workflow with experience in investment data flows, operational processing requirements and management of data assets
   


     Prior implementation experience of public and private markets investment systems such as portfolio management and analytical systems, order management systems, and research platforms, including total portfolio view and analytics by asset class and strategy
   


     Technical aptitude and knowledge of data modeling
   


     Working experience with investment accounting book of record applications, custody platforms, risk systems would be an asset
   


     Ability to play multiple hands-on roles such as requirement analysis, solution design and visioning, planning, testing, solutions implementations, and support
   


     Excellent communication skills, ability to communicate comfortably with both business and technical teams
   


     Knowledge of application development life-cycles including planning, requirement, analysis, design, build, testing, implementation and post-implementation activities in agile and waterfall approaches
   


     Strong domain knowledge in IT service management such as incident management, change management, configuration management and operations management is preferred
   


     Prior involvement with third-party vendors, internal and external operational audits
   


     Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Finance, or a related discipline
   


     CBAP, PMI-PBA, CSC, Lean and/or Six Sigma, or PMP designation is preferred
   


     Experience with CIBC Nexen, MyStateStreet, Bloomberg trading platforms, Managed Account Platform, Azure Data Platform, Eagle (Data Management, Performance and Accounting Solutions), Ortec Glass, Argus Enterprise, MSCI Risk Manager, DTCC Alert and CTM, Dynamo, FINCAD, MATLAB, SQL and Python
   


   We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 


   Our hybrid work model offers flexibility and provides our employees with the opportunity to lead a well-balanced life. Our Corporation’s offices located at 16 York Street, Suite 2400, Toronto, ON M5J 0E6 provide a welcoming space for employees to gather, work collaboratively, and grow together.
 


 IMCO is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities in its recruitment process. Please advise IMCO if you require an accommodation and we will work with you to meet your needs. Candidates being considered for this position will be required to submit to a background screening.

Title: Reporting Data Analyst (Power BI) - InsightLens
Description:
Company Overview
 INSIGHTLENS delivers software and services to Financial Institutions which have hundreds or thousands of locations. For our customers, the retail footprint is a critical part of their customer’s total branded experience.
 Financial institutions use INSIGHTLENS to improve the speed, accuracy, and cost effectiveness of brand-related initiatives throughout their branch network. Using tailored software and data analytics, INSIGHTLENS significantly increases the speed of fixture rollouts, reduces the cost of renovation programs, and increases the accuracy of marketing distributions.
 To find out more, please visit us at www.InsightLens.com
 Summary of Position
 The Reporting Analyst is responsible for utilizing various data applications, programming and visualization tools to provide insightful analysis and reports for Envision customers and stakeholders.
 The Reporting Analyst is also expected to coordinate various programs with vendors and customers, accumulate related data and update the corresponding sections in the database.
 Role & Responsibilities

Project coordination activities with vendors related to delivering the outputs and collecting data needed for the database update
Investigate and scope requirements for scheduled and ad hoc analytical and reporting needs
Develop and maintain Excel and Power BI reports and dashboards
Perform data analysis to identify data integrity issues/trends
Ensure that automated data imports/exports contain appropriate data and run in a timely manner
Maintain documentation for reporting and data integrity standards and related policies
Any other duties that may be assigned from time to time, in line with the role, competencies and skill

Qualifications & Skills Required

Experience with Power BI (Power Query/DAX)
Familiarity with data management, data analysis and ETL process skills and concepts, including data modeling and transformations.
Strong Microsoft Excel background
English language working capability (written and verbal).
Strong technical documentation skills
Ability to quickly learn new and old technologies to support all needs
Excel-based test as a part of the hiring process
Attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team
Ability to communicate effectively with technical peers as well as business clients.

Nice to have:

Experience with Excel VBA
Experience with any ERP system, PostgreSQL

Education and Experience:

Completion of post-secondary in a relevant field
Minimum 2 years in a similar role with Data/reporting/analytics

Title: Business Analyst/Software Implementation Professional
Description:
Job Title: Business Analyst/Software Implementation Professional
   Location: Vancouver, BC, Canada
   Department: Forestry
  
 Job Description
   Trimble Forestry is the leading provider of business solutions for timber management and wood product companies. We help companies take advantage of current technology to achieve operational efficiencies so they can make better-informed business decisions. Our systems can manage any aspect of the entire forestry cycle from silviculture, harvesting, procuring, hauling, consuming, inventory or selling logs and/or wood byproducts.
  
 With the launch of our ConnectedForest solutions, we are growing rapidly. To help with our growth, we are seeking experienced Business Analyst / Software Implementation Specialists to join our team. You will play a key role in delivering our solutions in an efficient manner for our customers. The ideal candidate will enjoy working with customers, enjoy the teamwork environment and be motivated to self-start initiatives and contribute to the product vision for the company by providing valuable feedback.
  
 Your primary responsibilities will be to:
 



     Develop detailed functional and business requirements specifications
   


     Liaise between business units, end-users, technology teams, and support teams
   


     Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs
   


     Assist with resolution of technical issues for our clients via email and telephone
   


     Maintain and expand documentation on all systems configurations, processes, and procedures
   


     Some Report and Code writing responsibilities are expected in this position
   



 Requirements:
 



     Bachelor's degree in business related field and 3-5 years of experience
   


     Have very clear written, visual, oral expression of ideas with business and technical people
   


     Have an outstanding track record of customer service
   


     Demonstrate knowledge and experience of systems development methodologies, system analysis concepts, techniques, and tools
   


     Able to conduct online and face-to-face solution configuration and training services for customers
   


     Knowledge in Transact-SQL writing stored procedures, table schemas, views and more
   


     Competency in ER diagram modeling using tools including ER/win, Visio or others
   


     Travel occasionally across Canada and US
   


     Knowledge of French is a plus (writing and speaking)
   


     Knowledge with Databases and development tools (such as Visual Studio or Delphi) a plus
   



 Information to Review:
   The following links are recommended in order to better your understanding of Trimble, and the products available within this particular division.
 




      Trimble
    




      Trimble Natural Resources
    




      Trimble Forestry
    



 Videos to Review:
 




      Trimble: Innovation at it's best
    




      Trimble: A History of Outstanding Innovations
    



 Trimble is transforming the way the world works by delivering products and services that connect the physical and digital worlds. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics enable customers to improve productivity, quality, safety, and sustainability. From purpose-built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble software, hardware, and services are transforming a broad range of industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial, and transportation and logistics.

Title: Pricing & Planning Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:
 The Pricing & Planning Analyst supports the creation, implementation, and ongoing requirements of the Corporate Sales & Marketing department. This role is to share the responsibilities of our four channels of support as follows: pricing RFQ'S, strategic sourcing with carriers to control costs and relationships, key account support for on boarding new business developments, and ensuring that the Pricing & Planning Department follows the compliance guidelines and regulations.

 Duties and Responsibilities:

 Work on RFQs, RFIs and RFPs, and review the bid package to adhere to service requirements to support completion with requested deadlines
 Analyze market trends and business opportunities to build new business
 Deal with carriers and customers directly to source and provide quotes
 Assist in analyzing export and import data to create models for pricing and account profitability measurement, lane segment studies determining the measuring yield and margin results
 Negotiate service contract freight rates, terms and conditions with carriers for heavy haulage projects
 Run or participate in meetings and carry out presentations
 Develop strong overseas contact relationship for pricing and operational support
 Strong customer service driven and support the onboard process dealing with multi-function
 Respond/report to customer inquiries and requests
 Work closely with sales resources and Director of CSMD
 Support the national sales team to achieve overall goals and budgets
 Various other tasks maybe we required


 Qualifications:

 3+ years experience in a similar role (preferably in the freight forwarding industry)
 Working knowledge and experience in a multi-mode domestic and international transportation service (especially in Ocean & heavy-haulage)
 Strong computer knowledge in Microsoft Excel, Word, Access and PowerPoint programs
 Familiar with customer contracts, SOP, tariff rates and issuance of quotation along with accessorial charge and proper T&C
 Ability to work individually as well as a team
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 High level of customer service skills with proactive
 Strong mathematical and analytical skills
 Ability to remain calm in stressful situations, work under pressure and meet deadlines


 Education/Certifications:

 Bachelor Degree in Commerce of College Diploma

Title: Business Analyst, QTC Strategy & Solutions Modernization
Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. 

Job Category Finance and Operations 
 
Job Details 
About salesforce.com: 
Salesforce.com is the global leader in customer relationship management (CRM) software. We pioneered the shift to cloud computing, and today we’re delivering the next generation of social, mobile and cloud technologies that help companies revolutionize the way they sell, service, market and innovate–and become customer companies. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For. Our more human, less corporate culture is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team and celebrating success Aloha-style. Ready to find your #dreamjob? 

Position Description:  The Revenue Operations Quote to Cash Strategy and Operations team is responsible for operational aspects of the Sales Operations Q2C space . The Business Analyst will have diverse responsibilities focused on technology and system implementations, as well as process analysis, supporting key business and operational initiatives, among other critical activities! The role will report to the Manager of the Quote to Cash Strategy & Operations Team Salesforce.com is a fast-paced environment and we are looking for someone who can hit the ground running to manage multiple responsibilities and projects while producing high-quality work. 

Responsibilities: 

Support systems-related SOPs project execution in direct partnership with IT; measure and document business results achieved through solution implementation 
Advise the business on best practices and available tools to manage business processes and other strategic initiatives 
Partner with IT (internal and external partners) and functional business owners to resolve systems related issues 
Meet with business teams to discuss process and follow up actions. 
Identify areas of improvement to increase accuracy, completeness and/or consistency and implement solutions in process, policy, and overall operations of the RevOps function. 
Audit processes to fix transactional data 
Surveys and analyzes best practices for techniques and processes. 
Gather and provide business requirements 
Complete User Acceptance Testing for IT deployments 


Required Skills/Experience: 

Professional Business Analyst experience, or focus in project/program management. 
Understanding of RevOps/ SalesOps functional disciplines: 
Proficient in Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint 
Understanding of systems analysis, including root cause analysis and other process modeling and systems design methodologies 
Project management skills. 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
Ability to multi-task and perform effectively in a fast-paced environment. 
Able to think independently and consider cross-functional and downstream impacts. 


Desired Skills/Experience: 

Advanced Knowledge of Business Systems - Salesforce.com (certification a plus), contract management, system error bug triage  

*LI-Y

Title: FUNCTIONAL ANALYST, IT BUSINESS SOLUTIONS
Credit Risk Analyst II
Description:
Opening up a world of opportunity.
We're a financial services organization serving more than 40 million customers across the globe through our Wealth & Personal Banking, Commercial Banking and Global Banking & Markets businesses.
We’re here to use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up a world of new opportunities for our customers, our people and our communities.


About Global Functions
HSBC’s Global Functions play a vital role in supporting the bank’s Global Businesses and offer a broad range of career opportunities in areas from Legal, Risk and Finance to Human Resources, Sustainability and Communications. Our operational and functional teams around the world help HSBC’s Global Businesses to operate efficiently and effectively on a day-to-day basis. They also focus on controls and governance to reduce risk and protect the Group’s reputations.
Global Risk is a thriving and expert risk management function supporting HSBC globally with all aspects of risk management. The team actively manages a varied and dynamic range of risk types, including security, fraud, information security, operational, credit, pension, insurance, compliance, regulatory, market, reputation and geopolitical risks.


About the role
The position is primarily responsible for analyzing retail credit risk, including model development, strategy development, portfolio analysis, performance monitoring and data management.


Responsibilities:

Support the growth of the retail portfolio while controlling credit risk
Deliver fair outcomes for our customers and ensure own conduct maintains the orderly and transparent operation of financial markets.
Internal stakeholders: Wealth & Personal Banking (WPB) Risk, IT, Finance
Business lines: Wealth & Personal Banking (WPB)
Lead and develop an effective team through communication, performance management, development plans and reward/recognition practices.
Promote an environment that supports diversity and reflects the HSBC Brand.
Supports the development, maintenance and analysis of all WPB analytics models, strategies and reports
Works with the business team to provide risk support for new and existing lending programs and projects
Provides statistical analysis and reporting on retail credit risk
Drafts, updates and maintains regulatory and audit compliant documentation on the development and validation of risk models, strategies and reports.
Stays current on regulatory developments related to WPB Credit Risk, drafting new documentation, gap analyses, or memoranda as required
Works with other internal teams to comply with regulatory requirements and deliver needed projects to maintain compliance on an ongoing basis
Ensures the accuracy of all Retail Analytics management information generated by the department, including reconciliation of data to financial accounts or other benchmarks
Quickly assesses and recognizes variances and inconsistencies in data and the various outputs of particular models and reports. Works independently and makes quick decisions with respect to data elements and the various analyses to be taken generally without reference to senior staff.
Generates multiple risk related electronic files, management reports and ad hoc queries in a timely manner
Plans and conducts validation of the Retail portfolio by effectively challenging both methodology and assumptions
Ensure all employees are aware of and effectively identify and manage applicable money laundering (ML), terrorist financing (TF), sanctions and reputational risks.
Complete other responsibilities as assigned



  Requirements 
 


A degree in statistics, mathematics, business, economics, or other quantitative discipline.
At least 3 years of experience in data modeling preferably in the credit risk function of a bank or financial services organization
Extensive analytical skills and statistical knowledge
Advanced proficiency in the use of SAS as well as excellent data presentation skills. Knowledge of Python is a plus.
Experience in data management, data processing and data analysis
A sound understanding of the data, products, systems and processes with respect to WPB Risk
