Title: Senior Risk and Compliance Analyst
Description:
Senior Risk and Compliance AnalystThis is an exciting opportunity to take on a new role at BlueShore Financial. The Senior Risk and Compliance Analyst is responsible for driving risk and compliance-related change initiatives throughout the organization. In addition, the Senior Risk and Compliance Analyst will influence change outside of the organization with regulators and other credit union system stakeholders through policy and regulatory proposal analysis.Employee Type: Full TimeClosing Date: June 20, 2022Job Category: Risk and ComplianceLocation: 1250 Lonsdale, North Vancouver (Hybrid Work)Key responsibilities of this role are: Risk & Compliance

Executes and implements Risk and Compliance related changes throughout the organization through leading projects and initiatives in partnership with other internal teams.
Assists in managing the Enterprise Risk Assessment process; works with internal stakeholders to ensure risks and controls are well documented, and gaps are actively being closed.
Identifies key risks and control failures.
Reviews and adjusts the Enterprise Risk Assessment Process as regulatory and environmental changes evolve.
Analyzes data to produce insightful intelligence on risk trends and emerging risks.
Regularly assesses open audit findings, working with findings owners to remediate, and produce regular reporting.
Manages the third party risk framework and process, ensuring complete lifecycle management of third parties including risk assessments, legal reviews, and ongoing monitoring.
Represents Risk and Compliance on projects ensuring risk and compliance related considerations (e.g. data governance, privacy, AML requirements, etc.) are “baked in”. Assists in the management of privacy incidents.
Contributes in producing Risk and Compliance reports for both Management Risk Committee and Board.
Participates in audits/regulatory reviews.
Provides guidance to managers and staff on security, risk and regulatory related issues including the risk based approach, legislative compliance, frauds, forgeries, controls, security compliance, and security systems; alerts staff of security warnings and bulletins.
Provides guidance to internal departments (such as Business Process Solutions) on risk and legal concerns with respect to procedures and forms.
Partners with Learning & Development to ensure up to date information on security, risk and regulations is included in applicable courses.
Drafts procedures, creates new content, and updates existing posts on Compass for the branches, head office and department.
Supports the business continuity plan (BCP) framework by assisting with plan updates and annual testing for all business units, branches, and the corporate-wide plan.
Other duties as assigned as they relate to the scope of the position and business goals of the department

Policy & Regulatory

Represents BlueShore Financial at external conferences, on external working groups, etc. to participate in CU wide initiatives both to strengthen the CU system, and ensure BlueShore Financial derives benefit from participation.
Reviews and analyzes regulatory and system produced proposals (e.g. proposed legislative changes to PCMLTFA, Digital Charter, etc.) and prepare a response on behalf of BlueShore Financial.
Researches, analyzes and makes recommendations on provincial and federal government legislative and regulatory proposals, policies and other emerging issues that could impact BlueShore Financial.
Monitors activities at all three levels of government, particularly legislation and regulations impacting the credit union’s operations that could impact business opportunities or strategic goals.

Qualifications and Experience

Minimum 5 years’ experience in financial services in a risk, compliance or regulatory related role or equivalent combination of education and/or experience
Bachelors’ Degree in Business, Criminology, Policy or equivalent
Expert knowledge of regulatory, risk and compliance practices and policies
Demonstrated ability to influence stakeholders and implement change
Solid knowledge of fraud management/AML
Solid knowledge of Microsoft programs including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and SharePoint
Discretion, attention to detail and confidentiality are essential to the role

What can BlueShore Financial can do for you?

Opportunity to take part in BlueShore Financial's Risk and Compliance culture evolution.
A Performance Reward Program which pays a variable cash reward program recognizing the achievement of corporate, team and individual goals.
Opportunity to work in a world class, award winning organization.
Continuing education assistance.
Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, pension, flexible benefits.

What BlueShore Financial needs from you: 

Accountability, in all directions.
A proactive, self starter with a “Can Do” attitude.
Goal-oriented and driven to meet objectives.

Got awards? At BlueShore Financial we are constantly innovating, connecting and improving to deliver exceptional client and employee experiences. As a result, we have grown to become an award winning organization, garnering both local and national attention for our progressive practices.Be Richly Valued. At BlueShore Financial, our employees are as important as our clients. We strive to create a workplace culture of openness, empowerment, trust and passion. Our values unite our organization and are our guiding compass. But it is our exceptional staff that bring our corporate values to life. They are passionate about delivering exceptional client service and a banking experience that promises to impress. And this level of engagement shows. We've been formally recognized making Kincentric’s "Best Employer in Canada" list ten years in a row and as one of "Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures" in Canada by Waterstone Human Capital.From the moment you walk into one of our Financial Spas™, you’ll know you’ve arrived at a special place, where all the elements work together to stimulate the senses and create a distinctive atmosphere unlike any financial institution you’ve experienced. We embrace the west coast lifestyle, while providing a premium and sophisticated experience for our clients and employees. You may not recognize us, but we've been serving the lower mainland for over 80 years! But this isn’t the Credit Union of your childhood. We’re different and better.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
The Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for supporting the maintenance of our BI infrastructure and delivering key improvements to the platform through comprehensive data analysis, BI software application and design. 


PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Data Cube Maintenance & Development:


Define business needs and translate into project specific action through proactive communication with key internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborative work relationships that focus on both the quality of the technical solution as well as organizational acceptance.
Own the development of key strategic initiatives and continuous improvement for the set of BI existing tools.
Collaborate with BI Architect to define the best course of action related to maintenance and new developments.

Solution Development:


Gather business requirements and facilitate key BI initiatives in partnership with the business units
Evaluate best-in-class tools / programs to help facilitate corporate business intelligence
Leverage the value of data acquisition. Think data first, and promote treating our data pool as a strategic asset.
Troubleshoot BI tools, systems, and software and performance-tune these applications as necessary
Design, document, code, test, and document all new or modified BI systems, applications, and programs
Identify and develop data warehousing opportunities ensuring integration with internal and external data sources
Assist in database/data warehouse design to ensure interoperability with BI solutions

Documentation & Support:


Produce ETL design guidelines (documentation) to ensure a manageable ETL infrastructure for the BI system
Ensure high levels of BI availability through support functions and in-depth testing
 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES 


Experience or extensive knowledge and understanding of database development (SQL Server), ETL (SSIS), OLAP (SSAS).
Experience in reporting tools
Advanced Excel
Proficient database management skills, familiarity Dimensional data models and data warehouse concepts.
Data visualization tools experience.
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university preferably in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Information Systems or equivalent work experience
Experience managing data based projects. Establishing project plans and meeting deadlines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to grasp and understand complex systems and see the big picture.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office products and Microsoft SQL server.
Practical Experience in other languages like Python, C#, or VBA
Passionate about data and data management tools
Experience or knowledge on Cloud solutions

 The organization offers an attractive compensation package that encompasses a competitive salary and excellent benefits.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (12-Month contract)
Description:

   At KPMG, you’ll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.
 


 The opportunity

The ideal candidate is a passionate, highly-analytical, personable and goal-oriented individual who seeks to make significant positive contributions to the firm.

Title: Software Business Analyst
Description:
Software Business Analyst 11 months 
      

       Job Number : 44204 
      

Edmonton Transit Service (ETS) is a fully integrated, progressive, easy-to-use public transit system that provides over 80 million rides each year. Transit plays an important role in city building and provides seamless connection within Edmonton and the region by focusing on three pillars: service, infrastructure and technology. ETS is continually assessing how it can best support Edmontonians’ transit needs and expectations.
We are looking for an innovative and strategic individual to join our team within ETS as a Strategic Business Analyst.
As a Software Business Analyst, you will be responsible for understanding, documenting, and analyzing the current state of all transit software, and providing recommendations for software innovations (including but not limited to improvements in processes and identification of new products) that will best fit operational needs.
Your success will be measured by your ability to excel at written communication, improve and break down business processes in clear and understandable ways.
With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments to be Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will:

Determine the stakeholders and users of identified software
Map the current connections among identified software and other systems
Identify points of failure/pain points where the software does not work as intended or as desired
Catalog areas of risk that would be affected by an upgrade or replacement of the software
Conduct gap analysis and highlights areas of deficiency or shortcoming where the software does not meet the needs or standards of the business
Determine overall costs of the software to the business including contract, operational, maintenance, support, and tertiary costs related to connections made to the software
Create a system flow map to identify how data enters the system, how it is used, and where it flows to
Document how users are using software and any processes related to software
Determine which processes within the business are must-have and which could potentially be altered/improved/discontinued through appropriate change management
Identify future areas where the business would like to grow or improve that could be addressed by new software
Identify possible software replacement candidates
Identify potential extra costs that may be incurred due to additional modules, API costs, or additional software that would be necessary
Other related duties as required



       Qualifications : 
       
A degree (or equivalent or higher) in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field
Training or coursework in project management, procurement, software, analytics, and/or process mapping
Minimum of 2 years of research and business planning experience, including developing, analyzing, and/or maintaining processes related to service delivery performance
Experience in the transit industry would be an asset
Proficient in applicable computer software, such as Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Sheets, etc) and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, etc), and the ability to learn and adapt to evolving technology
Knowledge of work methods, studies, and analyses procedures, practices, and terminology as related to the work assigned
Working knowledge of software systems, systems integration, and relational databases
Working knowledge of data analytics and reporting
Working knowledge of process mapping
Ability to understand and execute verbal and written instructions of an advanced nature
Ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with a variety of internal and external stakeholders
Ability to perform research, prepare technical reports, and make recommendations
Ability to perform work and make decisions with considerable independence and judgement
Ability to prioritize, organize, and direct own work to meet set deliverables, as well as thrive in a collaborative environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to understand, express, and present professional and technical information in reports and presentations
Skill in preparing technical reports and in making recommendations
Demonstrated ability to achieve results in the context of a respectful, inclusive and service-minded style
Embrace the Cultural Commitments of Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, and foster an environment that encourages others to do the same
Demonstrate service excellence, embracing diversity and promoting inclusiveness
Demonstrate alignment with the Cultural Commitments of Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, fostering an environment for others to do the same. For more information on the City’s Cultural Commitments, please visit (http://bit.ly/3bH2Ztv)
Demonstrate the foundational competencies, key behaviours and attributes of the City’s six leadership competencies: Courage, Inclusivity, Values-Based Influencer, Collaborative Networker, Systems Thinker and Creative Innovator. For more information on the City’s leadership competencies, please visit (http://bit.ly/2PLbz1w)
Applicants may be tested

The City of Edmonton is committed to inclusive, respectful and equitable workplaces that represent the communities we serve. We continuously improve our systems, policies and practices to remove barriers and ensure our employees, in all their diversity, can succeed. We value applicants with a diverse range of skills, experiences and competencies, and encourage you to apply. To learn more, see the Art of Inclusion: Our Diversity and Inclusion Framework here:https://bit.ly/3hd2d95

Title: Senior Consumer Data Analyst
Description:
As a member of the Business Analytics Function, the Senior Consumer Data Analyst will help create value for Reckitt (Canada) through enabling data-driven decision making for strategic and operational planning. The Senior Consumer Data Analyst will assist in our understanding of our target consumers across our key markets, Infant Formula, Child Nutrition, Intimate Wellness, Health Relief and Personal Care.
The Senior Consumer Data Analyst will be responsible for consumer insights, business intelligence report development, predictive models, and to eventually build ML algorithms generated from our data lake. The Azure lake centralizes marketing data stored in our CDP, Google Analytics, consumer survey data and Shopify e-com transaction records and sales data. You will have access to structured and unstructured data with tools to analyze the data like R and Python and will be responsible for setting up priority analyses and models. Working with other analysts on the Business Analytics team, and Brand and Digital Demand Generation teams, you will generate hypotheses to explore about our consumers and develop models to help predict consumer behaviour to improve sales performance. You will be responsible for ad hoc statistical analysis. You support RB Nutrition and Health teams in interpreting results and contribute to action plans indicated by the analyses and models. You will also be involved in the democratization of our reports, assisting to build out reports in Power BI.
You continually search for improvements in analytic technics, with a goal of being agile and improving research turn-around rates. You leverage new technologies and platforms and are keen to discover ways to gain insight from data.




 Competencies and Skills Required



The successful candidate will hold a university degree or equivalent in data analytics, social sciences, statistics, math, or computer science, with a minimum of 2 years relevant experience.
Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem-solving skills. Ability to translate/communicate analytics recommendations to both technical and nontechnical team members.
Strong understanding of quantitative (univariate and multivariate) analysis techniques. Experience with predictive modelling and machine learning. 
Experience with statistical or technical programming languages (R, Python). Experience using SQL for collecting, organizing, and manipulating data. Model development and deployment.
Experience with Databricks, Spark and Azure.
Experience with data visualization and business intelligence software. Familiarity with Power BI.
Ability to challenge the status quo and encourage use of new information and consumer insights.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously demonstrating strong prioritization skills, balancing uncertainties, and trade-offs to achieve desired business results. Attention to detail with emphasis on both speed and accuracy.
Strong intellectual curiosity and independent judgement with the desire to understand the basis and drivers of consumer behaviour.
Builds a collaborative, positive cross functional team environment and strong working relationships with senior management, marketing, healthcare and retail sales teams, finance, and outside agencies.





Equality


 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, disability or medical condition; colour, ethnicity, race, citizenship, and national origin; religion; pregnancy, family status and caring responsibilities; sexual orientation; sex, gender identity, gender expression, and transgender identity; protected veteran status; size or any other basis protected by appropriate law

Title: HR Systems Analyst - Toronto
Description:
Please apply on Isarta.com
 https://isarta.com/jobs/?utm_source=IND&job=82679
 


Our client is a leader in their industry and they are growing. They are looking for a HR Systems Analyst to join their team. 
The HR Systems Analyst will be a key player in the design, development, implementation, testing, maintenance and enhancements of all Human Resources related technology. This position will provide functional and technical expertise in analyzing, designing and implementing HR system solutions in support of organizational and business requirements, as well as utilizing technology to improve efficiencies. The HR Systems Analyst will also monitor data quality and integrity and proactively lead data remediation efforts. 
What you will deliver: 

Maintain and identify the accuracy and data integrity of the Human Resource Information System by running array of reports and conducting regular audits. Communicate and collaborate with respective HR team members to resolve any data discrepancies 
Serve as a technical point of contact within HR and assist subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities 
Collaborate with HR colleagues, IT and external vendors to ensure user requirement and change requests are reviewed and approved 
Assists Senior Manager, Compensation & Systems with the implementation of work processes and system solutions that support business initiatives, enhance the value and integrity of data and create an efficient system environment for users 
Contribute to the design and implementation of new and additional functionality to the HRIS, including Manager Self Service (MSS), Employee Self Service (ESS) and all other required modules 
Works with HR functional areas to interpret business requirements and develop systems configuration solutions 

? Administrate the HRIS system, with an ongoing focus on identifying opportunities for continuous improvement through technology ? Develop reports and dashboards, including alerts and bursts 

Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including all HR applications 
Develop and optimizes system reporting and prepares ad hoc reports based on end user requirements and specifications 
Creates and maintains appropriate documentation and user training in support of HR Systems applications 
Ensure IT General Controls are adhered to for access, changes and incidents 
Responsible for training Property Administrators and Managers/Supervisors on the requirements of Time and Attendance (UTA). This involves hands-on instruction, on-going telephone support to ensure all properties are familiar with and adhere to the prescribed procedures and guidelines for processing the biweekly payroll 
Support technical aspect and data collection for annual employee survey through Qualtrics including pulse surveys conducted throughout the year 
Prepare the annual department budget and monthly variance analysis preparation. Monitor expenses to verify invoices are coded to the correct accounts. Responsible for any budget questions and communications; key contact person for Finance 
Participates in special projects as required 

What you need to succeed: 

Minimum of 3 years' experience working with HR systems or equivalence 
Post-secondary education in Business and/or Human Resources diploma 
Advanced capability with software and application tools including MS Office Excel and Word 
Knowledge of automated systems such HRIS, payroll systems and time and attendance, preferably with UKG Pro. 
Working knowledge of BI reporting.

Title: Analyst, Quality Control
Description:
Seeing beyond numbersº At Laurentian Bank, we believe we can change banking for the better. Founded in Montreal in 1846, Laurentian Bank helps families, businesses and communities thrive. Today, we have over 2,800 employees working together as One Team, to provide a broad range of financial services and advice-based solutions for customers across Canada and the United States. We drive results by placing our customers first, making the better choice, acting courageously, and believing everyone belongs. This role sits within Laurentian Bank, a subsidiary of Laurentian Bank Financial Group. The Quality Control Analyst controls and ensures the quality of information of Business Services monetary and administrative files and transactions. He/she also provides the Business Services team with technical and administrative support and ensures the harmonization of data with the different systems used.

 º Create, analyze, control and document client files in the different computer systems º Prepare, analyze and control documents related to products and client files º Recommend, apply corrective measures to make files compliant and ensure a follow up º Complete and update control reports º Carry out efficient controls with regard to reconciliation of monetary and administrative transactions, and ensure the application of policies and procedures º Cooperate in audits, provide requested information and apply required corrective measures º Participate in implementing and updating procedures º Support the Business Services teams and cooperate in solving problems º Perform his or her work in compliance with specific practices, policies and objectives, and ensure compliance with current legislation and the Bank's policies, programs and procedures. º Keep his or her knowledge up to date in order to perform the job duties º Perform all other tasks requested by his or her superior or required for the job









 Qualifications :








 º Bachelor's degree in business administration or a related field º Experience in data analysis, an asset Or º College diploma and one to three years of experience in data analysis º Experience in banking, an asset Specific competencies º Strong proficiency in using different computer systems º Knowledge of specialized data analysis tools º Thoroughness, team spirit and collaboration º Autonomous and sense of initiative º Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) º Bilingual









 Additional Information :








 Equity, Diversity & Inclusion: We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible work environment that reflects the diversity of our customers and our communities. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including Indigenous people, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability or any other legally-protected ground. Title: Impact Analyst
Description:
THE ROLEAt Herschel Supply, we act with intent and seek to reduce our negative impact on the planet as we increase our positive impact in our communities. As the Impact Analyst at Herschel Supply Company, you will work on the Supply Chain team reporting to the Director of Sourcing, accountable for all environmental data measuring and reducing our impact on our planet. You will drive Herschel’s new carbon reduction strategies. Using the Higg Index suite of tools, you will implement Herschel’s commitments as members of the Sustainable Apparel Coalition, helping to entrench sustainable practices across the business from product design / development to manufacturing and logistics. This will be a future focused role integrating Herschel’s core values and vision into our impact plan.
*A DAY IN THE LIFE*Our workplace is dynamic, supportive, and entrepreneurial in spirit, and we pride ourselves on being a collaborative, open-minded and imaginative team.On a day-to-day basis, the Impact Analyst is responsible for:

Setting the foundation for our GHG accounting tools and processes, documenting data collection processes, calculations, and refining tools.
Ensuring accurate GHG accounting to track our progress towards our Science-Based Targets.
Managing the vendor environmental data and Higg FEM platform core responsibilities (being annual data collection, data integrity, vendor communications, and data analysis) to sharpen the strategy and show progress.
Providing data visualizations and analysis for communication of progress.
Leading environmental and social data collection, data analysis, formatting, and quality control with internal stakeholders and external consultants.
Organizing data and building reports to show progress against public commitments.
Establishing a protocol for effectively measuring and communicating product impact in line with future legislation and current global compliance requirements.
Evolving material traceability practices to ensure compliance with evolving regulation.
Managing product data using Higg Material Sustainability Index and the Higg Product Module.
Driving Higg Brand & Retail Module adoption across the organization to identify and enhance sustainability and impact.
Identifying obstacles and opportunities in our supply chain and recommending strategies for addressing them.
Key contributor to future Impact Reports or other external communications regarding Herschel Supply's Impact program.
Own PLM material impact data and GHG accounting software.
Project managing new environmental and social programs as they arise.

*YOUR QUALIFICATIONS*

You have a Bachelor’s degree or a diploma in a relevant field (Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, Sustainable Business Leadership, etc.) or equivalent experience.
You have 1-3 years’ experience in an analytics role in a relevant field (energy efficiency or renewables, water, or waste management) and with a relevant industry such as consulting, corporate impact, or apparel and footwear.
You have previous experience with GHG accounting, or you have carbon accounting certification, and a strong understanding of greenhouse gas metrics and reporting standards (i.e. GHG Protocol).
You have technical knowledge of environmental impacts (energy, water, waste) and are familiar with the tools of risk assessment, baseline studies, measuring impact, and mitigation.
Experience with organizing and performing data analysis and quality control on large complex data sets.
You have setup material traceability programs with reputable 3rd
You have previous experience with the Higg suite of tools.
You are an excellent communicator and are able to translate technical information into lay-person’s language.
You have excellent Excel skills.
You have a passion for working cross-functionally with the ability to manage up and down the organization.
Strong organizational skills, works well work under pressure with the ability to multitask and manage priorities.
Ability to work & communicate efficiently with internal and external teams in a professional manner.
A commitment to learn and demonstrate Herschel values.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Job Brief
 We are seeking a Business Intelligence Developer to join our great team of IT professionals at Graymont. An innovative, technology driven, global leader in lime and limestone solutions that operates throughout North America and Asia-Pacific.






Canada - BC - Richmond





Business Intelligence Developer About Graymont:
 Graymont is a global leader in lime and limestone solutions. With operations across North America and Asia-Pacific, Graymont’s growing business focuses on technology and application innovation. Graymont’s Information Services department is instrumental in delivering on Graymont’s strategy, exposing employees to information, technology, and opportunities they might not see in other companies. Visit www.graymont.com to find out more.
 Role: We are seeking an experienced Data Warehouse, ETL, data integration, Business Intelligence and Analytics specialist to join a global team of IT professionals.
 This position will be based out of Graymont's newly renovated head office in Richmond, BC under a hybrid/flexible work from home and in-office arrangement
 This position reports to an Enterprise Applications Manager and is responsible to lead data engineering efforts in a team dedicated to delivering high profile BI, analytics, and data warehouse solutions to internal customers in an organization that highly values Business Intelligence systems. This position will have the opportunity to take part in all aspects of growing and enhancing a highly effective IBM Cognos Analytics based solution, built on a strong enterprise data warehouse foundation.
 This individual will work with subject matter experts to examine and evaluate information requirements across the organization and explore source business system data to understand what connections are needed to meet those needs using analytics. They will have a leading role to recommend, design and build the required ETL, data mart design, and BI solutions. They will also deliver support to end users in the organization about how to use various tools efficiently and effectively in fulfilling business objectives. This includes diving deep into business data to identify data sources and to provide new data-driven insights to challenging business problems.
 Primary Responsibilities:

Work with end users and experts to identify, create, design and deliver cubes, scorecards and reports according to requirements.
Coordinate the creation and management of reporting structures within the data warehouse.
Create models for new data warehouse development and/or changes to existing data stores.
Design and code ETL to populate the data warehouse with data from other enterprise applications.
Maintain and manage a robust set of nightly ETL processes, including regular data reject resolution.
Prepare and deliver recommendations or alternatives for improving processes in reporting systems across the organization.

Requirements:

Experience using IBM Cognos Data Manager, or other Enterprise Data Warehouse ETL Tools (such as IBM DataStage, Informatica PowerCenter, Microsoft SSIS, Alteryx, etc.)
Experience designing and enhancing dimensional data warehouse models across varying business topic areas.
IBM Cognos BI/Analytics, and Cognos Powerplay cubes (OLAP) or equivalent Business Intelligence systems.

We’re looking for a versatile candidate who has a variety of experience in many of these areas:

Hands-on experience designing, implementing, and managing ETL processes
Building data integration between a variety of systems
Supporting Enterprise Data Warehouse environments running on Microsoft SQL Server
Report writing, technical requirements analysis and data modeling.
Excellent analysis and data exploration skills to understand complex source application schemas and data.
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate within a distributed team across the organization.
Inquisitive nature, and strong business acumen, to work across a wide variety of topic areas and an ability make creative connections to identify and solve problems that were previous considered unsolvable.
Exposure to Oracle JD Edwards EnterpiseOne ERP system or data would be an asset.

Title: Business Analyst – Direct Fulfillment - 9 Month Contract
Description:
The Position 

 The Direct Fulfillment Supply Chain function is an emerging capability at The Home Depot. With the outstanding growth as an organization, Home Depot is positioned to become a leader in the Home Delivery business. As such, it is a function that will be in a mode of exciting and significant change over the next few years. 
  
 As a subject matter expert in Supply Chain principles and having an in-depth knowledge of core supply chain or deliveries, the Business Analyst will be accountable for assisting the Manager, Direct Fulfillment with the execution of initiatives. They will work with cross functional partners to resolve specific business issues and will work with leaders and associates to develop and implement key strategies. This includes executing advanced analysis, detailed process engineering and change management.
  

Responsibilities:

 Leads change by example and drives project teamwork through ambiguity of new processes and systems
 Works closely with DF operations teams, Store Ops, IT, and other appropriate cross functional partners to drive project deliverables
 Perform complex analytics and deliver recommendations based on sound Supply Chain principles
 Use analytical methods to model/quantify current and future state performance and costs
 Make recommendations based on sound analytics for future state network improvements
 Recommend and assist in the implementation of best practices within the team.
 Provide project management oversight for various network initiatives to ensure high-quality delivery on project requirements
 Facilitate discussions with key business stakeholders to generate solution ideas and provide status updates and reporting 
Develop and manage action plans associated with improvement initiatives 
Prepare and present project details/updates when necessary to cross functional teams and partners including updates to internal leadership



Experience / Knowledge Required:

 Internal Candidates: Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets expectation, Consistently demonstrates).



3-5 years of analytical experience (ideally in a retail environment) with emphasis on process improvement, replenishment, change management and data analysis
 University or College Degree in business or engineering will be considered as a preferred qualification
 Experience with Distribution, Transportation or a Home Delivery related field a definite asset
 Proficient in: Microsoft Office Suite including Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visual Basic, SQL, Word and Visio, experience with Tableau an asset
 Clarifies and resolves complex business issues by breaking them down into meaningful components to determine root cause and redesigning internal and external business processes 
Strong analytical skills with the ability to extrapolate pertinent information from various sources (reports and spreadsheets) and analyze data for recommendations
 Maturity in a changing environment and ability to go above & beyond a defined role
 Strong relationship builder and has the ability to communicate effectively across different levels of the organization and external stakeholders
 Ability to travel within Canada and or the U.S.A.

Title: Impact Analyst
Description:
THE ROLEAt Herschel Supply, we act with intent and seek to reduce our negative impact on the planet as we increase our positive impact in our communities. As the Impact Analyst at Herschel Supply Company, you will work on the Supply Chain team reporting to the Director of Sourcing, accountable for all environmental data measuring and reducing our impact on our planet. You will drive Herschel’s new carbon reduction strategies. Using the Higg Index suite of tools, you will implement Herschel’s commitments as members of the Sustainable Apparel Coalition, helping to entrench sustainable practices across the business from product design / development to manufacturing and logistics. This will be a future focused role integrating Herschel’s core values and vision into our impact plan.
*A DAY IN THE LIFE*Our workplace is dynamic, supportive, and entrepreneurial in spirit, and we pride ourselves on being a collaborative, open-minded and imaginative team.On a day-to-day basis, the Impact Analyst is responsible for:

Setting the foundation for our GHG accounting tools and processes, documenting data collection processes, calculations, and refining tools.
Ensuring accurate GHG accounting to track our progress towards our Science-Based Targets.
Managing the vendor environmental data and Higg FEM platform core responsibilities (being annual data collection, data integrity, vendor communications, and data analysis) to sharpen the strategy and show progress.
Providing data visualizations and analysis for communication of progress.
Leading environmental and social data collection, data analysis, formatting, and quality control with internal stakeholders and external consultants.
Organizing data and building reports to show progress against public commitments.
Establishing a protocol for effectively measuring and communicating product impact in line with future legislation and current global compliance requirements.
Evolving material traceability practices to ensure compliance with evolving regulation.
Managing product data using Higg Material Sustainability Index and the Higg Product Module.
Driving Higg Brand & Retail Module adoption across the organization to identify and enhance sustainability and impact.
Identifying obstacles and opportunities in our supply chain and recommending strategies for addressing them.
Key contributor to future Impact Reports or other external communications regarding Herschel Supply's Impact program.
Own PLM material impact data and GHG accounting software.
Project managing new environmental and social programs as they arise.

*YOUR QUALIFICATIONS*

You have a Bachelor’s degree or a diploma in a relevant field (Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, Sustainable Business Leadership, etc.) or equivalent experience.
You have 1-3 years’ experience in an analytics role in a relevant field (energy efficiency or renewables, water, or waste management) and with a relevant industry such as consulting, corporate impact, or apparel and footwear.
You have previous experience with GHG accounting, or you have carbon accounting certification, and a strong understanding of greenhouse gas metrics and reporting standards (i.e. GHG Protocol).
You have technical knowledge of environmental impacts (energy, water, waste) and are familiar with the tools of risk assessment, baseline studies, measuring impact, and mitigation.
Experience with organizing and performing data analysis and quality control on large complex data sets.
You have setup material traceability programs with reputable 3rd
You have previous experience with the Higg suite of tools.
You are an excellent communicator and are able to translate technical information into lay-person’s language.
You have excellent Excel skills.
You have a passion for working cross-functionally with the ability to manage up and down the organization.
Strong organizational skills, works well work under pressure with the ability to multitask and manage priorities.
Ability to work & communicate efficiently with internal and external teams in a professional manner.
A commitment to learn and demonstrate Herschel values.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: Spécialiste BI
Description:
Joindre Akinox  
Notre environnement de travail est unique en son genre et nos gens sont véritablement ce qui est le plus important à nos yeux. Pour nous, l’équité, la confiance et la conciliation travail-vie personnelle ne sont pas seulement des buzzwords, ce sont des promesses.
Pour cette raison, nous offrons un environnement de travail 100% à distance et un horaire flexible pour que le travail s’ajuste à TON quotidien et non le contraire.
Nous pensons que tu seras heureux avec nous   

Travail à distance:  Nos bureaux virtuels te permettra de travailler d’où tu veux, que ce soit à la plage, dans un café ou à la maison, tu décides! (Équipement fourni)


Flexibilité :  Tu as une famille, tu aimes t’entrainer à 13h ou tu as simplement une vie remplie, on te comprend. Nos horaires flexibles de 35 heures te permettent d’aménager ton temps à ton goût. Autant dans l’exécution de tes tâches que dans ton horaire, soies en contrôle de ta performance!


Salaire compétitif : Notre rémunération globale a été conçue afin d’être compétitive. Aussi, tu débutes avec minimum 5 semaines de vacances, peu importe le nombre d’années d’expérience.


Avantages sociaux : Parce que nous voulons ce qu’il y a de mieux pour le bien-être de notre équipe, nous offrons une vaste gamme d'avantages sociaux généreux, y compris un PAE, un RVER et une assurance collective comprenant une assurance-vie, médicaments, vision, dentaire, voyage et bien plus!


Apprentissage continu : Nous nous engageons à te permettre d’acquérir une expertise et de la perfectionner en t’offrant un budget annuel pour la formation de ton choix.


Équipe autogérée : Nous misons sur l'expertise, la communication efficace et les valeurs communes partagées pour atteindre nos objectifs. C’est pourquoi nous n’avons pas de palier hiérarchique chez nous. Tu pourras donc participer à la mise en place d’objectifs et avoir des responsabilités à la hauteur de ton expertise.


Collaborateurs :   Travailler en groupe, c'est travailler avec le souci de l'harmonie et de l'efficacité des actions. Tu travailleras en étroite collaboration avec plus de 800 médecins, spécialistes et gestionnaires du réseau de la santé ainsi qu’avec une équipe extraordinaire!

Épanouie toi dans ton rôle : 
À titre de Spécialiste BI, tu deviendras notre expert en modélisation et administration de données et participeras à toutes les phases d’un projet d’intelligence d’affaires : 

Participer aux rencontres clients afin de comprendre et analyser leurs besoins et trouver des solutions aux problèmes analytiques;


Participer à la structuration des données dans un contexte de volume grandissant et être force de proposition dans les réflexions d’architecture de données;
Modéliser les données pour créer et administrer les modèles de données des différents projets et les datamarts prêts à l’emploi pour le client;
Développer les processus ETL adaptés pour passer de données opérationnelles à de l’information structurée pour nos clients;
Mettre en place des processus de suivi de la qualité / tests automatisés pour garantir une donnée fiable;
Documenter les dictionnaires de données et être la personne-ressource pour toutes questions relatives aux données;
Concevoir et créer des tableaux de bord présentant les données de manière simple et compréhensible.

Tu feras profiter l'entreprise des compétences et qualifications suivantes: 

Ta maîtrise en requêtes SQL optimisées, dans différents SGBD (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, …)


Ton expérience avec les outils ETL Talend (atout)
Ta bonne connaissance d’outils de reporting
Ton esprit analytique pour comprendre la donnée et en extraire les indicateurs utiles
Ta capacité à gérer de l’information et traiter des volumes de données importants
Ton désir de collaborer avec des équipes de développement hautement compétentes 
Ta passion envers les nouvelles technologies et le désir de se tenir à jour
Ton enthousiasme face au domaine médical et l’amélioration des soins de santé de la population

__________
Joining Akinox
  
Our work environment is one of a kind, and our people are truly what’s most important to us. For us, fairness, trust and work-life balance are not just buzzwords, they’re promises. 
That’s why we offer a 100% remote work environment and flexible hours so that your work schedule fits YOUR daily life and not the other way around. 
We think you will be happy with us 
  

Remote work: Our virtual offices lets you work from anywhere, whether it’s at the beach, in a cafe or at home, you decide! (equipment provided) 

  

Flexibility:  If you have a family, you like to workout at 1pm or you simply have a busy life, we understand you. Our flexible 35-hour schedule allows you to tailor your time to your liking. Whether it’s in the execution of your taks or in your schedule, be in control of your performance! 

  

Competitive salary: Our global compensation has been designed to be competitive. You will also start with a minimum of 5 weeks paid vacation, regardless of your years of experience. 

  

Benefits: Because we want the best for the well-being of our team, we offer a wide range of generous benefits including an EAP,  a VRSP and group insurance including life insurance,  health insurance, vision and dental care, travel insurance and more!  

  

Continuous learning: We are committed to helping you acquire and develop your expertise by providing you with an annual budget for the training course of your choice. 

   

Self-managed team:  We rely on expertise, effective communication and shared values to achieve our goals. This is why we have no hierarchical level. You will be able to participate in the implementation of objectives and have responsibilities that reflect your expertise. 

  

Collaborators: You will work in close collaboration with more than 800 doctors, specialists and managers of the health network, as well as with an extraordinary team, to help in the battle against Covid-19 

Be fulfilled in your role
As our BI specialist, you will become our data modeling and administration expert and participate in all phases of a business intelligence project: 

Understand and analyze customer needs and find solutions to analytical problems;
Participate in the structuring of data in a context of growing volume and be a force of proposal in the reflections of data architecture;
Model the data to create and administer the data models for the various projects and the ready-to-use data marts for the client;
Develop ETL processes adapted to move from operational data to structured information for our clients;
Implement quality monitoring / automated testing processes to ensure reliable data;
Document data dictionaries and be the contact person for any data related questions;
Design and create dashboards presenting data in a simple and understandable way.

You will benefit the company with the following skills and qualifications: 

Your expertise in optimized SQL queries, in different DBMS (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, ...)
Your experience with ETL tools (ex. Talend)
Your good knowledge of reporting tools (PowerBI)
Your analytical mind to understand the data and extract useful indicators
Your ability to manage information and process large volumes of data
Your desire to collaborate with highly skilled development teams 
Your passion for new technologies and the desire to stay current
Your enthusiasm for the medical field and improving population health care  

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent
Avantages :

Assurance Dentaire
Assurance Invalidité
Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
Assurance Vie
Assurance Vision
Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
Événements d'Entreprise
Horaires flexibles
Programme d'Aide aux Employés
Programmes de Bien-être
REER Collectif
Tenue Décontractée
Travail à domicile

Horaire :

Du Lundi au Vendredi
Quart de jour

Rémunération supplémentaire :

Heures supplémentaires majorées
Primes

Langue:

Français (Obligatoire)

Title: Enterprise Risk Analyst
Description:
Who we are
 At Canadian Premier, everything we do is driven by our genuine desire to build connections with our customers – listening, reflecting, responding – and being there for them during the most trying times of their lives. To be the best at what we do, we look for compassionate, creative people who work efficiently, aren't afraid to make decisions, and are driven to understand how their role fits into our vision; to be the innovative insurer trusted by families to provide financial protection through partners who care.
 For more than 60 years, Canadian Premier has been committed to providing financial security to Canadians and their families in the face of uncertainties, insuring over two million customers coast-to-coast. Every day at Canadian Premier means a day spent helping Canadians and their families build secure tomorrows.
 Headquartered in Toronto, Ontario, with an office in Burnaby, British Columbia, we are a wholly owned and independently operated subsidiary of Securian Financial, a Fortune 500 company*.
 Who we need
 Reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Risk Management, we are looking for an Enterprise Risk Analyst. You will assist in all risk initiatives and programs, verifying all risks are managed in accordance with Canadian Premier's Risk Appetite and adherence to our risk framework, policies, processes, and guidelines. In addition, you will collaborate with Risk Champions to collect and analyze risk data and update all related information.
 As we grow organically and through acquisition, we need someone strategic with a growth mindset who can build strong internal partnerships and provide highly valued enterprise, business continuity and cybersecurity risk management guidance.
 This is a hybrid opportunity, working 2-3 days per week in our Toronto office.
 What's in it for you
 Exposure, impact, and professional growth. This is an opportunity to interact with every area of the organization, gaining exposure and insights across our operations. You will be in a position to scale your knowledge rapidly and your experience, working as part of a smaller, influential and essential team providing analysis, process guidance, and coaching on business continuity, risk management, and control factors. You will be joining during the initial stages of onboarding our new acquisition and will play a role in aligning processes and people to our risk framework. As we continue to grow at an accelerated pace, so will your career opportunities. You will have the chance to work as an internal advisor, moving along a career trajectory to a Risk Manager.
 What you will focus on

 Risk events. You will assist in managing the identification, assessment, monitoring, resolution, and reporting of risks, issues and events. You will contribute to the planning and tracking of follow-up activities. You will coordinate and ensure post-implementation verification.
 Risk mitigation. You will assist in Identifying, maintaining, and evaluating control design and effectiveness to mitigate risks. You will work with the Manager of Enterprise Risk Management, "Risk Champions," and BCM coordinators in business and corporate functions to ensure company alignment.
 Manage data. You will manage the Canadian Premier GRC system (Resolver) and launch KRIs. You will conduct risk assessments and facilitate businesses in data input.
 Knowledge sharing. You will support and ultimately independently facilitate Risk Control Self Assessments (RCSA) workshops. You will maintain and update BCP and BIA documents and coordinate tabletop exercises and drills.
 Reporting. You will analyze data and conduct risk reporting, loss analysis/root cause evaluation, key risk indicator reporting, initiative risk assessments, and post-implementation reviews for new products/pilots.

 What you bring

 The experience. You have a degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Statistics, or a related field as well as direct experience working as an Analyst at an insurance company or a financial institution. You are familiar with industry practices and evolving trends, in particular OSFIs E 21 and B 10. You have gained insights working across enterprise/operations, cybersecurity, and business continuity risk management. You are familiar with setting up and monitoring KRIs, facilitating risk workshops and preparing risk profiles and reports. You have experience in process management, implementation of governance and controls, and operational risk management oversight.
 The analytical and technical skills. You have advanced Excel skills. You have critical thinking and problem-solving techniques and can quickly analyze large data sets to create reports.
 The project delivery skills. You have experience planning and delivering projects. You ask intelligent questions to obtain information, identify root causes, and determine solutions. You are highly organized, able to balance and change priorities, anticipate and respond to issues, and manage details.
 The interpersonal skills. You have outstanding professional written, verbal, and presentation skills. You can build trusting relationships within and across teams and confidently work with any level of stakeholder, influencing without authority. You have a genuine interest in understanding others, hearing their perspectives, and addressing their concerns.

 Why join?
 When you're a Canadian Premier employee, you're part of a hard-working, high-performing, bright-thinking, make-things-happen family. One that sees your potential on day one, challenging you to grow your unique strengths as you create a career filled with opportunity, collaboration and meaning. For our newest team members to our most tenured, we're committed to being an employer that supports the person you want to be, at work and outside of it. We're growing – and we want you to grow with us.
 At Canadian Premier, we know there's nothing more important than treating each other with respect, compassion, understanding, and dignity. Even though our family has grown over the years, we still maintain the entrepreneurial spirit that got us started. Watch this video to learn more about our core values and our Canadian Premier family.
 Be part of a fast-paced company that offers you exciting opportunities to advance your career while you contribute to helping Canadians build secure tomorrows.
 Many of the individuals who lead our team have an impressive tenure with us, and every single one of them will tell you, it's about the people—the people we serve and the people we work with. We're a small organization with flexibility, openness, and responsiveness; with the security and resources to continue to do our work in a way that makes the most impact on our customers.
 Be a part of a place guided by people-focused not profit-driven values: Communicate openly, be accountable, be curious, celebrate together as one family.
 This is a place that stands behind work-life balance, an accessible leadership team, transparent communication, and an atmosphere that can only be described as family-focused. We continue to promote an engaged work-life balance throughout the pandemic with initiatives that include virtual town halls, casual online coffees, mental health workshops and employee appreciation packages. The very nature of what we do – listening to our customers – is the foundation of how we collaborate, learn from one another, embrace diverse perspectives, and hold each other up.
 If you have the majority of the qualifications we're looking for and you're interested in joining the team, we encourage you to express your interest by submitting an application. Apply now.
 Canadian Premier is committed to providing a barrier-free work environment in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. As such, Canadian Premier will provide reasonable accommodations available to applicants with disabilities upon request during the recruitment process. Please contact hr@canadianpremier.ca for accommodation requests.

Securian Financial is the marketing name for Securian Financial Group, Inc. and its affiliates. Insurance products are issued by its affiliated insurance companies. 2020 Fortune 500 Companies List, May 2020.

 
VJ7WZlkDsJ

Title: Technical Solutions Analyst
Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Purpose:
 In advancing the Division of Students vision as Partners in Student Success, the Systems team within the Office of the University Registrar (OUR) collaborates tightly with University Information Technology (UIT) in the development, maintenance and user support of all student-facing and administrative student information systems to effectively enhance the student experience from student recruitment through to convocation. The Systems team supports and enables OUR functional partners (Recruitment and Admissions, Student Finance, Core Registrarial Services and Student Client Relations), Faculties and other university units to achieve their student service objectives through operational support and systems enhancements.Reporting to the Manager, Student Systems, the Business Analyst actively supports systems development projects to ensure on-time and quality delivery of systems solutions for the entire student lifecycle including recruitment, admissions, enrolment, scholarships and awards, student accounts, financial aid, registrarial services, academic scheduling, student records and convocation. The Business Analyst is knowledgeable in and provides support throughout the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) with a focus in delivering the most appropriate systems solutions to meet business needs. This includes participating in project scope definition, requirements gathering sessions and requirements prioritization discussions. The Business Analyst also supports requirements analysis, develops test scenarios and test cases according to approved test plans, executes test cases, performs activities in preparation for go-live, documents project artifacts including systems and data requirements, business processes, and project issues and resolutions. Another significant responsibility of the Business Analyst is to assist in the execution of transition plans to ensure successful operationalization of newly developed systems. The Business Analyst also actively participates in the discussions and their subsequent execution of improved project intake, planning and implementation methodologies within OUR Systems and UIT in order to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of our project delivery in support of student success.
  

Education:
 College diploma with project management, business analysis or communications as one focus area, or an equivalent of 2 years recent experience (within the last 3 years) working at York University and performing the same or similar tasks. This education equivalency is in addition to the experiential requirements outlined below. Or equivalent combination of 6 years of progressive training and experience in business analysis andsystems development projects supporting multiple business areas. College diploma in a technical discipline such as computer science, information technology, or engineering, or an equivalent of 2 years recent experience (defined as within the last three years) working at York University and performing the same or similar tasks. This education equivalency is in addition to the experiential requirements outlined below.
  

Experience:
 With college diploma, 3 years of experience in technical projects, systems development or systems maintenance
  

Knowledge in the complete systems development lifecycle and the various development methodologies including Waterfall, Iterative and Agile
Experience in gathering and documenting business requirements, process flows, data flows and test plans
Experience in the development and execution of test cases
Experience in using project and resource management tools such as MS Project, Jira, Basecamp and Confluence
Experience in creating process flow, data flow and entity relationship diagrams using a Unified Modelling Language (UML) tool such as Visio
Advanced skills in Excel, Access and PowerPoint


Skills:



Demonstrated experience in supporting systems development projects
Formal training in the requirements management lifecycle, business analysis and project management would be considered an asset
Strong analytical and interpretative thinking skills
Experience in delivering presentations to cross functional teams
Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills
Customer-focused, and demonstrated commitment to providing outstanding service
Knowledge in SQL
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and handle competing priorities
Share and live our divisional values: Respect, Excellence. Innovation, Collaboration, Accountability, Care and Inclusion


Additional Notes:
 Please note: This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credentials(s), or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview. Hours of work: Monday to Friday, 8:30 to 4:30. Summer: As above and per the Collective Agreement. Occasional overtime will be available. Is there any time during which vacation is restricted? Yes. Define the restriction: Vacation may be restricted depending on operational requirements. Reasonable advanced notice will be provided to staff of pending operational and project related restricted periods.
  


In order to be considered as an internal applicant, York University employees in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit must apply for jobs through the Employee Career Portal - YU Hire.

As per Article 12.02(f) of the YUSA-1 Collective Agreement, to be considered an internal applicant, employees in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit must submit the application 5 working days following the first day of posting. this is referred to as the 'Posted Date' on the job the posting. This applies to YUSA-1 internal and YUSA-1 Concurrent postings. Please refer to the 'Posting Intent' on the job posting.


If not filled by an employee in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit, employees in the YUSA-2 bargaining unit who have applied within the first 5 days from the 'Posted Date' will be given preference.


The University welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, including, but not limited to women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities (racialized), Indigenous Peoples and persons of any gender identity and sexual orientation. Title: Quality Analyst (Bilingual)

Title: Bilingual QA

Full Time
Willing to work on 24/7 shifting schedule, rest days, holidays, weekends and extended hours
Start Date: Immediate Need.
Language-French & English

· Ability to work in 24*7 environment
· Conduct daily/weekly Transaction Quality Audits
· Provide meaningful feedback and reporting to agents, team leads and management to guide improvements in agent coaching/training, documentation, resolution model, etc.
· Drive Quality and process improvement initiatives

· Flexibility and Availability for any ad-hoc business requirement
· Ensure Confidentiality, Availability and Integrity of Data. Should have the ability to spearhead a process from scratch

· Carry out Quality Initiatives Should have the maturity/experience to manage skilled resources
· Should have the required expertise and analytical skills to provide strategic process improvement inputs (Operational excellence)

Minimum 2 years of experience performing Transaction monitoring audits and providing feedback
· The candidate should have excellent problem-solving capabilities and lateral thinking skills

Technical Skills

· Language English
· Proficiency in MS Products (Excel, PPT and Word) along with other tools (Analytics, recording solutions etc.)
· Preferred skills (not required)
Ø Knowledge of SIX Sigma (Greenbelt or higher)

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Dental care
Vision care

8 hour shift

quality assurance: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Business Analyst - Hybrid Remote
Description:
Address: VIRTUAL59 - HomeRes - ON - BMO 
 







Job Family Group: 






Technology 
 

Digital Banking Platform experience is required 


Experience in a robust Agile environment is required 


Are you curious about technology? Do you thrive in a customer first environment? Are you ready to take a lead role in defining customer-focused solutions that meet real-world needs? We are a team of professional, passionate Business Analysts who deliver high quality solutions for BMO’s customer facing channels. We are looking for high-performing, passionate individuals who are ready to make a difference in the lives of our customers. 

Are you ready to join our team? 

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will act as the requirements management lead for medium-sized projects (Waterfall, Agile, or Iterative), working with your business partners to help clarify and formalize the project’s goals, objectives, and scope. You will plan, elicit, and document the business requirements to define new and/or enhanced products and services, and may provide advice on the functionality, applicability, and usability of technology solutions to support those requirements. 

What do you bring to our team? 
 Advanced Knowledge of Requirements Development and Analysis: 

Demonstrated ability to work on complex projects 
Strong knowledge and demonstrated use of various elicitation techniques 
Demonstrated ability to document requirements in the format applicable to the project (requirements documents, user stories) 
Ability to convey complex concepts visually that is appropriate to your audience 
Ability to clearly identify and articulate problems and potential impacts to scope, solution design, downstream systems, and other projects. 
Leads the development of requirements documentation for the project 


Strong Planning and Time Management Skills: 

Ability to create and execute requirements management strategies and plans 
Demonstrated ability to create accurate estimates for project milestones and deliverables 
Ability to manage competing priorities in a dynamic environment 


Strong Leadership, Consulting, and Relationship Management: 

Applies leadership through business analysis, acts as an agent of change, and shares accountability for the project outcomes 
Ability to manage scope and negotiate requirements on complex projects 
Builds and maintains productive relationships with project team and external stakeholders, working well in a team environment and managing conflict even in challenging situations 


Advanced Communication Skills: 

Ability to distill complex information and communicate in a way that is tailored to the needs of the audience 
Can traverse between detailed and high-level information, understand when each is appropriate and bring information to the level of detail needed for specific situations 
Ability to facilitate sessions with small to medium sized groups and lead meetings effectively, including with external vendors 


Strong Foundation of Business, Technical and Domain Knowledge: 

Ability to understand business objectives, define the business problem, and align solutions to reflect the needs of our customers in a complex business environment, including across geographies (e.g., Canada-US) 
Ability to assess and evaluate technical solutions from a business perspective with an understanding of data structures, data concepts, and data analytics 
Demonstrates ability to think like a customer and understands impact of technology changes to end users 
Ability to build domain knowledge through independent learning and research skills 


Additional Qualifications: 

Possesses a university degree/college diploma in a relevant discipline 
7-10 years of demonstrated experience as a Senior Business Analyst within a financial institution 
Solid business knowledge of the Finance/Banking industry 
Strong knowledge of SDLC methodologies: agile, scrum, Kanban iterative, waterfall 
Excellent MS Office Skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Outlook, Visio) 
Knowledge of Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence would be an asset 
Knowledge of banking systems including: Online and mobile banking systems, Branch/ Back office systems, CRMs such as Optimizer, Salesforce.com, Contact Centre systems such as Nuance, Genesys, Verint, Aspect, etc., would be an asset 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Sr Business Insights Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. 
We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data. 



Job Description

About this Role
 As an expert in data and analytics, you will provide in depth expertise, analytical interpretation, key insights and action items to your multi-functional business partners across the organization. Those insights will be brought to bear to enable informed and enabled business decisions enterprise wide or help to solve the increasingly complex business problems they face. 
In this role, TD will look to as a thought leadership as well as a leader in your space, coaching, mentoring, empowering and educating your peers to collaborate and bring TD into the future of banking.
 As a Senior Business Insights Analyst, you will: 

Apply understanding of respective business strategies to produce relevant and substantial data analysis to support business goals and objectives
 Develop analysis to illustrate business trends and identify areas of business opportunities
 Produce insights and recommend business actions to align with strategy and/or solve business problems
 Provide seasoned specialized knowledge, advice and/or mentorship to various business and working partners
 Execute on data requests accurately and within a timely manner
 Represent functional area as an analytics & insights professional and key resource; build positive and productive working partnerships
 Act as a bridge to translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domain
 Provides day-to-day support and delivery of analytics
 Work independently as the senior analyst/subject matter expert and may coach and educate others
 Considered an authority within a given area
 Oversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to end




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? 
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes: 
    
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
 Five (5) or more years relevant experience




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
