Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Job Brief
 We are seeking a Business Intelligence Developer to join our great team of IT professionals at Graymont. An innovative, technology driven, global leader in lime and limestone solutions that operates throughout North America and Asia-Pacific.






Canada - BC - Richmond





Business Intelligence Developer About Graymont:
 Graymont is a global leader in lime and limestone solutions. With operations across North America and Asia-Pacific, Graymont’s growing business focuses on technology and application innovation. Graymont’s Information Services department is instrumental in delivering on Graymont’s strategy, exposing employees to information, technology, and opportunities they might not see in other companies. Visit www.graymont.com to find out more.
 Role: We are seeking an experienced Data Warehouse, ETL, data integration, Business Intelligence and Analytics specialist to join a global team of IT professionals.
 This position will be based out of Graymont's newly renovated head office in Richmond, BC under a hybrid/flexible work from home and in-office arrangement
 This position reports to an Enterprise Applications Manager and is responsible to lead data engineering efforts in a team dedicated to delivering high profile BI, analytics, and data warehouse solutions to internal customers in an organization that highly values Business Intelligence systems. This position will have the opportunity to take part in all aspects of growing and enhancing a highly effective IBM Cognos Analytics based solution, built on a strong enterprise data warehouse foundation.
 This individual will work with subject matter experts to examine and evaluate information requirements across the organization and explore source business system data to understand what connections are needed to meet those needs using analytics. They will have a leading role to recommend, design and build the required ETL, data mart design, and BI solutions. They will also deliver support to end users in the organization about how to use various tools efficiently and effectively in fulfilling business objectives. This includes diving deep into business data to identify data sources and to provide new data-driven insights to challenging business problems.
 Primary Responsibilities:

Work with end users and experts to identify, create, design and deliver cubes, scorecards and reports according to requirements.
Coordinate the creation and management of reporting structures within the data warehouse.
Create models for new data warehouse development and/or changes to existing data stores.
Design and code ETL to populate the data warehouse with data from other enterprise applications.
Maintain and manage a robust set of nightly ETL processes, including regular data reject resolution.
Prepare and deliver recommendations or alternatives for improving processes in reporting systems across the organization.

Requirements:

Experience using IBM Cognos Data Manager, or other Enterprise Data Warehouse ETL Tools (such as IBM DataStage, Informatica PowerCenter, Microsoft SSIS, Alteryx, etc.)
Experience designing and enhancing dimensional data warehouse models across varying business topic areas.
IBM Cognos BI/Analytics, and Cognos Powerplay cubes (OLAP) or equivalent Business Intelligence systems.

We’re looking for a versatile candidate who has a variety of experience in many of these areas:

Hands-on experience designing, implementing, and managing ETL processes
Building data integration between a variety of systems
Supporting Enterprise Data Warehouse environments running on Microsoft SQL Server
Report writing, technical requirements analysis and data modeling.
Excellent analysis and data exploration skills to understand complex source application schemas and data.
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate within a distributed team across the organization.
Inquisitive nature, and strong business acumen, to work across a wide variety of topic areas and an ability make creative connections to identify and solve problems that were previous considered unsolvable.
Exposure to Oracle JD Edwards EnterpiseOne ERP system or data would be an asset.

Title: Program Manager - Business Intelligence
Description:
Are you someone who believes that a positive experience can make a huge difference in people's appreciation of specific companies, services or products? As customers ourselves, are we not delighted each time we have a pleasant experience interacting with a customer service department? Can you remember the best experience you had when in need of assistance? Did it influence how you felt about the company? Chances are, it did.
 At Coveo, our Technical Support team is on a mission to transform every situation into an enriching experience, one interaction at a time, so that Coveo employees, partners and customers can strive towards their desired outcomes. If this resonates with you, please read on.
 The mission
 Coveo Support is not your typical call center image that you might imagine when you think of support. We are not siloed into tiers (levels) of support. We are a team of specialists with great business and technical knowledge of the Coveo Relevance Cloud Platform . The Program Manager - Business Intelligence's mission is to oversee and manage the team's business intelligence program and ensure that we deliver world class service:

Work in collaboration with the management team to establish short, medium and long term strategy in terms of business intelligence.
Build reports and dashboards, for the Support Delivery team.
Identify trends, correlations and causations in Support data to optimize operations and overall customer experience.
Collaborate cross functionally with internal teams on business intelligence initiatives.

To do so, you will work with a team of professionals to ensure continuous improvements in employee engagement, internal collaboration and customer satisfaction.
 Sounds interesting? This is what it looks like on a daily basis!
 Once you are all settled in to start off the day (whatever that means for you: coffee, side chat with colleagues, etc.), here's what you'll be doing:

Meet with the rest of Coveo Technical Support leadership to identify strategic initiatives
Analyze data from various sources (operations, platform usage, CSAT) to identify overarching trends in service and customer experience and identify areas for improvement
Collaborate with the corporate Business Intelligence team on data architecture and requirements for the business unit
Work with the Technical Support Enablement team to understand improvement opportunities and how to best measure their impacts on operations and customer experience
Share findings with the Support leadership team to help shape and improve customer service and support delivery

A passionate strategist and overseer
 Coveo is a very fast-paced and dynamic company, meaning its management teams need to be ready to focus on building and improving team processes and dynamics, rather than maintaining them. This entails an ability to think of things at a high level and with a broad vision. This makes for an environment rich in challenge and stimulation and where one needs to have the flexibility to pivot quickly. Proven business intelligence experience in customer service and technical support departments is a definite plus, but the following will speak for you.

You have a strong interest in top edge technologies, especially proficient in SQL and dbt
You are no stranger to Snowflake.
You are qualified with Business Intelligence software / data visualization tools
You have experience building and maintaining data pipelines (we use AWS)
You are at ease interacting with business stakeholders internally and understand the business processes.
You have a strong understanding of Support/Customer Service processes
You have a solid understanding of Salesforce and its data model
You are a true believer in delivering enriching experiences
You are organized
Finally, you strive working in a fast paced environment, believe in teamwork and collaboration, and are strategically-minded

We have a fit?
 Send us your resume and convince us that you are a must-have rather than a nice-to-have. Join the #CoveoLife!

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by Health Canada, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.


McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by Health Canada, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.

 McKesson touche la vie des patients en œuvrant dans pratiquement tous les secteurs des soins de santé dans le but d’améliorer la santé en général. Chez McKesson Canada, nous créons un impact dans la vie de 12 millions de Canadiens, chaque jour. Nous distribuons plus de 35 000 produits à partir de 12 centres de distribution à 6 300 pharmacies de détail, 1 350 hôpitaux, centres de santé longue durée, cliniques et établissements de santé partout au Canada. Toutefois, nous sommes beaucoup plus qu'une entreprise de distribution. Nous avons automatisé 2 500 pharmacies de détail et distribuons annuellement plus de 100 millions de doses de médicaments grâce à nos solutions d'automatisation. Les fabricants, les fournisseurs de soins de santé et les patients comptent sur nous pour une gamme complète de services qui contribuent à la qualité et l'intégrité des soins de santé pour le bénéfice de tous.
 
 Chez McKesson, vous participerez à la création de produits et de solutions qui contribuent à la réalisation de la mission de l’entreprise, soit améliorer la qualité de vie et faire progresser les soins de santé. Travailler ici représente une occasion d’édifier une industrie qui est vitale pour nous tous.
 

Résumé du poste

 Relevant du gestionnaire principal, Gestion des données, l'analyste associé principal de la gestion des données assure la qualité, la cohérence, l'exhaustivité et l'actualité des données de référence en veillant à ce que la création et la maintenance des données suivent les processus établis. Sa responsabilité consiste à traiter toutes les demandes et activités liées aux données de référence dans toutes les unités commerciales. Dans ce rôle, on s'attend à ce qu'il effectue des analyses des processus d'affaires, identifie les écarts et les inefficacités et propose des solutions pour aider à rationaliser les procédures. Ce rôle nécessite des interactions avec des parties prenantes internes et externes de diverses unités commerciales.
 

Section A – Responsabilités spécifiques


Gestion des données


 Agit en tant que point de contact principal pour toutes les demandes de création ou de modification des données de base.
 Crée et maintient les données de base dans les systèmes MDM.
 Gère les informations critiques telles que les détails du contrat, les spécifications des articles, les prix, les substitutions, les abandons et les paramètres d'intégrité des données.
 Créer, analyser et agir sur divers rapports de validation pour assurer le contrôle des données de base.
 Travailler directement avec les parties prenantes internes et externes pour obtenir et valider les informations pertinentes des données de base et communiquer les normes et processus requis, en assurant la qualité et l'intégrité des données.
 Communiquer aux partenaires commerciaux concernés toute information pertinente reçue des parties prenantes internes ou externes.
 Assurer la qualité des informations du système, le référentiel de décisions et l'exactitude de son contenu.
 Signaler aux fournisseurs toute inefficacité liée aux informations sur les articles et les prix.
 Résoudre les problèmes techniques en établissant un diagnostic ou, le cas échéant, en collaborant avec l'équipe de soutien informatique concernée pour parvenir à une résolution.


 Section B - Responsabilités générales

 Autres
 

 Maintient une connaissance commerciale pertinente des processus de données de référence, des systèmes de MDM et des exigences commerciales.
 Résoudre les problèmes techniques en établissant un diagnostic ou, le cas échéant, en collaborant avec l'équipe d'assistance informatique concernée pour parvenir à une solution.
 Participe activement aux initiatives et aux projets de gestion des données de référence.
 Agit en tant qu'ambassadeur McKesson des valeurs de l'entreprise.


 Section C - Exigences du poste

 Éducation
 

 Baccalauréat en commerce ou en administration, gestion des données ou équivalence d'expérience en affaires.

 Développement personnel et compétences générales
 

 Bilinguisme (anglais et français) à l'écrit et à l'oral.
 Leadership démontré.
 Excellentes compétences en matière de partenariat.
 Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite.
 Capacité à collaborer avec divers niveaux de gestion et d'employés.

 Compétences techniques
 

 Expérience dans les domaines de la gestion des données, de l'analyse et de la création de requêtes, un atout important.
 Parfaitement bilingue, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral.
 Maîtrise des systèmes ERP et des systèmes de réapprovisionnement, un atout.
 Connaissance approfondie des produits MS Office (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project et Visio).
 Connaissance de SAP (un atout)

 Autres compétences et aptitudes
 

 Capacité à travailler dans un environnement dynamique en évolution rapide.
 Capacité à travailler au sein d'équipes multifonctionnelles.
 Souci du détail, tout en conservant un sens aigu de la synthèse et une capacité à synthétiser.
 Capacités d'analyse permettant la création d'un état d'esprit favorisant l'innovation.
 Esprit d'équipe.
 Capacité à travailler efficacement avec peu de supervision

 McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 17 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.
 
 At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
 

Job Summary

 Reporting to the Senior Manager, Data Management, the Sr. Associate Data Management Analyst assures the quality, consistency, completeness and timeliness of the Master Data information by ensuring the creation and maintenance of the data follows established processes. Their responsibility is to process all Master Data requests and activities across all business units. Performing business process analyses, identifying gaps and inefficiencies, and proposing solutions to help streamline the procedures is expected in this role. This role requires interactions with internal and external stakeholders from various business units.
 

Section A – Specific Responsibilities


Master Data Management


 Acts as the main point of contact for all requests for creation or modification of Master Data.


 Creates and maintains Master Data in MDM systems.
 Manages critical information such as contract details, item specifications, pricing, substitutions, discontinuations and data integrity parameters.
 Creates, analyzes and acts upon various validation reports to ensure control of the Master Data.
 Works directly with internal and external stakeholders to obtain and validate relevant Master Data information and communicates the required standards and processes, assuring data quality and integrity.
 Communicates to applicable business partners any relevant information received from internal or external stakeholders.
 Ensures system information quality, decisions repository and its content accuracy.
 Reports supplier non-compliance on any inefficiencies related to item and pricing information.
 Solve technical problems by establishing a diagnosis or, where applicable, working with applicable IT Support Team to reach a resolution.


 Section B – General Responsibilities

 Other
 

 Maintains relevant business knowledge of Master Data processes, MDM systems and business requirements.
 Solves technical problems by establishing a diagnosis or, where applicable, working with applicable IT Support Team to reach a resolution.
 Actively participates in master data management initiatives and projects.
 Acts as a McKesson ambassador of corporate values.


 Section C – Position Requirements

 Education
 

 Bachelor of Commerce or Administration, Data Management or business experience equivalence.

 Personal Development and Soft Skills
 

 Bilingualism (English and French) in writing and speaking
 Demonstrated leadership.
 Excellent partnering skills.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills
 Ability to collaborate with various levels of management and employees.

 Technical Skills
 

 Experience in the fields of data management, analysis and query creation a strong asset


 Perfectly bilingual, both written and spoken.
 Proficiency with ERP systems and replenishment systems an asset.
 Extensive knowledge of MS Office products (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project and Visio).
 Knowledge of SAP (an asset)

 Other Skills and Capabilities
 

 Ability to work in a rapidly changing dynamic environment


 Ability to work as part of multi-functional teams.
 Attention to detail, whilst maintaining a strong sense of summary and ability to synthesize.
 Analytical capacities allowing the creation of a state of mind favoring innovation
 Team player.
 Ability to work effectively with little supervision

 Career Level – IC – Professional – P2
 

Worker Type
 Fixed Term (Fixed Term)

Title: Product Information Analyst - Pricing & Web
Description:
Product Information Analyst - Pricing & Web
 

   Status:
  Regular, Full time
 

   Location:
  Montréal, Quebec
 








          Job Description
        








   Reporting to the Director of Product Information Management (PIM), the Product Information Analyst shall maintain and ensure integrity of all information received from suppliers, which includes but is not limited to:
  

Updating manufacturer price lists
Product information management into our InRiver platform (PIM).




   MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
 



     Information Management Products:
   


     Update our InRiver Product Information Management (PIM) platform;
   


     Collect key attributes and specifications on the IDW platform;
   


     Communicate with suppliers for photos, descriptions and specifications of new products or even search the web as needed
   


     Enrichment of products in our product information management platform (PIM)
   


     Organize and maintain company web taxonomy;
   


     Propose taxonomy modernisations for an optimized web navigation experience.
   


     Suggesting layout improvements for an optimal navigation experience
   


     Analysis, creation, modification and correction of product data integrity in our ERP and PIM database
   


     Updating manufacturer price lists:
   


     Price list validation through internal procedures;
   


     Build price matrixes using spreadsheet when necessary;
   


     Communicate with partners to gather missing information;
   


     Perform macros and Excel advanced formulas for price management;
   


     Write and organize product descriptions in both languages (French and English).
   



   QUALIFICATIONS:
 



     Bachelor degree in administration, completed similar studies or College degree with proven expertise;
   


     Strong skills in sorting data on spreadsheets (Excel) and using Office Suite;
   


     Bilingual (French and English spoken and written);
   


     Organized, self-sufficient, resourceful and oriented towards tangible results;
   


     Understanding B2B business related to electrical product distribution, an asset;
   


     Mathematical and/or computer skills on data management
   



   Advantages :
 

 Flexible work hours
 Fair profit sharing
 Dynamic and proactive team
 High growth industry across the country



   What’s in it for you
 

   Voted Great Place to Work®, you can build an interesting and challenging career with possibility of advancement as well as continued personal and professional development. Guillevin has always given its employees the opportunity to develop their autonomy, professional skills and competencies. By joining us, you will integrate a team of motivated, competent, and engaged team players. Our Total Rewards package focuses on our human capital to create an environment where our employees can reach their full potential.
 

   What we offer:
 

A fast-paced, dynamic, empowering and friendly work environment open to today’s reality.
Competitive salary and participation in our generous profit-sharing program that recognizes the individual contribution of our employees. There is no limit to your ingenuity; you are encouraged to create, improve, learn and surpass yourself.
Flexible benefits program where you can choose the benefits and levels of coverage that are right for you:




     Health, dental, paramedical & vision care, and prescription medication
   


     Short- and long-term disability benefits because you never know what the future holds
   


     Supplemental Health Insurance
   


     Life insurance
   


     Employee Assistance Program (EAP) with Telemedicine
   


     Travel Insurance
   


Reimbursement of training expenses to acquire new skills and advance your career within the organization
RRSP with generous employer contribution
Possibility of contributing to a TFSA with a favorable group rate
Post-graduate scholarship program for children of our employees
Employee discounts on purchases
Free parking
Electric vehicle charging stations in many of our locations



   Guillevin ensures equality in the recruitment and selection process by making employment decisions based on qualifications, relevant experience, knowledge and capability, demonstrated skills and accomplishments.
 

   We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.
 

   The masculine gender is used solely to simplify the text.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Indigenous Health, DARE
Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.

 In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.
 



   The Senior Business Analyst is an integral part of the team responsible for providing leadership and analytical support for planning, monitoring and reporting on health system performance across PHSA programs with focus on Indigenous Health. Additionally, the role provides application support for adjunct applications and business intelligence tools. This role is responsible for providing leadership in business process reengineering concepts and methods and leads the analysis and documentation of business requirements on DARE projects as well as ongoing enhancements to the provincial and national health care data system.
 



   The Senior Business Analyst will lead the planning, analysis, design, and documentation of business requirements for data standardization, ad-hoc queries, reports, and interfaces. The position will have a deep understanding of Indigenous Health workflows and programs and will support operational and clinical program leaders in the development of reports related to business/operational planning, data interpretation, and data integrity and quality of the available data. In addition, this role will require broad systems understanding of PHSA priorities around Indigenous Health reporting requirements to facilitate and support planning.
 

   PHSA upholds the Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act and the work of Governments in cooperation with Indigenous Peoples to establish a clear and sustainable path to lasting reconciliation. Reconciliation is an ongoing process and a shared responsibility; PHSA is committed to creating opportunities which implement the Truth and Reconciliation Commission Mandate.
 



 What you’ll do


Leads program services planning and performance monitoring focused on Indigenous Health through the development of reports, direct data extraction and analysis. Provides specialized knowledge, analytical, and technical expertise in information management processes utilizing a deep understanding of data standards in relation to establishing quality reports.
Leads the formal data sourcing and analysis to help identify system deficiencies and/or operational inefficiencies in order to report and develop new ways of improving health care efficiencies with focus on Indigenous Health including the data analysis related to business case developments, project proposals, and other key strategic and transformative initiatives.
Ensures the quality, accuracy, reliability, and timeliness of the data and reports available through meticulous testing, automated and manual data reviews, performance monitoring, contingency planning, consistency reviews, and other methods as appropriate.
Leads in the analysis, criteria definition, development, testing, training, implementation and maintenance phases of assigned projects. Carries out post-implementation reviews and makes recommendations for improvements.
Provides analytical support for strategic planning and change management services for the Indigenous Health initiatives.
Leads the analysis, design, and documentation of reports, and interfaces to support planning, operations, management and evaluation reporting for Indigenous Health projects. Collaborates with other project team members as needed. This includes gathering requirements from stakeholders; negotiating changes in the context of the vision of the current and future state, defining appropriate change management strategies and monitoring and supporting best practice in documentation standards.
Leads the analysis, requirements specifications, and documentation of various business intelligence solutions, collaborating with PHSA, RHA and FNHA leaders and other project team members as needed. This includes gathering requirements from stakeholders; negotiating changes in the context of the vision of the reporting solutions; translating user requirements to technical requirements for implementation; designing reports; researching solutions; and implementing change management procedures. May occasionally take direction from a Project Manager on large projects.
Supports PHSA executives and senior program leaders with reporting requirements through the analysis of data with a deep understanding of performance metrics and benchmarking for Indigenous Health.


  Pursuant to section 41 of the British Columbia Human Rights Code, preference will be given to applicants of Indigenous Ancestry. We invite applicants to self-identify within cover letter and/or resume.
 



 What you bring


A level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Master’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Health Information Management, Business Administration or related discipline and five (5) years of experience in health information management, health services planning, or data analytics and use of reporting tools.
Knowledge and appreciation of the unique history, cultures, and rights of Indigenous Peoples in Canada is required.
Demonstrated ability to relate effectively to a variety of people from diverse backgrounds.
Demonstrated knowledge of Canadian colonial impacts on Indigenous people in social and health contexts, supported by significant knowledge of Canadian and Indigenous ideologies.
Lived experience with Indigenous populations and demonstrated extensive knowledge of Indigenous health care needs, services, and issues as well as knowledge of culture, protocols, traditions, and ideology of Indigenous people and organizations in British Columbia is an asset . This role requires a superior degree of critical-thinking and analytical skills with the ability to integrate broad system thinking/perspective with data to develop quality reports, operational support plans and monitor on-going performances.
This role also requires superior written skills with a high degree of producing concise, structured and very well written documents and reports.
Understanding of the Systems Development Life Cycle and project management methodology. Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to express complex ideas in simple terminology appropriate for the audience.
Demonstrated ability to use Analytics tools, spreadsheets, word-processing, presentation tools and other software at an advanced level.
Knowledge and adherence to privacy and confidentiality policies and measures to protect data. Ability to work as a member of a multi-disciplinary team, while working independently to organize workload, set priorities, and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment.
Ability to use query- and report-writing tools is an asset.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the job.


What we bring




   Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
 

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.


Job Type: Regular Full-Time
  
Location: 1333 West Broadway, Vancouver BC V6H 1G9
  
Closing date: Until Filled
  
Hours of Work: 08:00-16:00 Monday-Friday
  
Requisition #: 129881E
 



 What we do




   The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.
 



   Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services
 



   PHSA is committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Title: Attendance Management Analyst
Description:
Posting #:
    

21851




     Openings Remaining:
    

1




     Full/Part Time:
    

Full Time




     Reg/Temp/Casual:
    

Temporary




     Union:
    

Non-Union




     Hours of Work:
    

Monday to Friday; days




     Time of Day:
    




     Shift Length:
    




     Open Date::
    

28/06/22




     Closing Date::
    

12/07/22





Temporary Assignment - approximately 52 weeks   POSITION SUMMARY: This position is responsible for monitoring and analyzing attendance metrics to identify where to focus efforts for attendance improvement within departments and organizationally. Through an analysis of attendance data and other relevant reports, and in consultation with managers this position will be able to provide support and insight to managers to determine root causes for attendance issues, promote best practices and make recommendations to achieve attendance goals utilizing the Attendance Support Program (ASP).

 QUALIFICATIONS:


Bachelors degree in Business or Human Resources required, CHRP designation is preferred
Minimum 3 years Human Resources experience as a generalist or experience in attendance management or equivalent experience analyzing data in a similar role
Demonstrated analytical skills, understanding of metrics, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
Advanced ability with Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel and Word
In-depth knowledge of payroll systems
Knowledge of attendance management programs, practices and related issues
Knowledge of Short/Long Term Disability, Return to Work, HOODIP benefits and sick banks
Knowledge of relevant collective agreements, legal and arbitral jurisprudence and statutory requirements.
Strong decision making, critical thinking, listening skills, analytical and problem solving ability
Innovative and results oriented approach to work with the ability to plan, prioritize and management concurrent projects
Ability to work effectively in both a self-directed and team environment
Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and management



 RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Some responsibilities include the following:
   

Regular analysis of sick time and any other relevant reports to identify root causes in departments or job classifications experiencing higher than average sick time
Assist and coach managers on the ASP, including orientation of new managers or presentations to managers on the Program
Participate in ASP reviews as per the revised policy and make recommendations for improving the ASP or any processes related to attendance management and promotion
Assist line Managers and ER/LR staff with strategies to handle complex cases as needed and establish close links and good working relationships with Managers, occupational health, unions and ER/LR staff
Respond to attendance stage progression related requests from managers or Human Resource staff for specialized reports, data, documentation and/or analysis
Oversee the ASP in accordance with the Attendance Support Policy including distributing stage letters, entering exclusions, and tracking stage meeting compliance
Complete Ontario Hospital Association (OHA), benchmarking, and hospital surveys in regards to attendance metrics
Other duties as assigned


 HOURS OF WORK: Monday to Friday, days. Hybrid remote work available.  PLEASE NOTE: Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
 St. Joe’s fosters an environment where we celebrate diversity, where teams reflect the diversity of the community in which we serve, enhancing the connection to patients, clients, community, and each other.

Title: Business Analyst: Technical Requirements
Description:
Introduction
 Are you looking for a career that will allow you to use your unique blend of business acumen and tech savvy? Business Analysts at IBM are subject matter experts that build the bridge between our business and our clients, immersing themselves into the market to understand problems and find innovative solutions. Be ready to navigate the complex relationships that make the business world run and find the actionable insights that result in great business decisions.
  

Your Role and Responsibilities
 IBM Consulting helps our clients fundamentally redesign experiences to create new sources of value, digitally reinvent their operations for great efficiency and transform their entire enterprises through cognitive. We invite you to consider joining IBM's global reach, outcome-focused methodologies, domain skills and deep industry expertise that are helping transform the way we live and work.
   IBM's state-of-the-art Client Innovation Centre (CIC) opened in Nova Scotia in March 2013 and is the first of its kind in Canada. The Centre weaves together IBM’s business insights and industry-leading software portfolio and is ideally suited for any client that needs flexible access to emerging or niche skills that may not be cost effective to grow internally. In addition, our focus on our team is unparalleled as demonstrated by the following:
  
 The CIC NS is one of IBM’s highest performing delivery centres worldwide – for retention, client satisfaction and utilization. Our employees are empowered to stay and grow within IBM.
 We are very focused on continuous skill development – staff training is our third largest annual Centre investment. Employees are immersed in a culture of learning and constant growth.
 Investment in key partnership with universities, government and private sector groups which has resulted in IBM having a key influencing role in Nova Scotia’s ICT industry, especially in talent development.

 As a Business Analyst-Technical Requirements at IBM, you'll team with some of the best minds in the industry to create innovative high quality solutions focused on clients' business needs. You'll do this using your knowledge and expertise to design and model processes, develop solutions, and integrate them with applications.
  
 Analyzes and documents business requirements utilizing process models, use cases, etc. to translate business requirements into system requirements in a legacy/ mainframe environment that could include COBOL, CICS, IMS, MVS, PL1, SQL, TSO/ISPF, VM.
  
 To deliver business results this specialization has the following responsibilities:
  
 Understanding the needs of multiple stakeholders.
 Facilitating the negotiation of requirements amongst multiple stakeholders.
 Identifying the current- and future-state business processes.
 Helping the business stakeholders envision the future and how their work will need to change to support the future.
 Technology responsibilities include:
  
 Webservices and API Skills
 Must have a concept of code
 Creating, analyzing, and validating detailed functional specifications.
 Facilitating design sessions with the implementation team to define the solution.
 Delivering elements of systems design, including data migration rules, business rules, wireframes, or other detailed deliverables.
 Problem Solving
 Incident Management
 ITIL (preferred not necessary)
 Customer Service experience desired
 Very strong written & communication skills
 Prior ticket management experience desired. 
Additional Skills to have:
  
 Understanding of Business models (capability/ service, Process models).
 Retail Banking experience.
 Should have worked on channels


 Required Technical and Professional Expertise


 At least 5 years experience in Business Analyst Technical Requirements


 Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise


 At least 7 years experience in Business Analyst Technical Requirements

 Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.
 



 About Business Unit
 IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.
 



 Your Life @ IBM
 Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.
  
 Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.
  
 It's time to define your career.
 



 About IBM
 IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.
  
 Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. 
  
 At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.
 



 Location Statement
 This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, and the Crimea, Luhansk and Donetsk regions of Ukraine) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.
 



 Being You @ IBM
 IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Position Profile: 
 
 Come join our Analytics and Business Insight team as a Senior Business Analyst, specializing in Financial Analysis and Program Performance as we work together to deliver compassionate care that is responsive to the healthcare needs of our community.

 Humber River Hospital is committed to revolutionizing patient care for our diverse community. We are looking for exceptional individuals to join our great team: people who share our passion to deliver excellent, patient-focused, expert care. The Hospital is formally affiliated with both the University of Toronto and Queen’s University.
  
 At Humber River Hospital, Analytics & Business Insight plays a pivotal role in understanding the business and analytical needs of the hospital, identifying, tracking, analyzing and making recommendations for corrective action to financial/statistical utilization issues; while ensuring the hospital is meeting all external and internal reporting requirements. As we continue to grow our operations, we are seeking a Full-Time Senior Business Analyst to join our team.
  
 Are you looking to join a progressive Analytics & Business Insight team and have accountability for providing sound and timely financial and business information to the Clinical Programs and Senior Leadership team? If you answered yes, we invite you to read the requirements below and apply to this exciting career opportunity at Humber River Hospital. 
  

Reporting Relationship: Manager, Case Costing and Utilization. 
  
Schedule Requirements: Must be available to work Monday to Friday. 
  
Location: Wilson Site 
  
Employee Group: Non-Union
 

 Position Responsibilities:



Provide sound and timely financial and business information to the Senior Leadership, Program Leadership and Clinical Leadership
Prepare annual budgets and operating plans in collaboration with internal stakeholders 
Regular monthly analysis of budget and utilization variances (e.g. financial results to Board of Directors)
Apply Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)/Public Sector Accounting Standards and Management of Information Systems (MIS) standards to recommend appropriate accounting entries for the accurate recording monthly financial results
Review monthly actual vs. budget results; follow up on significant variances, and determine appropriate action; refer highly complex issues to Manager/Director for resolution
Evaluate the reasonableness of financial and statistical data; provide recommendations for changes to processes and procedures to enhance financial/statistical reporting, utilization and/or efficiency
Provide clients managers with a single source for interpretation of case costing financial and statistical information
Develop and analyze statistical reports of key information (i.e. statistical, financial, payroll, etc.) that improve data flow and support data driven decision regarding Health Based Allocation Model (HBAM), and other government funding regulations and legislation
Develop, maintain and distribute custom financial/statistical reports, Review current report designs and update as required to ensure compliance with current reporting requirements
Disseminate, interpret, and develop utilization data and financial information to program and service areas and external reports (e.g. MOHLTC); prepare financial reports for MOHLTC Central Local Health Integration Network (LHIN) to meet regulatory or funding agencies requests
Develop and analyze annual planning for LHIN submissions (e.g. mental health Community Annual Planning Submission (CAPS), Hospital Accountability Planning Submission (HAPS)) for Board of Directors approval
Examine charted (coded) data from patient sectors (e.g. length of stay, etc.) to identify and communicate trends and issues to health records and clinical and operational managers; determine resolutions to the issues, and document issues and their resolution
Report on compliance with departmental strategic plan; monitor achievement of quality performance goals and objectives aligned with organizational priorities
Maintain Finance, business intelligence, and other analytics and business insight tools and systems to deliver required information (e.g. assumptions, proposals) and measure and evaluate progress
Keeps informed about current and emerging healthcare statistical and financial standards, issues and trends, including technological changes
Share knowledge and expertise in performance reporting and monitoring
Drives initiatives to improve our financial and analytics and business insight processes and procedures, improving our data quality and reporting compliance. 
Other duties as assigned including participating on special committees, assisting with onboarding and training of other departmental staff and leaders to meet financial/statistical reporting and documentation support requirements. 



Qualifications:



Successful completion of a university degree in accounting, economics or business administration, health informatics or health administration is required, Masters preferred
CPA designation required
Minimum 5 years related experience in a healthcare environment
Working knowledge of Canadian information management standards such as the MIS Reporting Standards, workload measurement systems and methodologies, patient-specific case costing methodologies (Ontario Case Costing Initiative) and health information databases such as Med2020
Excellent project management skills
Superior ability to organize, analyze and evaluate data, both quantitatively and qualitatively
Strong skillset in MS Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, and modern BI Tools
Strong understanding of the nature of health information and its processing, application and impact within the industry.
Good knowledge of large computerized Financial reporting systems
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Self-starter with ability to motivate and focus team on tasks and projects
A strong ability to influence change among various levels of leadership.
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent attendance and discipline free record required.


 Why Humber? Why Now?

 Humber River Hospital is on an exciting transformation journey of redefining patient care as we leverage the most advanced technologies to enhance all aspects of delivering high-quality, safe care. We continue to build a people-centered workplace with excellent staff and physician engagement by hiring passionate, diverse and inclusive healthcare professionals. People who care and live our values of Compassion, Professionalism and Respect. People who are committed to making a positive difference.
  
 We are a Studer Group hospital, focused on building our evidence-based practice and hardwiring a culture that WOWs.
  
 Why? Because at Humber River Hospital, we know it’s our people and our ability to innovate that allows us to consistently deliver a great patient experience and the best quality outcomes. After all, we are the hospital that believes exceptional care...healthier community.
  
 This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by the employee within this position. However, the actual responsibilities, duties, qualifications and experience may vary. Employee may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. Information contained in this job posting/description is subject to change.
  
 This position will be filled in accordance with the non-union recruitment policies. 
  
 Humber River Hospital is committed to inclusion and diversity. We believe that diversity drives our culture of innovation. By bringing together a variety of different perspectives, it fuels our creative thinking, generates new ideas and creates solutions designed to address tomorrow's healthcare challenges today. We take pride in providing professional development and career advancement opportunities for our employees including minorities, women, veterans and individuals with physical and developmental disabilities. We also provide accommodation to applicants and all of our employees - from hire to retire.
  
 Let us know what we can do to help you be successful during your recruitment experience at Humber River Hospital.
 


 Please be advised that in order to be eligible for employment at Humber River Hospital, all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days prior to the hired employee’s first date of employment Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospital’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis

Title: HRMS Business Analyst - Temporary
Description:
Mission



Each student, in keeping with their individual abilities and gifts, will complete high school with a foundation of learning necessary to thrive in life, work and continued learning.
 Values
 Students come first. Learning is our central purpose. Public education serves the common good.
 Culture
 The CBE strives to create a dynamic, diverse, and collaborative culture. We value diversity and welcome applications from all qualified individuals.







 Competition Info



Competition Close Date: Tuesday, July 12, 2022 at 11:59pm
 Calendar: 12 month temporary
 Salary: SA Grade H - $39.48 - $48.82 per hour
 FTE: 1.0 - 35 hours per week
 This is a temporary position till September 2023.







 Position Description



Purpose

The purpose of this position is to provide business analytical services and support to the Calgary Board of Education (CBE) in the core functionality of the Human Resource Management enterprise System (HRMS). This position works with CBE’s current HRMS to identify technology capabilities to enhance HR service delivery to CBE clients. 

Accountability
 This position is accountable to:


Act as the primary contact for clients, SME’s, and technical support resources to manage day to day Enterprise HRMS requirements and to provide client groups with HR data from HRMS to assist with informed decision making.
Performs configuration changes within the system and works on system customizations with the Technical Business Analyst and Developer.
Participates in the design, testing, implementation and support of applications. Possesses a broad and in depth knowledge of the application and how it relates to corporate business processes and practices.
Assist in trouble shooting and resolving all system failures.
Work jointly with end-users to identify system inefficiencies and document requirements and specifications.
Assist users to effectively implement the technical solution through appropriate training, procedures and consultation.
Maintain and develop a well performing HRMS system by leveraging industry best practices for development, change control, version control, migrations, testing, standards, and procedures.
Elicit and document business requirements for system or process enhancements.
Create system testing scenarios and execute test cases to validate results against the requirements; including regression testing. Use automated testing tools to develop and execute regression testing where applicable.
Test and troubleshoot the processes and functionality of HR technologies and solutions.
Assist internal clients to leverage technology and modify existing processes in support of business needs.
Document technology and business process changes.
Participate in the implementation of CBE HR strategies as required.
Develop core competency with multiple PeopleSoft modules and exercise a thorough knowledge of CBE business processes.
Coordinate and execute system processes to support the operation of the interdependent modules of Enterprise HRMS, which includes talent acquisition manager, payroll, time & labour, benefit administration and multiple inbound and outbound interfaces.
Define query and report requirements to extract information for decision makers from the HRMS.


 Major responsibilities

Maintain expertise in the core functionality of the Enterprise HRMS technology, and the HR application architecture.
Work jointly with end-users to identify system inefficiencies.
Support the development of functional business requirements by assisting CBE clients to clearly define requirements, rules, and processes and document functional specifications, and assist Technical Business Analysts and Developers with design and implementation.
Provide first level application support in PeopleSoft, Smart Find Express (SFE) and Talent Hub for end users and resolve system and/or user errors.
Ensure technology and process designs support business process owner requirements. Conduct requirements gathering and fit gap analysis to leverage application capabilities with business requirements.
Scope customization requirements and complete cost benefit analysis for business owner consideration in decision making.
Apply configuration changes to Enterprise HRMS for department & location codes, job codes, salary grades, benefits, position data and any other table changes within PeopleSoft.
Work with the technical Business Analyst on requests for data loads and PeopleSoft customization requirements.
Understand and communicate technical issues related to defects and enhancements in PeopleSoft.
Ensures a consistent approach and drives continuous improvements in processes.
Coordinate all refreshes for PeopleSoft environments.
Provide relevant information to Service Providers in regards to the design, implementation, and operation of services.
Create and update functional specifications, completing quality assurance, preparing workplans, and coordinating with multiple departments for design testing and deployment.
Conduct thorough UAT integration and regression testing of the application.
Document procedures and guidelines related to information, technical or application environments.
Ensure correct business functionality, requirements and standards are followed in developing business process solutions, training, and troubleshooting.
Complete assigned analysis, consulting, design and programming projects/tasks within established guidelines and timelines including appropriate testing and documentation.
Track progress of new and updated HR processes, ensuring identified changes of both technical and operational requirements are documented and implemented.
Participate in project teams in the delivery of system enhancements.
Assist with task estimates and timelines as part of project planning.
Ensure effective communication, procedures and processes are maintained between CBE and the Service Providers to ensure seamless provision of HR information and services.
Determine report specifications to identify and extract CBE data requirements from the HRMS. Analyzes and manipulates data from HRMS and existing “data views” into database and spreadsheet applications.
Create queries to gather and extract data for investigation, design and testing.
Provide analytical support and assistance to users on matters relating to technology, new application ideas or existing applications for HR.
Manage Enterprise HRMS security administration and maintenance through coordinating amendments, additions and deletions through HRMS Security Administrator.
Serve as a resource on the application and functionality of the HRMS technology with regards to compliance with feasibility of proposed changes to collective agreements, terms and conditions of employment, CBE administrative regulations, legislation, and HR methodologies.
Works with the business to enforce and maintain a standard and best practice in PeopleSoft.
Performs other related responsibilities as assigned to meet the purpose and accountabilities of the role.


 Qualifications
 Education and Experience:

University Degree with 3 years experience supporting an Enterprise HRMS or a certificate in Business Analysis with 5 years’ experience supporting an Enterprise HRMS.
Experience with setup configuration and execution of PeopleSoft 9.1 or 9.2 modules, including implementation, design and customization.
Experience with continuous improvement or other project management initiatives; considered an asset.
Intermediate skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, MS Project and Visio).
Experience working in a large, multi-union, complex organization; considered an asset.
An equivalent combination of directly related education and directly related experience will be considered.

 Demonstrated Skills and Competencies:

Quality of judgment: Contribute to the achievement of strategic outcomes as they relate to the CBE Ends Statements and the service unit or department. Decisions or recommendations reflect a balance of high professional standards, best practice, and understanding of unique CBE staging requirements.
Professional currency: Stays up to date in field and is able to apply innovative solutions as appropriate.
Effective cross functional teamwork: Ability to achieve progress and results related to strategic initiatives and continuous improvement. Able to partner with senior organization leaders with the capacity to lead cross functional solutions.
Communication/Negotiation and Influencing skills: Excellence in communication, including writing, presenting and active listening skills. Strong negotiation skills with hands on experience/involvement in implementing changes in process. Comfortable dealing with confrontation and diffusing conflict without alienating others.
Technical Competence: Extensive knowledge of Microsoft software applications and familiarity with functionality and operations of PeopleSoft or other full service HRMS technologies. Ability to plan and report data information using in effective ways to meet customer requests.
Customer Service Orientation: Results driven, while being aware of and responsive to client needs and requests. Ability to manage expectations, prioritize work requests and communicate effectively. 
Analytical Competence: Strength in data analysis with attention to detail, statistical or quantitative methods. Strong problem solving and systematic thinking skills.
Project Management Skills: Strong focus on delivery of results and management of work.
Personal suitability.










 Conditions of Employment



Police Information Clearance: Applicants new to the Calgary Board of Education WHO ARE OFFERED EMPLOYMENT must complete and pass a police information clearance before employment is confirmed.









 Be Part of Our Success



Are you looking for an opportunity to join a team where your contribution makes a positive impact on the lives and learning of more than 125,000 CBE students? The Calgary Board of Education is looking for exceptional professionals to join our team. Our employees are highly valued and recognized, a career with the CBE offers incredible opportunities, rewards and supports.

 We thank all candidates for their interest in this position however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Digital Marketing Analyst
Description:
**To apply to this job, please submit your application directly to us through this link: https://careers.cathaypacific.com/jobs/digital-sales-analyst-2843871
Note that candidates must apply directly on our website using the link above in order to be considered. Applications submitted via Indeed will not be reviewed.
Company DescriptionLet your passion fly! We’re proud to be one of the world’s leading airlines. Our reputation is built on a long track record of success, an ongoing commitment to our home Hong Kong, and on the delivery of customer service that’s straight from the heart. All of this is possible due to our talented people who share our passion for aviation and our commitment to being the best. Our global family can open up a world of opportunities for you. This means that your first role at Cathay Pacific won’t be your last. It could take you anywhere. Join us and discover just how far you can go!
Role IntroductionCathay Pacific Airways is looking for a highly motivated individual to join the Digital Sales Team in Vancouver, BC. This Full-Time Digital Sales Analyst position is a multi-faceted role, the successful candidate will focus on developing and delivering reporting and analysis on our direct sales channel to support the digital sales team in the Americas. The role will also support regional digital sales campaigns and initiatives, broader marketing campaigns, social media and website content management.
This individual will be part of a close knit team that wear many hats but are very open and supportive of each other. Cathay Pacific is entering a period of recovery from the Covid-19 pandemic and while no two days will be the same you’ll be encouraged to find new ways of working and carving out best practice processes to add to our team’s effectiveness and efficiency.Key ResponsibilitiesKey Responsibilities and Tasks

Proactively collect and interpret daily, weekly and monthly data using all data tools available to provide consultancy and challenge to the digital sales team to ensure the channel is properly monitored, with areas of improvement identified.
Analyze and identify performance trends, historical patterns, user behavior and opportunities in the direct channel to highlight gaps to regional and head office teams.
Translate trends, patterns and opportunities into actionable items for the regional digital sales team.
Working alongside channel specialists, the regional leadership team, and regional digital sales team, conduct ad-hoc studies on potential new business needs and newly identified market challenges.
Define optimal regional data collection, reporting and analytical processes in close collaboration with regional business development team.
Become an expert on the suite of data analysis tools available to Cathay Pacific and mentor the wider team on their application and use.
Conduct comprehensive regional level analytics and proactively identify synergies between direct sales channel data and broader Cathay Pacific performance data/metrics.
Conduct tracking and measurement of direct channel KPIs and communicate to the broader team.
Conduct other reporting and analysis as required.
Support campaign activities for the region as needed, including but not limited to website content management, social media and partnership/vendor relations.

Emergency & Accident

Emergency and Accident and Crisis response responsibilities as required

Requirements

Diploma or certificate (in a related Sales, Marketing or Business field) is preferred
A minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in ecommerce or marketing data analysis
A minimum of 5 years of experience, preferably in aviation, travel, tourism is an asset
Expert knowledge of Excel and Google Analytics
Knowledge of Adobe Analytics, QlikView and QlikSense is an asset
Proficient user of Microsoft Office suite including Teams, Word, PowerPoint
Experience with Adobe Experience Manager (or any CMS) and Salesforce Marketing Cloud advantageous, but not required
Demonstrable experience in working in a campaign environment, understand timing and rollout in relation to timely reporting
Comfortable with a test and learn approach with a focus on continuous improvement
Good presentation, forward planning and time management skills
Must be self-driven with a passion for data analysis
Superior problem-solving and interpersonal skills
Effective verbal and written communication skills with an ability to adapt communication style to suit different audiences across our global team
Ability to travel 10% of the time (when global travel resumes)
Must be willing to work from San Francisco or Vancouver office as required
Must comply with the Company’s mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination policy
Must have the right to live and work in Canada

Personal & Application InformationCathay Pacific Airways Limited is committed to employment equity, supports diversity in the workplace and encourages application from all qualified individuals including women, members of visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes only. A copy of our Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request by contacting our Data Protection Officer.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Business Intelligence, Senior
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you. 















Working Arrangement 













Hybrid 
 
Job Description 
This position is responsible for developing a roadmap for the business unit reporting strategy and providing business insights through in-depth and thorough data gathering, scrubbing transformation and analysis. The role assists in developing standardized reports, dashboards, and self-service access to critical information for individuals about the business unit Program. This position is responsible for developing a roadmap for the business unit reporting strategy and providing business insights through in-depth and thorough data gathering, scrubbing transformation and analysis. The role assists in developing standardized reports, dashboards, and self-service access to critical information for individuals about the business unit Program. 

Key Accountabilities:  

Be partnered with users, product owners & data engineers to design, develop and maintain business intelligence solutions (dashboard & interactive reporting tools on crucial business measures) 


Work directly with business stakeholders and translate business data needs into technical requirements, design, and implementation thru data visualization. 


Develop, Test, and Maintain BI Dashboard to high quality and performance standards using the company-approved BI Tools. (e.g. Power BI, Qlikview, QlikSense, Tableau) 


To utilize UI/UX best practices to craft visualizations that create a single, aligned version of the truth, present clear information about business results & call for action. 


Responsible for collaborating with the team and assisting in setting up and implementing best practices to ensure the quality and consistency of the solutions. 


Flexible in working with medium to high complexity projects with the possibility of utilizing multiple BI tools for each solution. 


To provide and maintain user access, report connections, and troubleshoot by navigating to the management consoles or workspaces. 


Skills Requirement: 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or relevant experience with Business Intelligence. 


At least 5+ years of hands-on experience developing BI solutions, preferably with Power BI. 


Proven experience with customer management and project administration. 


Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. 


Ability to allocate time efficiently and handle multiple demands and competing priorities. 


Planning and organization skills, including the ability to prepare schedules and communicate the status of the overall development effort. 


Ability to work independently and act professionally at all times. 


Adaptable to teamwork and dynamic work environment. 


Technical Skills: 

Experienced with BI technologies (e.g., Qlikview, QlikSense, Tableau, Power BI) 


Pertinent Experience in Data Modelling and Data Model normalization 


Solid Understanding of the ETL methodology. 


Strong knowledge/proficiency in relational databases (MS SQL, Oracle) and business intelligence. 


Understanding of design and development tools, SDLC methodologies and techniques, preferred 


Curiosity and analytical mindset – ability to ask the right questions and propose solutions. With solid evidence of being able to transform data into actionable insights. 


Experience in working in agile (SCRUM) is an advantage. 


Project management experience preferred 


Adept data storytelling and visualization – proficiency in creating solutions that align not only with the business requirements but also the company’s branding. 


Process Specific Knowledge: 

Software Development Life Cycle 


Business Solutions Discovery 


Data Modelling and Normalization 


Agile/Scrum Methodology 


Tools Specific Knowledge: 

Intermediate to Advance Expertise in any of the following BI Tools: 


Power BI 


Intermediate Qlik Management Consoles / Power BI Workspace Management 


Familiarity with Tableau 


Intermediate MS Excel 


Familiarity with NPrinting or MS Reports Builder 


Basic to Intermediate Expertise in the following relational databases: 


MS SQL 


MS Access 


Enterprise Data Lake 


Familiarity with MS Power Applications 


Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today. 

About John Hancock and Manulife 

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com . 

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Title: Price, Promotion & Trade (PP&T) Analyst
Description:
LG Electronics is looking for a Price, Promotion & Trade Analyst in our Sales Finance Management Department. This role will contribute to assist in the day to day operation to ensure the sales goals and objectives are met, while supporting the needs of both LG and its customers alike. 


PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES:


Manage pricing and promotion data and reporting tool.
Promotion data supporting to sales and sales finance management team.
Provide sales program support.
Manage RFPs by bid number and simulate expected costs for bids, prepare proper budget accordingly, and update and maintain bid information in Claim portal.
Update and maintain sales planners for Key Account Managers, including PSI and pricing data.
Assist with new product launch activities.
Investigate market trends and competitors’ behaviour in the market.
Maintain Power BI dashboard for market insights based on NPD monthly result.
Maintain Python web scrapping tool for online price tracker.
Ensure data accuracy for sales strategy and planning.
Support sales pricing and promotion simulation.
Ad hoc analysis required.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:


Bachelor degree or above & 2-4 years' experience in Financial analysis, Forecasting or Sales data analysis
Advanced Excel & Power Point, Power BI, VBA, Python
Detail oriented and good at handling data
Good organization skills and able to multi-task
Ability to work on multiple projects in a fast paced environment with tight deadlines
Time management and superior communication skills

Nice-to-have:


Budgeting and Planning experience
Experience of ERP systems
Business to Business (B2B) experience

 The organization offers an attractive compensation package that encompasses a competitive salary and excellent benefits.

Title: Sr. Sales Analyst (Fixed-Term Contract)
Description:
Job Description : 
Celebrating life, everyday, everywhere is our purpose at Diageo 

OUR TEAM 

Diageo is a global leader in beverage alcohol with an outstanding collection of brands across spirits and beer, including Johnnie Walker, Guinness, Tanqueray, Captain Morgan, Cîroc, Baileys, Smirnoff, Bulleit, Ketel One and Don Julio! We have over 200 brands—old and new, large and small, global and local—sold in 180 countries. 

Come join us on our journey to achieve our ambition to become one of the best performing, most trusted and respected consumer products companies in the world! 

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING 

Diageo is a spirited company with an entrepreneurial spirit and determination

REQUIREMENTS

BONUS POINTS

Fluent in French and English

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
The Dealer Analysis team is accountable for ensuring the financial risks of the Dealer network to the Corporation are identified, monitored and mitigated, where possible. The team analyzes various Dealer financial metrics and provides insights to senior management where trends and opportunities exist. The team works closely with various cross functional teams such as Real Estate, Finance, Legal and the Store Support group. 
What you’ll do 

Analyze Dealer financial statements, identifying trends and bringing items forward for review and escalation, if required. 
Build models and data mining techniques which help assess the overall health of our Dealer network performance 
Provide regular reporting/scorecards to stakeholders across the company where aggregate Dealer information and/or analysis are required. 
Develop key reporting tolls using MS Access, MS Excel and VBA code of a solid understanding of operating system architecture. 
Develop and maintain internal databases. 
Act as the Dealer Analysis data steward with specific attention placed on ensuring Dealer Contract governance rules are upheld. 

Who you are 
We are looking for individuals who are: 

Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment 
Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business 
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business 
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward 
Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong 
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be. 

What you bring 

5+ years of professional experience demonstrating advanced analytical abilities 
Post-secondary education (Finance, Business or IT undergraduate degree preferred); accounting designation is an asset 
Superior computer knowledge (SQL, Excel, Access, Powerpoint) 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
#LI-GG1 


  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Store Support & Operations
