Title: Analyst, People Analytics
Description:
COVID-19 Information 
ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. 
Always there. Anywhere. That’s us! We are committed to delivering inspired solutions for a better world. We care about our communities, we care about each other, and we care about showing up for those who need us. We value and encourage different perspectives and we have the courage to do the right thing, even when it’s hard. 
Employer Descriptions: 
We’re looking for someone who cares about their work and strives for more each day. Someone who challenges the status quo, embraces change, and thrives in a collaborative work environment. If you are someone who approaches work with passion, curiosity and the courage to innovate, then this role is for you. 
We are looking for an Analyst, People Analytics to join us in the exciting work we do in HR Systems and People Analytics Team. It’ll be your responsibility to provide customer service to the Human Resources Leadership Team, Business Partners, and other HR COEs by gathering workforce related data from multiple internal and external sources for the ATCO Group of Companies to create data reporting and analytics to help inform decision making and provide actionable support to key stakeholders within HR and in the operations. 
What You Get To Do: 

Strategic Thinking – Lead Us Higher 
Responsible for people analytics infrastructure, including scaling, building and evolving the current HR analytics capability to provide a uniquely positive experience for employees through their lifecycle journey as well as defining the strategy and building out the key functions in the people analytics space. 
Identify and define specific people analytics, forecasting and reporting needs, select and access the most appropriate data sources, and produce easily understood, statistically sound and accurate analytical products for the ATCO Group of Companies. 
Differentiate the highest value metrics to provide human capital metrics and analytics that enable stakeholder understanding and response to meaningful trends in the workforce. 
Stay current with trends in People Analytics and find enhancement opportunity in terms of practice, process, technology, governance etc., and provide input to shape the long-term vision of People Analytics. 
Analytical Thinking – Technical Savvy and Business Analysis 
Perform in depth analysis to identify trends and/or causal relationships to provide relevant, credible and actionable recommendations. 
Apply strong working knowledge of HR systems and the application of HR data to various HR customers and their unique requests. 
Utilize BI / Data Visualization tools and techniques (e.g. build reports & dashboards) to translate analysis into an insightful and relevant data story. 
Conduct external market research on workforce related data (e.g. trend, process) and identify areas of growth and risk in relevant external industries. 
Develop predictive models to better understand the driving factors of critical HR and business issues and translate them into forecasting tools (e.g. – probability of success in new roles, identifying employees at risk of leaving, factors driving engagement and culture, etc.). 
Customer Focus – Client Support & Business Acumen 
Partner with HR COEs, business stakeholders and HR Leadership team to prepare workforce related materials that enables HR to effectively assist business leaders in improving business performance. 
Provide oversight on end-to-end project management in business requirement gathering, pre-development analysis, design & development, UAT, deployment and ongoing reporting support or maintenance. 
Collaborate with HR client groups on ad hoc reporting requests driving the requirement gathering process, designing queries, creating reports, obtaining needed data and providing analysis to enable data driven decision making. 
Provide recommendations and support to HR COEs and Business Leaders to deliver HR materials and/or reporting solutions. 
Data Governance and Compliance – Enhance Data Integrity & Protect Our Information 
Ensure reporting and data management standard as well as apply the ‘need to know’ basis for end users. 
Participate in the on-going HR Data Governance meeting to discuss issues around data integrity and assist in formulating or executing solutions. 
Participate in Reporting & Analytics COEs community to ensure reporting standard as well as the handle of confidential and/or personal data is following ATCO’s data policy. 
Maintain HR data permissions and accesses on monthly basis and partner with internal/external auditors as needed. 
Operational Excellence – Efficiency & Effectiveness 
Manage complex weekly, monthly, and quarterly Human Capital reports, metrics and dashboards for the ATCO Group of Companies. 
Consolidate data, performing in-depth analyses and interpretation/evaluation, summarizing results and key trends, updating materials, and preparing reports and presentations. 
Analyze and profile large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets with a variety of tools. 
Continually review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing tools and processes for data collection, analysis, reports, and dashboard and develop strategies for enhancement. 
Support ATCO’s People Analytics activities by maintaining the integrity of the human capital reporting, dashboards and scorecards. 

Who You Are: 

Minimum of an undergraduate degree in Business, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or related discipline 
Minimum 5 years’ progressive experience in the area of information analysis, including building data modeling and analyzing complex quantitative and qualitative data involving business plans, human capital, and economics 
Strong BI and HR systems knowledge (e.g. Oracle HCM / OTBI preferred, and PeopleSoft, Workday, SAP/Success factors considered as asset). 
Experienced with data visualization tools such as Microsoft PowerBI with ability to create data models, DAX (data analysis expressions), KPI metrics, role level security setup and training materials 
Experience with delivering end-to-end analytics solutions or programs to HR COEs or Business Leaders while managing expectations, timelines and communications 
Knowledge of statistical programming applications such as R or Python is considered as asset 
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Projects and SharePoint. 
Strategic thinker with the ability to identify and prioritize the right KPIs and metrics. 
Strong query writing and usage, familiarity with statistical analysis, data visualization, and data cleansing tools and techniques 
Ability to analyze, interpret, synthesize and communicate complex information to technical as well as non-technical stakeholders in a logical and concise manner 
Ability to diagnose system problems related to data collection and data retrieval through research and discussion with users and then develop and implement effective solutions to resolve the issues 
Strong communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills with the ability to present findings in a clear and professional manner, both verbally and in written reports 
Exceptional work ethics, with the ability to work independently, see competing priorities through to completion, on time, and with a high level of quality. 
Is a team player; willingness to help in all other aspects of work, including those outside of core responsibility 


We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted. 
CU Inc. is part of ATCO Ltd. ATCO delivers inspired solutions for a better world. We are a diversified global corporation with investments in the essential services of Structures & Logistics, Utilities, Energy Infrastructure, Retail Energy, Transportation and Commercial Real Estate. Learn more about how we build communities, energize industries and deliver customer-focused solutions like no other company in the world at www.atco.com . ATCO is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Visit our website for more information.

Title: Senior Business Analyst (BHJOB13022_12273)
Description:
Senior Business Analyst (Reporting Development exp) – Permanent position in Vancouver:
 

 On behalf of our client in Vancouver, Ignite Technical Resources is looking for a Senior Business Analyst (Reporting Development exp) with the client for a permanent opportunity.
 


 Role Description:


   The Senior Business Analyst, Security Access Data and Reporting (SADR) analyzes business needs and develops overall strategies for how automated systems can be used to support the short- and long-term direction of the business.
   The incumbent will provide expertise and leadership in the areas of requirements definition, business process definition, business process analysis and design, functional design, configuration, implementation, testing, training, facilitation and documentation to deliver enterprise solutions to the university community. The position may manage the entire lifecycle of sub-projects which includes developing a project plan, coordinating the activities of a project team, identifying appropriate resources needed, and developing schedules to ensure timely completion of the project. This role will also manage staff directly including performance appraisals and mentorship of junior team members.
 


 Responsibilities:


 Leads the assessment of client needs by utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to identify business priorities and recommend options.
 Conducts workflow and gap analysis for operational support processes.
 Performs data analysis and data modeling as required.
 Engage business stakeholders, clarifying and document business requirements and translating them into technical requirements
 Engage technical stakeholders to transmit technical requirements, ensuring proper understanding of the required outputs, including data mappings, test cases and others.
 Acquires and maintains a working knowledge of the university's technical and business environment
 Understands and applies business architecture concepts to analysis to ensure strategic alignment with organizational goals, outcomes and business value.
 Conducts comprehensive and in-depth feasibility studies for projects and enhancements.
 Provides guidance and leadership to less-experienced individuals on the team.
 Identifies integration, security, scalability and performance requirements.
 Provides direction and best practices for functional team business analysts supporting the technical teams for data conversion, reporting and integrations
 Provides direction and best practices for workflow and gap analysis for enterprise business processes, analysis and identification of requirements for data, reporting and integrations
 Supports the project following appropriate project management methodology including gathering and defining project requirements, developing project plans, and schedules, identifying staffing requirements and forming project teams
 Develops and maintains a productive working relationship with project sponsors, vendors, key stakeholders other project teams, including technical teams for data conversion, reporting, security and integrations
 Works with multiple vendors to foster effective working relationships in order to ensure alignment with project goals and deadlines
 Develops user test cases and validates test results during user acceptance testing and system acceptance testing, operational acceptance testing.



 Requirements:


 8+ years of Senior BA exp (including 2 yrs of leadership exp) with Report Development and Data Modeling exp
 Demonstrated knowledge and proven experience in producing BRDs, use cases, user scenarios, user stories, and BPMs working experience on enterprise-wide projects.
 Knowledge of business process re-engineering improvement.
 Knowledge of data analysis and data modeling (conceptual, logical).



 Nice-to-have:


 Experience with classical reporting tools (Crystal Reports, etc.) and visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI) is an asset.




   Due to the volume of resumes, only those candidates being considered will be contacted.
  


   Based in Vancouver and proudly Canadian, Ignite Technical Resources has been providing Top Technical Talent to organizations across Canada since 2005.
  


   Ignite. Wired for people.
  


   Follow Ignite on Twitter @ignitetechnical and become a fan on Facebook for up-to-date information about our company including job postings!
 


About Ignite Technical Resources.:


Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Vancouver BC, Ignite Technical Resources has been the preferred IT Staffing provider for many of Canada’s largest and well-known organizations for over 15 years.By specializing in Information Technology, we ensure that our processes are focused exclusively on providing qualified IT Professionals and our commitment to speed ensures your teams and projects are staffed quickly and efficiently. Our years of experience provide us with one of the most well-developed networks of candidates in the Canadian market. Come see why Ignite Technical is one of Canada’s premier providers of IT Professionals On-Demand.Ignite Technical Resources – Your Source for Top Talent

Title: ECommerce Brand Advocate Analyst
Description:
The Position:

 The Brand Advocate Analyst for assigned supplier brand is responsible for creating and executing the supplier project strategy, generating and presenting analytical data, and providing insightful digital content findings to propel the brand’s conversion online. The Brand Advocate Analyst is also responsible for developing strong supplier relationships, executing against quarterly action plans and effectively communicating successes / progress within the account. The Brand Advocate program is a unique vendor funded model that provides brands the ability to leverage dedicated in-house Home Depot Canada associates to perform and expedite white-glove content enrichment initiatives.
  

Responsibilities:
 EXECUTE PROJECT STRATEGY 
 

Complete data maintenance tasks in digital content systems to drive account strategy

Title: Modelling/Forecasting Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

What does TD stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and for almost every department, that begins with data.
 As part of our Data and Analytics team, you'll be a fundamental part of crafting business processes enterprise-wide by analyzing vast amounts of past and present data. 
TD's vision for the future? Tailored, customized banking products, services and experiences for every single customer. If you've been in business as long as we have, you know there's no such thing as one size fits all, and a diverse, inclusive Data Analytics team is a massive part of that future achievement.



Job Description

About this Role
 With a burgeoning career as a forecasting analyst, you abide by a key philosophy: the more data the better. Good thing TD has vast amounts of it to parse – as in petabytes. You will join a team of data specialists who create complex data models. You will support numerous data analysis functions across the enterprise including data modeling, visualization, data profiling, report design and other specialized data management functions. TD will look to you to assess our current data capabilities and identify (at a high level) the data requirements for a broad variety of business needs. To meet those needs, your team will propose data management solutions based on industry gold standard methodologies and trends. As your career grows, so does your own drive to learn and enhance your own expertise.
 We are looking for someone to provide strategic technical planning on an innovative team of data specialists, using complex, industry-leading tools to support our business processes through descriptive and predictive modelling.
 As a Modelling/Forecasting Analyst you will: 

Work with data specialist to assess current capabilities and identify high-level business data requirements 
Analyze identified data quality issues against source system and existing data quality capabilities to confirm the source of the data quality 
Work under general guidance of Data Specialists or Managers to identify, design, develop and support data management solutions for the bank 
Work with IT to deliver on data requirements 
Understand the banks source systems, data and metadata 
Work on TD platform to deliver data solutions required for analytics and modelling solutions 
Continuously enhance knowledge / expertise in own area and keep current on emerging trends /developments and grow knowledge of the business, analytical tools and techniques 
Prioritize and manage own workload to deliver quality results and meet assigned timelines 
Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest 




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Tell us about your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes: 
    
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate 
Three (3) or more years relevant experience 




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.



Job Family

    Advanced Analytics & Modelling 
   


Job Category - Primary

    Enterprise Data & Analytics

    Enterprise Data & Analytics

    35

    50 Boulevard Cremazie West, TD Centre - TD Tower - 66 Wellington Street West Insurance

    12-Jul-2022

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Engineer
Company: Pathways to Education Canada/Passeport pour ma reussite
Description:
ORGANIZATION: Pathways to Education CanadaPOSITION: Senior BI EngineerREPORTING TO: Director, Business IntelligenceLOCATION: Toronto, ON or Montreal, QC (Hybrid workplace)WEBSITE: www.pathwaystoeducation.ca
Senior Business Intelligence Engineer, Pathways to Education Canada
We’re looking for someone who can change the paradigm for Canadian youth living in poverty. Someone who enjoys building partnerships, making an impact, and working with energetic, high-performing teams. Is that you?
Pathways to Education is a national, charitable organization breaking the cycle of poverty through education. Its award-winning program is creating positive social change by supporting youth living in low-income communities to overcome barriers to education, graduate from high school, and build the foundation for a successful future. Through the collective power of partnerships, Pathways to Education’s innovative program is preparing youth for tomorrow.
The Opportunity
As a member of the Business Intelligence (BI) team within the Finance and Operations department, you will play a key role in developing the organization’s BI infrastructure to execute on its data strategy. By collaborating with a variety of business stakeholders to identify their business needs, you will design data models, BI assets, dashboards, and reports to contribute to data-driven decision-making for Pathways Canada.
As the successful candidate, you are passionate about data and how it can be leveraged by organizations to empower their analytics. You have strong technical skills and a customer service focus to support non-technical business users in understanding the root of their requirements and developing BI solutions that fully meet their needs. You bring exceptional problem-solving skills and want to make an impact in a small team in support of young people across Canada.
What You’ll Do

Collaborate with business and IT teams to design dimensional models that represent business processes.
Design and build data models, views, BI semantic layers, and BI assets for governed reporting and self-service data discovery and analytics.
Engage in workshops with various business stakeholders to understand underlying business requirements for new reporting and analytics use cases, and develop dashboards and reports that fully meet their needs.
Conduct source data analysis and profiling to complete source-to-target mapping.
Develop, implement, and monitor data pipelines to maintain a high level of service and data quality.
Support the development and implementation of a data quality monitoring framework with departmental data owners and stewards.
Supervising of staff in maintaining data governance documentation.
Strategic planning of BI infrastructure, including budget analysis, identification of technical requirements, and providing business case recommendations.

What You Bring 

A minimum of 5 years’ in-depth business reporting and analytics experience.
Post-secondary education or training in Engineering, or Computer Science is an asset.
Deep understanding of data structures and schemas.
Extensive experience and skills in Business Intelligence, Data Architecture, and cloud-based technologies (especially within the Azure technology stack).
Advanced knowledge of Power BI functionalities, administration, design, and implementation.
Advanced working knowledge of SQL and DAX scripting.
Experience working in an Agile environment (developing stories, prioritizing tasks, and backlog grooming).
Quick to understand business needs and learn domain-specific knowledge.
Excellent communication skills.

What We Offer

An exciting opportunity to be part of a leading not-for-profit dedicated to excellence and impact.
A collaborative work environment with a culture of innovation.
Opportunities for learning and professional development.
Competitive salary.
Generous vacation and health benefits package.
Group RRSP program.

To confidentially explore this opportunity, please submit a cover letter and resume with the subject line ‘Senior BI Engineer’. Applications will be accepted until 5pm on July 17, 2022. Pathways Canada thanks all applicants for their interest. Due to volume, only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.
Pathways to Education Canada is committed to fostering a diverse work environment, one that is inclusive of different races, ethnic origin, citizenship, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, ages, family status, disability status, and intersectional identities. All interested candidates are encouraged to apply and advise us of any accommodations or supports needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process.
Pathways is committed to ensuring the health and safety of its staff, visitors, and community partners. Accordingly, to be considered for employment with Pathways, candidates must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, in accordance with provincial guidelines, and provide proof of such vaccination at any time during the recruitment process as required by Pathways, subject to accommodations necessary pursuant to the Quebec Charter of Human Rights and Freedoms, the Human Rights Code, and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Pathways will comply with all applicable privacy legislation.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today. 

About John Hancock and Manulife 

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com . 

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com . 

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

Title: AML Watchlist Analyst (Mandarin/Cantonese)
Description:
Address: 100 King Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Customer Shared Services 
 
The AML Watchlist Analyst will conduct investigations to identify, assess, decision and report on activity that indicates an exposure to financial crimes. Ensures potential threats and investigations are evaluated, documented, managed and escalated by following standard operating procedures. Provides subject matter expertise and oversight of criminal risk by following a disciplined and intelligence-based approach to detection and research of activities and events in alignment with criminal risk frameworks and standards to ensure compliance as well as support trending, analysis and insights generation. 


Provides input and develops recommendations for process and customer service improvements. 
Stays abreast of financial crimes risk trends, relevant regulations and compliance standards. 
Monitors and analyzes various information provided through detection systems, tools, reports, or manually to evaluate, investigate and determine required actions. 
Supports the collection of evidence and information to be used for multiple purposes including incident reports/filings, loss prevention, litigation and criminal prosecution, management information and statistics, and process improvements. 
Documents actions and information found throughout the investigation to develop and maintain account/case files. 
Develops and maintains an understanding of the financial crime management processes, frameworks and techniques. 
Gathers and formats data into regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. 
Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations. 
Executes routine tasks such as service requests, transactions, queries etc. within relevant service level agreements. 
Provides notification, information and instructions to internal/external stakeholders related to incidents as necessary. 
Completes complex & diverse tasks within given rules/limits and may include handling escalations from other employees. 
Analyzes issues and determines next steps.

Specialized knowledge.

Title: Pricing Analyst (Actuary)
Description:
Pricing Analyst (Actuary) (m/f/d) * 



Primary Objectives:
 The Pricing Analyst conducts qualitative and quantitative data analysis to assist in pricing and rating new and existing products, as well as in identifying new business opportunities, in order to facilitate the Company planning process.
 Located at our Head Office in downtown Toronto, reporting to the Director-Underwriting, and as part of the Corporate Underwriting Team, the role will contribute to Pricing Projects, using actuarial models and innovative approaches. Projects are varied and include development of rating structures and monitoring/reporting on overall rate adequacy. This role, will have exposure to rating in both personal and commercial property lines with valuable career development potential. It is an ideal position for an innovative thinker with a problem solving mindset, who is eager to learn and grow.
 Job Responsibilities:

Apply pricing components and rating methodology to price existing and new products based on thorough statistical analysis.
Provide actuarial support in the development of new products and services to achieve successful implementation of approved strategic initiatives.
Provide actuarial and statistical analysis related to rate adequacy, including loss and premium trends, production of rate indicators and development of rating structures.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders such as Treaty, Regional Offices, Digital Distribution, New Solution Development and Claims to support their needs for pricing, data processing, analysis and mining of data and reporting.
Provide on-going review and improvements of pricing and processes for greater automation, accuracy and rate adequacy.
Drive and deliver the existing projects and contribute in various pricing projects. Projects are varied and include development and implementation of rating structures and pricing models.
Measure, Track and Monitor Products performance. Analyze market changes and emerging trends affecting pricing and profitability of the products and make recommendations on rates to management with supporting documentation to ensure strong profitable revenue growth.



WE OFFER 
Driven by technology and fueled by innovation, HSB is Canada’s premier specialty insurance and applied technology services provider. Offering 150 years of technical and service excellence, we are focusing on emerging trends and unlocking new opportunities for clients. Today, we are accelerating, changing the future of insurance and risk solutions, for a modern world.
 At HSB, we value the strengths and contributions of our diverse workforce. We offer continuous learning opportunities, giving you flexibility to grow in your career while enjoying a healthy work-life balance and a collaborative approach in our coast-to-coast network of offices. Become part of a rewarding and impactful workplace experience while seeing first-hand technologies and risk solutions that are changing the way we live and work.
 HSB is much more! It’s insurance. Engineering. Technology. To learn more about us, please visit: www.hsb.ca


WE EXPECT 
Qualifications:

University Degree in Actuarial Science, Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Computer Science.
3-5 years of relevant experience in a similar role with the ability to apply actuarial methods to develop insurance rating and pricing structures, compile, analyze, present and translate findings from analytics to concrete suggestion for business opportunities and to facilitate decision making.
Advanced programming knowledge and data processing abilities (using tools such as MS Office, Power BI and languages such as VBA, SQL), deep knowledge of databases, analytics tools and experience with data cubes.
Strong analytical and Problem-solving skills and looking for efficient, automated solutions.
Organizational and time management skills to prioritize workloads and multiple projects and meet time sensitive deadlines with high degree of accuracy.
Ability and desire to learn and adapt quickly to a changing and fast-paced environment.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills in effectively working within a team and collaborating with several business partners.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
P&C and Insurance analytics experience including a strong understanding of earned premium, incurred claims, loss development and deriving loss costs is an asset.
Strong team player, able to contribute in a collaborative environment.
A positive, professional attitude is essential for this role.







Creating and maintaining a work environment that promotes respect, diversity and dignity is important to us. We strive for equality in our workplace, to eliminate employment barriers, and promote a workplace based on principles which align with our company values and promote positive employee practices. Candidates requiring accommodation during any stage of our selection process should advise us of this; we will strive to work with individuals to find a suitable means to meet their needs.
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however only those selected for interview will be contacted.

Title: Customer Care Systems Analyst
Description:
Provident is a leading Energy Services Company (ESCO) in the Greater Toronto Area. Provident specializes in the multi-residential market with an emphasis on high rise condominiums.
 

 Provident is committed to generating substantial energy savings through energy management systems and monitoring, individual metering and billing, energy consulting and energy retrofits. The Provident Team includes engineers, certified energy managers, and building systems engineering technologists among other disciplines. Provident supports our clients with years of experience and state-of-the-art expertise. The Customer Care Systems Analyst will support reporting, data analysis, business process improvements, and cost reduction initiatives pertaining to Customer Service and Collections functions. The Customer Care Systems Analyst will be the internal expert of the contact management software, Five9, managing queue design. The incumbent will also be responsible for enhancing process and technology to achieve high service levels through automation while being sensitive to the customer experience. This role requires a unique blend of customer service experience and technical skills to effectively drive the required activities.
 

 RESPONSIBILITIES


 Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:
 



 Develop and maintain Standard Operating Procedures and Business Continuity Plans for all functions related to Customer Service and Collections



 Collaborate with key internal and external stakeholders as required to resolve issues or identify and implement opportunities that improve operational processes



 Provide expertise in data analytics and management reporting services to support Customer Care performance management, including goal/incentive tracking




 Summarizing and interpret customer contact volume trends by leveraging our contact centre management software, Five9, to support staffing plans




 Work with internal and external stakeholders to improve web design, including automated forms integration with Provident’s billing system Cogsdale



 Project manage process and system change implementations for Customer Care, developing formal project plans and documentation of all user testing



 Drive process efficiencies through automation



 Proactively identify customer interaction risks and opportunities to improve the customer experience
 Maintain in-depth understanding of industry trends and regulatory changes, ensuring Customer Care business processes are designed to comply with the OEB Sub-Metering Code and privacy legislation
 Contribute to the annual budget and quarterly forecasts processes as required
 Any and all other duties as assigned to meet Company objectives.

 CORE COMPETENCIES

 Adaptability
 Problem Solving
 Initiative
 Team Work
 Dependability
 Communication
 Organization Skills



 REQUIREMENTS


 University degree in any quantitative discipline (eg. Business Administration, Engineering, Computer science)
 Three (3) years’ experience in utility or telecommunication sectors
 Solid knowledge of collections and customer services practices
 Analytical mindset to process information logically and deliver value added analysis
 Strong project management and planning skills
 Knowledge of the OEB Sub-Metering Code, The Consumer Protection Act, and privacy legislation would be an asset
 Knowledge of relational databases and associated programming languages would be an asset
 Proficient in customer-facing systems including web design, contact management software (Five9 is preferable) and utility billing software
 Excellent organizational and time management skills with strong attention to detail
 Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing



 Cricket Energy Holdings Inc. and its subsidiaries have created policies and procedures to meet the required Accessibility Standards under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. 2005.


 
Our Accessibility policies are available in a number of formats. Should you wish access to these documents, please email: 
aoda@cricketenergy.com

Title: Sr Business Intelligence Engineer
Description:
UserTesting® was founded in 2007, crossed $100M in revenue in 2020, and began trading under USER on the NYSE in 2021. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, California, with regional offices in Atlanta, Edinburgh, and Singapore. A trusted company by top brands for 14+ years, UserTesting has over 2,500 customers in 45 countries including more than half of the world's top 100 most valuable brands according to Forbes.
 A leader in video-based human insight, we believe the path to human understanding starts with shared insight—seeing and hearing how another person engages with the world around them and taking in their perspective. We're for capturing the kind of human responses that don't show up in a spreadsheet. This is what inspires us, and it's how we enable companies to connect with their audiences, authentically, through an experience that's uniquely, and intentionally, human.
 We're proud to have been named to the Inc. Best-Led Companies of 2021 and the Fortune Best Workplaces in the Bay Area 2021 lists, along with having received a variety of additional workplace and corporate growth awards. Choosing to join our team means being part of a passionate group focused on transforming the way companies understand their customers and build better products and experiences. Come join us and help us build the engine for human understanding!

 About the Team
 The Business Intelligence (BI) team is responsible for the key metrics that inform the company strategy. We work closely with both the senior executive team and operational leaders to build an integrated metric framework, which gives us insight into the health of the company's core activities. This is an ever-evolving process that requires a deep understanding of the operations of each department and the ability to measure the most important leading and lagging indicators of performance.
 We are an analytical and open-minded team. The breadth of our work requires us to be flexible collaborators as we switch gears across our many initiatives. We scale the impact of our work by taking a process-driven approach. We invest in building repeatable metrics and business processes that are robust enough to forecast our long-term business health as well as address the ad-hoc opportunities of the day-to-day.
 About the Role
 The Sr. BI Engineer will be responsible for working with functional teams to understand their reporting and data needs and then delivering required information using the appropriate corporate tools. You will play a key role in defining, compiling and then providing valuable insights through reliable and accurate metrics.
 The Sr. BI Engineer will be owning, designing, developing, documenting, and managing scalable solutions for new and ongoing business metrics, reports, analyses, visualizations, and dashboards to support business needs using tools like Snowflake, DBT & Tableau. You will design data models that help build functional data marts along with optimizing the performance of business-critical queries and dealing with data transformation job related issues. You will manage the key reports and datasets the BI team uses to measure the company's health. Beyond ensuring the validity and timeliness of this data, the role will be responsible for curating dashboards and metrics that will guide the strategic focus of the team.
 As UserTesting continues to grow, the Sr. BI Engineer will be responsible for anticipating reporting needs of the company and enhancing our reporting processes accordingly. This will require strong leadership and collaboration skills as we pioneer our future state and drive alignment across our partner teams.
 Responsibilities

Responsible for building and delivering day-to-day reporting and dashboards for various functional areas including finance, HR, legal, product, operations & executives etc.
Work with functional areas to gather reporting requirements, identify data gaps, highlight enhancement opportunities and propose adequate solutions.
Extracting and combining data from various heterogeneous data sources
Designing, implementing and supporting a platform that can provide ad-hoc access to large datasets
Utilize internal and external data & systems to establish an understanding of customer behavior and engagement.
Support and contribute to BI team knowledge base through focusing on documentation, data mapping, delivery methods and areas of improvement.


Modeling data and metadata to support ad-hoc and pre-built reporting
Continuously improve the future state of our reporting process by collaborating with our Business Systems, Data Engineering, and business partner teams
Work closely with other members of the BI team to better design and build metrics that enhance our analytical capabilities
Provide statistical analysis on critical company data to derive insights
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources, data points, and data gathering techniques

Qualifications

4+ years of experience in an analytical business operations and data engineering role, preferably at a technology or high-growth company
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or related fields
Hands-on experience writing complex SQL queries for data analysis and DBT data modeling skills
Functional domain knowledge of finance, HR, legal, sales, product & operations. Good understanding of external financial reporting is nice to have
Good understanding of SOX compliance and internal controls for a public company
Experience using Tableau or other visualization tools
Background in statistical analysis using Python is a plus
Demonstrated experience building and maintaining key company dashboards
Comfortability working with large data sets across multiple sources, which map to complex business processes
Meticulous attention to detail and an intuitive understanding of data validation
Strong communication and organizational skills to collaborate with multiple stakeholders and drive an outcome
Ability to successfully managing and delivery on shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment with strong time management skills


 To learn more about our team, culture, and customers, check out our careers page, company blog, and press/awards. Aside from a great work environment and the opportunity to make an impact, we're also growing the team quickly–join us!

 UserTesting will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, as applicable. Title: Enterprise Business Analyst - Fiix Software
Description:
About Fiix
 Fiix is on a mission to build better maintenance teams by connecting customers to the tools, resources, and technology they need to join the future of maintenance. We help our customers drive better business outcomes with easy-to-use, AI-driven maintenance software, an open ecosystem, pre-built integrations and the industry expertise they need for maintenance success. Creating positive social impact is baked into our company DNA, and as one of Canada’s previous awardees Best Workplaces previous awardees, we’re transforming an industry and doing it the right way.

 Fiix was acquired by Rockwell Automation in December 2020. Our relationship with Rockwell gives us access to more resources, connections and expertise in the industrial automation space while maintaining our individuality and creative freedom as a high-growth SaaS company. This acquisition allows Fiix to offer the best of both worlds to our employees.

 About the team
 Our Fiixers are the key to our success. Our team is made up of professionals who bring together a variety of experiences, backgrounds and perspectives. We celebrate the diversity of our people and place a high value on creating an environment where everyone can bring their whole self to work.

 As a Fiixer, you will work in a caring and collaborative culture, alongside people who are passionate and purpose-driven. You’ll have the support and resources you need to grow, achieve your professional goals and develop your career for the future.

 In our fast-paced, high-growth environment, you’ll have the opportunity to work on challenging projects, develop your expertise and pursue leadership, within and outside of your role. Plus, there are tons of opportunities to make an impact! Take paid time off to volunteer in your community, join an employee resource group, or mentor other Fiixers. Best of all, you’ll have the flexibility to work remotely or come and experience our awesome office. No matter where you’re working from, we’re committed to ensuring that the Fiixer experience is best in class!

 We are hiring an Enterprise Business Analyst to join the Fiix Software Operations department within Rockwell Automation. Reporting to the head of the Enterprise Architecture Team, this critical role leads business transformation projects to optimize our end-to-end SaaS tech stack in a rapidly growing organization.

 In this position, you will be part of a dynamic team responsible for delivering enterprise cloud technology solutions. Wearing many hats on their projects and are responsible for everything from requirements gathering, systems configuration, testing, delivery and post deployment support. As an Enterprise Business Analyst, you will work alongside Enterprise Architect and Operations Team to design, develop, and deploy enterprise solutions particularly on Sales Cloud, E-commerce and Community, all while learning and growing your abilities in an agile environment.

 What you will do:

 Support gathering, understanding, and defining business requirements including demonstration of requirements traceability (RTM)
 Document future state business processes
 Write user stories for future state business processes
 Estimate work effort and build a business case for specific enhancements
 Conceives, proposes and facilitates the selection of viable functional solution alternatives
 Support System Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing
 Work with Business, Product Owner, Data team and QA to ensure built solutions meet stated requirements
 Oversees User Acceptance phase of initiatives (define strategy, plan, approve test cases, lead all aspects of execution).
 Provide support post Go Live
 Provide 3rd tier support for business applications and work with the IT/development team to resolve system bugs


 What we are looking for:

 2+ years experience as a senior system administrator, business analyst or solution engineer in the software industry, including 2+ years of experience on Salesforce, NetSuite or similar cloud-based implementations through the full Software Development Lifecycle
 Experience with Agile methodology
 Experience collaborating with business partners like Marketing, Sales and Finance teams
 Validated ability to leverage analytical and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment
 Strong presentation, communication (written and verbal) skills, and interpersonal skills
 Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio
 Ability to balance and prioritize numerous tasks within a collaborative team environment
 One or more Salesforce Certifications (Admin, Sales / Service / Experience Cloud, or Platform App Builder) preferred
 Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, information technology or related field preferred


 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans.

 If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at +1 (844) 404-7247.

Title: Pricing Analyst (Actuary) - Head Office
Company: The Boiler Inspection and Insurance Company of Canada
Description:
Driven by technology and fueled by innovation, HSB is Canada’s premier specialty insurance and applied 
technology services provider. Offering 150 years of technical and service excellence, we are focusing on 
emerging trends and unlocking new opportunities for clients. Today, we are accelerating, changing the 
future of insurance and risk solutions, for a modern world. 

At HSB, we value the strengths and contributions of our diverse workforce. We offer continuous learning 
opportunities, giving you flexibility to grow in your career while enjoying a healthy work-life balance and a 
collaborative approach in our coast-to-coast network of offices. Become part of a rewarding and impactful 
workplace experience while seeing first-hand technologies and risk solutions that are changing the way 
we live and work. 

HSB is much more! It’s insurance. Engineering. Technology. To learn more about us, please visit: 
www.hsb.ca 

Primary Objectives: 
The Pricing Analyst conducts qualitative and quantitative data analysis to assist in pricing and rating new 
and existing products, as well as in identifying new business opportunities, in order to facilitate the 
Company planning process. 

Located at our Head Office in downtown Toronto, reporting to the Director-Underwriting, and as part of 
the Corporate Underwriting Team, the role will contribute to Pricing Projects, using actuarial models and 
innovative approaches. Projects are varied and include development of rating structures and 
monitoring/reporting on overall rate adequacy. This role, will have exposure to rating in both personal and 
commercial property lines with valuable career development potential. It is an ideal position for an 
innovative thinker with a problem solving mindset, who is eager to learn and grow. 

Job Responsibilities: 

Apply pricing components and rating methodology to price existing and new products based on 

thorough statistical analysis. 

Provide actuarial support in the development of new products and services to achieve successful 

implementation of approved strategic initiatives. 

Provide actuarial and statistical analysis related to rate adequacy, including loss and premium 

trends, production of rate indicators and development of rating structures. 

Collaborate with internal stakeholders such as Treaty, Regional Offices, Digital Distribution, New 

Solution Development and Claims to support their needs for pricing, data processing, analysis 
and mining of data and reporting. 

Provide on-going review and improvements of pricing and processes for greater automation, 

accuracy and rate adequacy. 





Drive and deliver the existing projects and contribute in various pricing projects. Projects are 

varied and include development and implementation of rating structures and pricing models. 

Measure, Track and Monitor Products performance. Analyze market changes and emerging 

trends affecting pricing and profitability of the products and make recommendations on rates to 
management with supporting documentation to ensure strong profitable revenue growth. 

Qualifications: 

University Degree in Actuarial Science, Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or 

Computer Science. 

3-5 years of relevant experience in a similar role with the ability to apply actuarial methods to 

develop insurance rating and pricing structures, compile, analyze, present and translate findings 
from analytics to concrete suggestion for business opportunities and to facilitate decision making. 

Advanced programming knowledge and data processing abilities (using tools such as MS Office, 

Power BI and languages such as VBA, SQL), deep knowledge of databases, analytics tools and 
experience with data cubes. 

Strong analytical and Problem-solving skills and looking for efficient, automated solutions. 


Organizational and time management skills to prioritize workloads and multiple projects and meet 

time sensitive deadlines with high degree of accuracy. 

Ability and desire to learn and adapt quickly to a changing and fast-paced environment. 


Strong interpersonal and communication skills in effectively working within a team and 

collaborating with several business partners. 

Strong written and oral communication skills. 


P&C and Insurance analytics experience including a strong understanding of earned premium, 

incurred claims, loss development and deriving loss costs is an asset. 

Strong team player, able to contribute in a collaborative environment. 


A positive, professional attitude is essential for this role. 


Creating and maintaining a work environment that promotes respect, diversity and dignity is important to 
us. We strive for equality in our workplace, to eliminate employment barriers, and promote a workplace 
based on principles which align with our company values and promote positive employee practices. 
Candidates requiring accommodation during any stage of our selection process should advise us of this; 
we will strive to work with individuals to find a suitable means to meet their needs. 

If you are interested in applying for this position, please quote Job Reference PAA.0622-BW and please 
click the link: Apply here. 

We thank all candidates for their interest; however only those selected for interview will be contacted.

Title: Advanced Analytics, Senior Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

CTO Forecast Methodologies is part of CTO Corporate Data & Analytics, responsible for central ownership and analysis of the balance sheet and income Statement Forecast Methodologies for CCAR / EWST / MST.  The Canadian Line of Business Vertical team within CTO Forecast Methodologies is responsible for 

overall methodology designed to measure the Canadian P&C and Canadian Wealth balance sheet and income statement in stress testing and BAU Asset/Liability Management,
 Developing and justifying key non-modelled assumptions (i.e. held flat),
 Designing E2E aggregation processes,
 Integrates functional areas such as management of assumptions and input, reporting and analysis, and partners with Execution team for process simplification across balance sheet, income statement, and capital result
 Delivers multifunctional forecasting and reporting capabilities that could be leveraged for EWST/MST, ad hoc requests, and ultimately, supporting BAU forecasting functions
 Provide Transparency (inclusive of documentation) to modeling teams and business partners into how methodologies function.
 Ensures consistency across projections of different balance sheet / income statement line items




Job Description

About this Role
 The position will encompass a range of responsibilities with regards to CAD LoB Vertical team, specifically focused on the activities relating to the Canadian P&C and Canadian Wealth, stress testing and BAU forecasting, planning & analysis:

 Assist in the delivery of the overall Canadian P&C and Canadian Wealth Segment stress testing processes, models, documentation, and framework
 Participate in working groups and building relationships with partners including CAD P&C Finance, Wealth Finance, Corporate segment finance, Line of Business leadership and strategy team, Enterprise Capital Stress testing team, CTO (Data, Modeling, NII teams), Credit & Operational Risk teams.
 Develop deep understanding of the Canadian P&C and Wealth results.
 Liaise extensively with Finance groups, to ensure all relevant components are reported appropriately.
 Assist in the preparation of ad hoc analysis for senior leadership purposes.
 Assist in the development of documentation outlining best practices relating to the CAD P&C and Wealth stress testing process.
 Drive a culture of continuous improvement and efficiency by ensuring efficient and effective processes, leveraging automation where appropriate.
 Maintain good relations with all internal stakeholders and ensure that all their requirements are met. Must be able to work with minimal supervision in an unstructured and fast-paced environment.
 #LI-Hybrid
   


Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Tell us about your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
    

Specific Work/Educational Requirements:

 Canadian P&C and/or Canadian Wealth experience or associated finance support an asset
 Experience with Stress Testing & Knowledge of PPNR requirements considered beneficial.
 Demonstrated ability to drive transformation and change
 Ability to understand and resolve complex issues
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential
 Ability to adapt quickly, and adjust priorities as required
 Self-motivated and enjoy working in a team environment  Other Qualifications / Skills / Expertise:
 Process improvement-focused mindset, with consistent and demonstrated track record of full-scale process re-design and automation.
 Knowledge of data visualization tools, Alteryx would be an asset.
 Data analytics competencies supported by experience in traversing large data sets to perform analytics/drive business insights.
 Proficiency with MS Office Suite, including a strong competency in both MS Excel and MS PowerPoint. Expertise in macros beneficial.
 Experience with query (SQL) and large quantity of data retrieval and analysis is a plus. 
The following experience/knowledge is not required, but considered as an asset: SAS VA / MLE, Tableau.
 Analytical, problem solving and consensus building skills.
 Must be able to think conceptually (“out-of-the-box”) and have a high degree of attention for detail.
 Proactive and highly motivated individual who will take the initiative and who can work independently and in a team environment.
 Should be able to develop good business relationships with internal partners and be able to work with minimal supervision in an unstructured and fast-paced environment.
 Excellent written and oral communication skills.




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Intermediate Business Systems Analyst
SAP iXp Intern - Business Analyst, Third-Party Licensing
Description:
We help the world run better

 Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

 About the SAP Internship Experience Program

 The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

 Three reasons to intern at SAP


 Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
 Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
 Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


 About the team

 This position is part of the Global Licensing (GL) team whose mandate is to support and guide SAP lines of businesses (LOBs) with licensing third-party (TP) intellectual property (IP) and other materials for use in SAP products. GL manages end-to-end processes and inbound licensing standards in collaboration with other SAP expert teams to support SAP product development.

 What you’ll do


 Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Business Analyst, Third-Party Licensing
 Position Location: Vancouver, BC
 Anticipated Start Date and End Date: September 06, 2022 - April 28, 2023


 In this role, you’ll

 The Business Analyst position is best suited for candidates with a passion to work in the GRC (Governance, Risk management, and Compliance), procurement, software license management, project management, or process management fields. You will be responsible for providing first-level support to LOBs located across the globe – from understanding and researching TP IP licensing needs to formulating and executing solutions. You will gain hands-on knowledge of SAP’s software development and approval processes through managing and executing data quality, knowledge management, or process improvement projects. As a part of these projects, you will also be expected to create documentation related to inbound licensing and compliance.

 This position requires working independently, achieving tight timelines, and collaboration across teams including development, sales, procurement, legal, and various compliance teams.

 Work with stakeholders to gather requirements and support the licensing of various forms of TP IP and other materials, including:
   
 Free and Open Source Software (FOSS),
 TP web APIs/services,
 TP commercial (proprietary) software, and
 TP contents (e.g. data sets).

 Interpret license materials as well as technical use cases to help SAP make informed decisions
 Learn, understand, execute, and help improve established processes
 Compose documentations on processes and guidelines
 Perform manual data entry and information processing under tight timelines without sacrificing quality
 Gain an understanding of software approval processes and related data integrity requirements
 Develop project plans and manage projects autonomously
 Demonstrate interest, knowledge, and curiosity in the area of inbound licensing
 Assist in various other duties consistent with GL’s initiatives

 Who you are

 We’re looking for someone who can challenge the status quo and likes to stay curious. You enjoy working on meaningful projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


 Superb written and verbal communication skills; ability to cater to different audiences effectively and bridge the gap between business, engineering, and other professionals
 Excellent organization skills to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks and projects
 Excellent attention to detail to produce high-quality work used for decision-making purposes
 Highly self-disciplined, self-motivated, and demonstrates initiative
 Ability to professionally handle ambiguity, lack of information, and changing business conditions
 Ability to deliver under pressure, including quickly understanding new topics and existing frameworks
 Ability to work independently and efficiently with minimal supervision
 Track record of developing creative solutions to novel problems
 Active enrollment in business administration, commerce, law, or other relevant degree programs
 Can commit for 8-month full time internship from the start date indicated in this posting
 Strong qualitative research skills and ability to make connections from seemingly irrelevant information
 Ability to seek out, digest, and apply brand new domain/technical knowledge efficiently
 Working knowledge of process improvement methodologies and use of technology to streamline processes
 Working knowledge of knowledge management methodologies and tools
 Working knowledge of basic software systems modeling (e.g. UML diagrams) and database concepts
 Working knowledge of project management tools and principles
 Customer service skills and mindset
 Knowledge on copyright and contract law a plus
 Previous co-op or corporate work experience recommended
 Previous business analyst, project management, or paralegal experience a plus


 Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

 We build breakthroughs together

 SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

 We win with inclusion

 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

 EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

 Requisition ID: 348004 | Work Area: Legal | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Student | Employment Type: Intern | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid.

Title: Service Desk Business Analyst
Description:
Position Overview
 Number of Positions: 1
 Language: Bilingualism in English and French is an asset.
 Work Model: Hybrid
 Alternate Title: n/a
 Additional Information: The work location for this role is flexible to Calgary, Guelph and Moncton.






Our Client Services team aspires to create a seamless and personalized client experience. Our professional, agile and knowledgeable team works collaboratively to understand and anticipant the needs of our clients, helping our organization to grow. We foster open communication and think innovatively to find mutually beneficial solutions for our clients. The Service Desk Business Analyst develops business requirements and completes analysis, testing and delivery of new applications, enhancements or upgrades for products and services used by the Systems Operations Support Desk (SOSD) including, but not limited to, the call centre platform and incident management software. Leads all testing activity occurring within the team. Develops and runs custom service desk and other Client Service Solutions (CSS) reports.
 
Technologies you have experience with:

MicroStrategy, SQL, Power BI, Power Automate, Genesys Cloud.


What you’re responsible for:

Develops, analyzes, documents and validates department-specific business requirements for service desk applications used by SOSD and other CSS teams. 
Liaises with IT partners to ensure effective solutions for the department. 
Extracts key performance data from call centre software and incident management software and develops custom internal reports. 
Leads testing effort including development of user acceptance testing strategies and plans specific to updates to service desk software applications. Defines detailed test cases to be executed as part of the test plan. 
Estimates resource requirements for testing and coordinates the testing. 
Develops release notes to communicate all changes with business impact to the service desk and support chain. 
Investigates and resolves application, workflow and process issues as they arise. 
Proactively identifies and recommends improvements to existing systems, procedures, forms and workflows.  

To be successful:

You have an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiencies and ability to influence change, with a primary focus on client needs. 
You use critical thinking skills to recognize assumptions, evaluate arguments, draw conclusions and proactively propose solutions. 
You have strong communication skills to clearly convey messages and explore diverse points of view. 
You build trusting relationships and provide guidance to support the development of colleagues.  

To join our team:

University Degree or College diploma (Math, Science or Statistics degree or diploma is an asset). 
Minimum 5 years' experience working with business systems in an insurance environment. 
Experience with analytical tools is an asset (i.e. Excel, MS Access, SQL, MicroStrategy). 
Working towards an Advanced Certificate in Business Analysis. 
Actively working towards Chartered Insurance Professional(CIP) designation. 







Interested in applying?
 Click 'apply now' to submit your current resume and cover letter. Tell us a bit about yourself, your professional experience and how you think you can make a difference at Co-operators. We look forward to learning more about you and we welcome you to follow us on LinkedIn.
 Co-operators is focused on fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible work environment and we encourage individuals from all identity groups to apply. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact the hiring manager.

Title: Senior Analyst, Equity Settlements (Recon/Seg)
Description:
Address: 55 Bloor Street West

Customer Shared Services

Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of solutions.

Resolves standard and relatively straightforward issues, referring non-routine issues to more senior team members and/or manager. 
May function as a problem-solving resource for more junior staff. 
Provides input and analysis into and participates in the planning, testing and implementation of continuous improvement projects as required. 
Follows documented policies and procedures to execute day to day transactions, activities, processes and ensure all Service Level Agreements(SLAs) are met. Checks and reconciles information and documentation to ensure accuracy and completeness. 
Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations. 
Identifies and analyzes issues and problems, and resolves discrepancies in a timely manner. Deals with clients directly to resolve issues and/or escalates as required. 
Communicates and collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives. 
Develops and maintains effective relationships with internal & external stakeholders to execute work and fulfill service delivery expectations. 
Communicates and collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives. 
Understands the regulatory requirements and risks inherent in the operations and ensures appropriate actions are taken and operational integrity is maintained.

Focus may be on a business/group. 
Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works mostly independently.

Typically between 3 - 5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Knowledge and experience using relevant systems and technology – In-depth. 
Knowledge and understanding of the business unit’s key products and services, processes and controls – In-depth. 
Knowledge of the risk and regulatory requirements of the business – Good. 
Prioritization skills – Good. 
Customer service skills – In-depth. 
PC skills (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint) – In-depth. 
Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people.
