Title: Technical Data Platform Analyst
Description:
Joining Suncor means you will work for one of the best companies in Canada, providing tremendous future potential where talented people thrive and lead. As our business evolves, so do our employment opportunities. Our work culture includes a dynamic mix of professionals, with a diversity of skills and expertise.
 
 We are looking for an individual who is excited to join a cross-functional team who is accountable for the enablement, operationalization and continued maturity of the Data & Analytics platform.
 

   In this role, you will work as a technical analyst across a diverse set of stakeholders and technical capabilities. Further to that, you will provide expertise in both the Microsoft Azure and DevOps space in order to enable product teams to accelerate their speed and frequency of delivery.
 


   Minimum Requirements:
 



     A Bachelor’s degree or a technical diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent
   


     Three years of experience in Information Technology
   


     Experience in Microsoft Azure
   


     Two years of experience working with DevOps capabilities
   


     Proficiency in a broad range of Microsoft products and services including but not limited to: Azure Cloud platform, ADF, Databricks, ADLS, Synapse, SQL database, Power BI
   


     Experience with GitHub actions
   


     Experience with IaC; Terraform, ARM, Bicep
   


     Experience in Linux and Windows; strong grasp of Cloud fundamentals
   


     Ability to communicate and present technical requirements and solution to diverse stakeholders across the company
   


     Demonstrated skills in design thinking, automation, and agile practices; and awareness of new digital technologies and use cases within the business and how to implement them
   



   Responsibilities:
 



     Contribute to the enablement, operationalization and maturity of Data and Analytics technical capabilities in support of the platform
   


     Provide and advise on best practices, technical design and development of platform technical capabilities
   


     Create and maintain technical design artifacts and operational runbooks
   


     Provide system level support such as Windows and/or Linux server environment configuration, installation, security, system upgrades, backups and disaster recovery
   


     Support ETL workloads in Azure
   


     Build and maintain relationships with stakeholders and vendors, support long-term strategic direction, and act as technical expert helping our stakeholders optimize their cloud investment
   


     Apply DevOps best-practices to the continued operationalization of technical capabilities across the platform, including Continuous Improvement/Continuous Development (CI/CD) pipelines, test automation, monitoring and alerting
   


 Location and other Key Details:
 



     You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W.
   


     Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday
   



   #LI-HYBRID
 


   Why Suncor?
 





 Our operations include oil sands development and upgrading, conventional and offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and our product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our renewable energy portfolio includes investments in four operating wind farms and the operation of an ethanol plant. And our use of innovative technology has made us an industry leader in the energy business.
     


       With a strong strategy for growth and our long-standing approach to sustainability, operational excellence, capital discipline and technology and innovation, Suncor offers a solid foundation for you to continue building your career. We offer rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions – all of which means tremendous potential for your future. We are focused on deepening our commitment to inclusion and diversity and creating a respectful workplace.
     


       We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We have numerous employee inclusion networks to help foster an inclusive and respectful culture and drive positive change within Suncor. Current networks include both workplace inclusion networks (focusing on inclusion and respect for all), and identity-focused networks (focusing on building community and a sense of belonging and allyship). Through the Journey of Reconciliation, we are progressing the way we think and act to build greater mutual trust and respect with the Indigenous Peoples in Canada. Please note we will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.

Title: Inventory & Purchasing Analyst
Description:
Manitobah Mukluks is a company rooted in Indigenous culture that produces authentic mukluks, moccasins and accessories. Recognized as one of Canada’s Fastest growing companies for 5 years in a row and named in the Top 150 Most Iconic Canadian Brands, Manitobah products can be found in 50 countries and over 1,000 retail outlets. Since 1997 we have continued our Indigenous founder’s vision to build a vibrant, global brand that makes a significant impact in Indigenous communities.
Manitobah Mukluks is seeking an Inventory & Purchasing Analyst for our Winnipeg Head Office.
Qualified Indigenous candidates are strongly encouraged to apply and to self-declare.
Duties and Responsibilities: 

Detailed accuracy for item creation, purchase order creation and maintenance of all product lines within the Manitobah Mukluks banner.
Maintain & update accurate costing, season coding, availability and all other parameters directly linked to the item files in the system.
Maintain & update accurate item costs on purchase orders, verify & confirm receipt of product at 3PL partners match original purchase orders.
Assist in managing inventory in a multi-channel environment. Review & execute weekly inventory replenishment.
Assist in planning inventory levels to support sales forecast plan, to achieve in-stock, replenishment and service level targets while adhering to lean inventory principles.
Build relationships with external vendors and internal partner departments.
Communicate with external vendors on purchase order tracking as well as track on time delivery of purchase orders.
Manage vendor scorecard and communicate results both internally and externally with vendors.
Manage and respect defined timelines. Ensure delays are communicated in advance to management and colleagues.
Ensure the integrity of data meets corporate standards and best practices.

Qualifications: 

Post-secondary degree or diploma in supply chain management, business administration or in a related discipline.
Minimum 5 years of progressive experience in a similar role.
Knowledge of industry, sales channels, the sales process, demand planning, booking programs, style life-cycle management and the critical link to supply.
Understanding of forecasting, merchandising, sales planning, demand planning or supply planning.
Strong analytical, organization and time management skills.
Advanced computer skills in Excel modeling, Outlook and Word.
Clear and effective communication skills.
Enjoy working in a fast-paced, agile environment and the camaraderie of working as part of a team.
Appreciation and respect for Indigenous culture.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: Up to $50,000.00 per year

Casual dress
Dental care
Discounted or free food
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Paid time off
Tuition reimbursement
Vision care
Work from home

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Education:

DCS / DEC (preferred)

Experience:

Purchasing and Inventory Management: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Performance Measurement Data Analyst
Description:
Open up to the Possibilities!At Purolator, you’ll be proud knowing you’re working for a Canadian company that truly values its employees. And it’s community. This is an exciting and evolving industry and we’re leading the change as we strive to deliver the future. Here you will be empowered to help move the business forward. Each and every day. Are you open to the possibilities?
Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. If you have questions, please feel free to ask during your interview.
Job Description
The Manager, Performance Excellence and Business Intelligence will be responsible for managing performance excellence program and driving performance improvement initiatives. Key areas of responsibilities include
Sets and monitors operations performance KPI and metrics for all levels of operations which include development of the KPI, method of reporting, establishing data owners, maintenance of the KPI, management of control plans, etc.
Provides business intelligence and insights on operations performance, key levers and improvement opportunities
Owns the overall operations management review cadence which include monthly business reviews and national business reviews and field operation reviews
Job Responsibilities: 
Include, but are not limited to:
Lead the performance Excellence Team with a focus on performance excellence, business hydraulics, and operations dynamics.
Responsible for managing and meeting operations performance targets and initiatives
Manage operations and performance planning and budgeting process for field operations
Integrate, consolidate and manage scope, resources, timelines and budgets on projects/initiatives
Identifies and leads common programs that help improve operations performance across all regions
Manage and monitor multiple interdependent performance improvement projects and initiatives across the regions.
Oversee and manage performance and ROI on all initiatives
Strong leadership, project and time management skills with the ability to prioritize multiple projects in an Agile approach
Lead and coordinate the Revenue capture processes, systems and technology impacting Operations
Work with the Operations teams to identify root causes, and mitigation strategies to achieve better outcomes for our customers and optimize revenue capture
Develop reports to showcase trends and work with the operations team to brainstorm solutions
Be the trusted adviser and manage executive communication on all aspects of the program including progress metrics, issues and risks and mitigating actions
To work collaboratively with finance function to ensure tight alignment on financial and operations performance
Conducting career development and performance reviews for team members, providing ongoing support and accountability for achievement
Performing other related duties as required.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: 
Degree in Business Management/Industrial Engineering/BS degree in Engineering or Operations Research or equivalent
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Project Management skills Required-PMP designation preferred but not required
Six Sigma tools and techniques
Strong written and oral communications skills
Ability to develop and present business cases to senior management.
Ability to establish work goals, objectives, and standards to be achieved by subordinates
Ability to performance manage subordinates while keeping manager informed of performance discussions and results.
Minimum of 3 years leadership experience in a high availability Supply Chain (Transportation/Network/logistic) environment
Experience in working in a complex cross functional environment
Frequent interaction with senior management on projects and updates
Conveys information fluently, interpreting and clarifying details and explaining rationale.
Comprehensive knowledge of Productivity and performance measures
Arranges training or assignments, give timely coaching, to foster learning and development
Has managed resources, timelines, and budgets

Title: SAP Business Analyst
Description:
SAP Business Analyst
Finance & technology – Information Technology & GIS


Competition 22/198
 
Status Regular Full time
 
Hours of Work 70 hours bi-weekly
 
Rate of Pay $46.63 to $52.89 per hour (2021 rates)
 
Review of applications begins 4:00pm on July 25, 2022


Summary
 Reporting to the Manager, SAP Payroll & HCM this position is an integral part of a functional team responsible for the ongoing support and development of the CRD’s Enterprise Resource Planning system, SAP. The position is part of a support team responsible for day to day support related to SAP, plays a key role in development projects, oversees training programs, annual support package test routines, and functions as a technical expert in the SAP Payroll and HCM modules.
 

Duties & Responsibilities

Collaborates with business units to define functional requirements and functional designs to support the organization’s strategy and future business goals.
Understands and utilizes business information to manage everyday operations and generates innovative solutions to approach business and administrative challenges.
Facilitates business requirements analysis and functional design work sessions including creating business presentations, communications, and documentation.
Leads functional system design in the development of SAP Payroll and HCM modules.
Configures and tests SAP Payroll and HCM modules.
Directs consulting services, ensuring project work meets desired outcomes.
Prepares and delivers system demonstrations to stakeholders to validate business approach.
Identifies creative solutions to business requirements, analyzes the strengths and weaknesses of alternatives, and provides recommendations.
Works with SAP, external vendors and consulting firms to obtain additional insights, approaches and solutions to various business requirements.
Provides IT resource estimates for preparation of business case and project costing.
Executes projects utilizing current project management standards and protocols.
Follows all defined technology standards and processes and provides input for improvements as required and/or identified.
Provides expertise to train and support groups as appropriate before system go-lives.
Trains and/or mentors other team members, and peers as appropriate.
Uses an effective interpersonal style to build, inspire, and sustain a cohesive team by focusing the team on its mission and importance of the role to organizational success.
Follows all policies, procedures and standards of the CRD.
Performs other related duties as required.


Qualifications

A related Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 6 years’ experience in SAP or equivalent ERP functional design and development or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Hands-on configuration experience with SAP HCM (Canadian Payroll, Organizational Management, Personnel Management including Benefits, CATS, Time Evaluation).
Excellent communication (verbal and written), interpersonal and customer service skills are required.
Experienced working within an Enterprise Architecture, where systems and data have many inter-relationships and dependencies and an understanding of the critical nature of these relationships.
Experienced in information technology systems design and development methodologies as related to the systems development lifecycle.
Excellent business systems and process analysis skills in a complex computerized environment.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to elicit requirements from business users including experience facilitating requirements analysis and functional design working sessions.
Experience managing teams of consultants focused on multiple simultaneous projects.
Strong leadership skills to provide advice and guidance to team members.
Strong project management skills to ensure projects are delivered in scope, on time and within budget.
Direct experience with business process re-engineering.
High level of proficiency and experience with Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Experience with the following is an asset: implementing SuccessFactors module, S/4HANA and SAP HCM Fiori applications.


To keep our employees, customers and the communities we serve safe, the CRD has introduced an employee vaccination policy intended to prevent the transmission of COVID-19. As such, the CRD requires verification of your COVID-19 vaccination status as a condition of employment.


Applications
 To apply for this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume and covering letter online at 
 www.crd.bc.ca under “
 Careers”. To learn more about working with us, 
 visit our website.
 
 The CRD thanks you for your interest and advises only those candidates under active consideration will be contacted.

 Education : Bachelor’s degree 
 Experience : 5 years or more

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
BUSINESS ANALYST


The Opportunity:
We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our Irving Forest Services team, based in Saint John, New Brunswick.
We are seeking an individual interested in developing their skills working with databases and creating dashboards. As a Business Analyst, you will contribute to the building of the Pulp and Paper Division's analytical reporting platform in Tableau / Alteryx / SQL Databases, as well as work closely in the integration between our various platforms and data sources. The work environment includes operational controls, process data, and financial data.


Who We Are:
Our team operates within highly technical, fast paced, competitive businesses and is part of an integrated forest products value chain under J.D. Irving, Limited (JDI). Our goal is to play an integrated role in sustainably transforming our renewable forest resources into value-added products for today’s consumer markets.
We are not just invested in forest products; we are invested in people. We know that our overall success is a combined effort, and we therefore strive to provide opportunities for our employees to learn, grow, and thrive. Being curious and focused on innovation is key to leading a successful team. True leaders never stop learning and are never satisfied with the status quo. 
We operate four Pulp and Paper Mills out of Saint John and St. George New Brunswick that produce 1 Million Tonnes of Product and employ over 1000 employees.


We Offer:

Competitive pay, benefits package, RRSP contributions, Quarterly bonus
Strong commitment to safety
Opportunity to work with leading edge technology, processes and equipment 
Opportunity to be part of a world class analytical platform
Multiple career development opportunities
Dynamic work environment
Ongoing Professional Development


 
You Have:

A degree or diploma in Business Information Systems, Computer Science or Business Administration
Highly organized, pays close attention to detail, and a problem solver
Experience with Tableau, Alteryx and Power BI is an asset
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, specifically Pivot Tables is an asset
Good understanding of conceptual, logical, physical data modeling concepts
Driven self-starter who is flexible and adaptable to changes in assignments and priorities
Creative thinker that knows how to transform data into visual displays that are meaningful to the business
Shows curiosity when dealing with datasets and problems
Strong verbal, presentation, and written communication skills
Data driven decision-making and problem-solving skills


 
Responsibilities:

Gather and analyze business requirements and user specifications
Extract and assemble data from various sources (time series data, flat files, relational databases and data warehouses) and design queries to bring this data into Tableau visualizations and Alteryx workflows
Flexible in working with ad hoc requests, projects, and other activities as required 
Contribute to and help define team best practices around report development, testing, access management, and report refresh scheduling
Provide technical assistance to users and monitor performance of BI system
Use statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts
Assist in data governance task, and documentation for data cataloging


 
The Company:
Founded in 1882, J.D. Irving, Limited (JDI) has operations in Eastern Canada (New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Quebec, Ontario, Newfoundland and Labrador), and the United States. We are a team of 18,000 dedicated employees.


To Apply for this Career Opportunity:
Please apply online.
We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. 
To learn more about our products and services, click here.
Irving Forest Services Limited is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.

Title: Sr Business Info Mgmt Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Business Information Management (BIM) at TD is part of a creative, enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Roles in BIM are highly professional and valued, specialized yet inter-connected and focused on making the availability of business information to designers, developers and decision-makers a priority, all with a united purpose to serve customers and continually build a better bank.
 We're looking for analytical and agile professionals who can merge and translate data into technology and business information, serving today's business needs and setting in motion TD's longer-term goals and strategic objectives.
 If you get data, its power and potential, we think you'll love working at TD, where data knows no bounds and where your professional expertise will help to drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.



Job Description

Are you an expert level business information analyst, equipped with both conceptual and practical expertise in business information management? If so, this role offers a hands-on and high-career growth opportunity to provide business technical leadership across a broad range of information management functions to support various areas of data and analytics.
 Enjoy partnering with colleagues and directing data traffic? In this advanced professional role, you'll work both independently and within teams as a senior lead analyst. Colleagues and business partners will look to you to manage and direct activities related to analysis, design and support of business data management solutions, including larger projects.
 As a Senior Business Information Management Analyst, you will:

 Be the expert-level team analyst, considered an authority with in-depth knowledge and experience in your field of specialty as well as working knowledge of broader related areas
 Lead projects of moderate to complex risk and resource requirements; may lead end-to-end processes or functional programs
 Analyze and understand business and data requirements to develop complete business solutions (e.g. analysis of data models, entity relationship diagrams, data lifecycle management, governance, lineage, metadata and reporting elements)
 Develop business requirements; design and implement complex business data information management frameworks
 Apply automation and innovation on data platforms and on new development projects / initiatives
 Conduct a range of data analyses, demonstrating your in-depth experience with very large datasets and big data technologies; assessing business information-related data requirements aligned to business needs and for specific data platforms, applications systems and servers
 Partner and collaborate with business and technology partners to resolve data / application issues and ensure requirements delivery
 Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality and innovation and, ensure timely communication of issues/points of interest




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

 Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
 Five (5) or more years relevant experience from a business administration, statistical, mathematical, scientific or financial background
 Sound conceptual knowledge in your area of specialty
 Fluent in one or two programming languages
 Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
 Proficient knowledge of various data sources, tools and technologies used in preparing summaries/reports
 In-depth knowledge of competitor and market trends
 Proficient to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
 Expertise in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
 Strong ability to work collaboratively and independently, communicate effectively (both speaking and writing), follow instructions/direction, and help building relationships across teams and functions
 Act as a brand champion for our business area / function and TD, both internally and externally




Additional Information

    #LI-Hybrid #dataengineer
   



Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

    Business Information Management

    Enterprise Data & Analytics

Title: Business Intelligence ETL Developer
Description:
The Business Intelligence ETL Developer will support the continual development of an enterprise-wide BI function, including building out the architecture, tools, and processes to report on business performance. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience in writing code to deliver high-quality reports in a complex environment. It will also be vital for the candidate to bridge the technical world of data warehousing with the needs of the business by acting as an internal consultant to help answer challenging questions using their data expertise and technical know-how.
 This role will report to the Senior Manager of Customer and Billing and will partner with our architecture team and business analyst teams to develop data based solutions in accordance with organizational priorities.
 Key Areas of Responsibility:

 Design and develop business criteria reports by leveraging deep ETL skills and database knowledge.
 Work with business for deep dive analysis of existing reports.
 Support architectural decisions and tool selection.


 Required Skills:

 A strong developer who thinks about issues from a business perspective with demonstrated ability to develop value added reports
 Ability to work with business group leadership to provide analytical insight
 Ability to implement best practices for software development and operations
 Solid knowledge in business intelligence, web analytics, report development and working knowledge of data warehousing, data modeling and data mining
 Deep skills in at least one of the following ETL tools: Integration Services of Microsoft SQL Server (aka SSIS), SSRS, Power BI, SAP BusinessObjects Data Integrator (earlier versions known as BusinessObjects Data Integrator), IBM WebSphere DataStage, Informatica PowerCenter, Oracle Data Integrator. Also, deep knowledge on Query Optimization.
 Scripting experience in Perl, Powershell or Python
 Will need to have source and target experience with two of the following databases: SQL Server, MySql, Sybase or IBM DB2
 Hands on experience on .NET C#
 Nice to have: JAVA, DBA skills, AZURE
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills


 Required Experience:

 University Degree or equivalent in Computer Science related subject
 8+ years of experience in software industry; strong knowledge of database design, and data warehouse technologies
 Experience in coding T-SQL, complex stored procedures, functions, and views (We are looking for somebody that will assist with development across the entire Microsoft SQL stack)
 Strong knowledge of relational & non-relational database concepts
 Experience in fine-tuning procedures, indexes for performance improvement
 Proficient, C#, .Net, and legacy platforms
 Knowledge of object-oriented design principles and ability to design software systems at an abstract/conceptual level as well as at a detailed level
 Strong skills in troubleshooting and designing software systems to support back-office applications (e.g. Billing, Finance, CRM, etc.)
 Project Management experience would be an asset
 Good written & spoken English communication skills

Title: HR reporting Analyst (12-month contract)
Description:
At McCarthy Tétrault, we offer challenging and rewarding career opportunities and are delighted to have been selected for the tenth consecutive year in 2022 as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. Our culture is built on professional excellence, collaboration, innovation, thought leadership and entrepreneurialism. We embrace inclusion in all its forms and we provide the tools and opportunities to help our people develop to their full potential.
This position can be based out of Montreal, Toronto, Vancouver or Calgary. McCarthy Tétrault employees benefit from a hybrid work environment.
As a Data Analyst, Human Resources, you will be: 
This role will be responsible for completing reports for the business year end processes. They will work within our HRMS tool, specifically the business intelligence reporting section. In addition, they will also provide back up to the Reporting Analyst and HRMS System admin.

Providing accurate and timely business reporting including but not limited to: payroll and benefits audit reporting, payroll and benefits reconciliation, retro calculations, headcount, general data inquires and other reports as required.
Specific year end business reporting for our job evaluation process, compensation and payroll reporting.
Building, and delivering reporting for various stakeholders in the business as requested
Troubleshooting and fixing reporting issues as they arise.
Maintaining all documentation relating to reporting.
Focusing on continuous innovation; utilizing analytical tools to provide data driven insights and providing recommendations to management team regarding reporting procedural enhancements.
Participating in work teams with other business stakeholders to understand their reporting needs.
Collaborating with the Reporting Analyst, System admin on data and reporting inquiries to ensure the best solution to the business problem.
Ensuring compliance with people data governance policies and guidelines.

As our ideal candidate, you will have: 

Minimum 5 years of progressive experience in using business analytics tools to design and create HR reports with demonstrated knowledge applying analytical methodology.
Familiarity using various HRIS systems to navigate extract data, writes report queries etc.; knowledge of UKG and exposure to Cognos BI and Power BI is an asset.
Certification, diploma or Bachelor degree in data science, computer science, Business Intelligence background considered a strong asset
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills (data presentation, VLOOKUPS, index and match formulas).
Data validation between multiple data sets.
Experience working with SQL and in a data base environment.
High attention to detail and analytical capabilities.
Strong knowledge and working experience of business technology.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Able to perform comfortably in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented work environment and to maintain a professional attitude.
Able to work autonomously and as part of a team.
Strong attention to detail and ability to ensure accuracy.
Bilingualism considered an asset.

As a member of the McCarthy team, you will have access to: 

Competitive compensation including paid overtime.
A commitment to professional development and growth opportunities for our people at all levels, supported by a culture that fully embraces and encourages two-way feedback.
Strong community involvement and a commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.
A collaborative, cohesive culture that connects lawyers and business teams through collective purpose.

We thank all applicants for their interest in McCarthy Tétrault; however, only chosen applicants will be contacted. We regret that we are unable to respond to individual inquiries about application status. McCarthy Tétrault is an equal opportunity employer that fosters an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment. Please notify us if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process.

Overtime pay

Monday to Friday

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Description:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Perkins + Will, our Instagram, and our Blog.
 We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.
 Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.
 Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable.
 We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!
 To make a difference for a million people, we need to significantly increase our ability to scale. The data we collect in our product is the key to this scale. It can help us understand everything from which financial institutions are the more reliable data sources, to what activities are taking up a disproportionate amount of bookkeeping time, to which UX patterns are most effective for our customers.
 We're looking for a Product Analyst to join our Product team and fall in love with our data—warts and all. We believe that having someone in this role will supercharge both our product investment decision making and also the way we build features. This person will need to deeply understand data derived from browser analytics (Google Analytics, Heap), data imported from financial institutions (custom integrations, Plaid integrations, and also an in-house data processing team), and the incredibly interesting data associated with our in-house (250 person) bookkeeping team, who together handle 12,000 years worth of books each year (and growing!).
 What you'll be getting up to:

Work with executive leadership on product strategy and identify key areas of investment.
Help quantify, validate, and measure the hypotheses put forward by Product Managers.
Work closely with the engineering and the roll-out team to ensure that new features are set up to be measurable
Build dashboards and other means of understanding the data we ingest through our application
Codify metrics that measure the success of our launches and communicate them effectively to stakeholders.

To be successful in this role, you'll need to have:

A resonance with our mission and principles.
An activated curiosity and openness to being an equitable and inclusive team-member. Our commitment to anti-racism and anti-discrimination as a company excites you.
A demonstrable ability of data analysis
A strong SQL toolkit
Experience working with AWS Redshift or similar technology
A demonstrable drive to grow. Fostering growth is what we do here, in ourselves and in our reports. Our mission is big, and we all need to grow significantly to achieve it.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, a keen perceptiveness to your audience, and the ability to authentically generate buy-in across multiple teams.

Perks of working here:

At Bench we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this full-time permanent role is $72,720 - $90,200. Stock options will also be a part of the total compensation package.
In addition, we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, unlimited paid flex days, stock options, and full health, dental, and vision.
You'll get unlimited access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
Bench is moving towards being a fully remote organization, with a couple of team exceptions, and we're in the process of closing our Vancouver HQ. We focus our hiring efforts in the following provinces: British Columbia, Alberta, Ontario, New Brunswick, and Nova Scotia.
You'll have access to our Home Office Setup Fund, to ensure that you have everything you need to work comfortably from home, from day one.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.
 We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.

Title: Sr. Business Analyst
Description:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 
 
Work with departments to align processes and systems to increase efficiencies in Workforce Management, Asset Management, Point-of-Sales, Work Order processing, Supply Chain and Inventory functions. 
Lead discussions or workshops with business users and/or stakeholders to gather requirements. 
Seek consensus and acceptance of business requirements and solutions from the key stakeholders. 
Assist in the planning, design, development, quality review, and deployment of new applications and/or enhancements to existing applications. 
Ensure compatibility and interoperability between applications. 
Analyze implications of requested new or enhanced application functionality and provide feedback. 
Perform hands-on fixes and configuration of software. 
Provide Tier 2 and Tier 3 support for business applications as needed. 
Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems. 
Provide orientation and training to end users for modified and new systems. 
Communicate application problems and issues to key stakeholders. 
Provide technical application stewardship: responsible for administration functions of an application, including user administration, application maintenance and sustainability 
Work closely with key stakeholders, and other IT groups to identify appropriate solutions. 
Write functional specifications to address application bugs and minor enhancements. 
Create operational support documentation and user guides for support provided to the business or other parts of IT. 
Create formal system change requests and facilitate delivery of production updates through the change management process. 
Other duties, as assigned. 
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS Education/ Experience 
 
Post-secondary degree or Diploma in Business Operations, IT, or other related discipline. 
3 to 6 years’ experience implementing, optimizing and/or supporting business applications. 
Working knowledge of System Development Life Cycle methodology. 
Knowledge of business functions related to accounting, asset management, supply-chain and billing. 
Prior experience supporting end-users on functionality, interface, problems, and/or usability issues on applications and systems. 
Experience working with IT Service Management solutions like ServiceNow or similar systems. 
Familiar with Incident Management, Request Management, Problem Management, Release Management and Change Management Processes. 
Experience working with and supporting Enterprise Applications like JD Edwards, Kronos, Symphony Point-of-Sales, Incorta or similar systems. 
Process and systems experience in hospitality industry is highly desirable. 
Experience in task prioritization either independently or in a team-oriented collaborative environment. 
Software development exposure or experience is considered an asset. 
Advanced analytical skills in gathering system requirements, logical data & process modeling, use case modeling, workflow modeling. 
Maturity of judgment and on-demand decision making to resolve problems immediately and/or to seek support when required. 
Experience performing upgrades of business applications / systems and/or related 3 rd party applications highly regarded. 
Proven experience in translating business requirements into creative functional and technical specifications. 
Skills & Abilities 
 
Excellent verbal & written communication skills. 
Demonstrated project management skills. 
Advanced analytical skills in gathering system requirements, logical data & process modeling, use case modeling, work flow modeling. 
Self-starter and highly motivated to achieve results. 
Propensity to innovate and challenge the status quo. 
Maturity of judgment and on-demand decision making to resolve problems without delay and/or to seek support when required. 
Demonstrated organization and time management skills. 
Ability to juggle multiple projects & tasks and prioritize and deliver results in the face of competing business interests. 
Detail oriented, but also able to view a big picture and understand strategic context. 
Proficient in MS Office products. 
Ability to work independently and proactively to develop and implement solutions with minimal guidance. 
Ability to build relationships quickly and work as part of a team. 
Business acumen – ability to quickly grasp how a process works and leverage that knowledge to drive business results.

Title: Analyst Systems Integration
Description:
Requisition ID: 168393
Career Group: Corporate Office Careers
Job Category: Operations COE Labour & Performance
Travel Requirements: 0 - 10%
Job Type: Part-Time


Country: Canada (CA)
Province: Nova Scotia
City: Stellarton
Location: Foord St. Office, Tahoe Office, Vancouver Office, Victoria Office, Winnipeg Office
Postal Code: B0K 1S0


Our family of 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better – great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.


A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1500 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawton’s Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.


All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.



 Overview




The Analyst of Systems Optimization and Support is responsible for the maintenance, development and optimization of all reporting issued by the team. This is a 7-months contract. 




Job Description




Individual accountabilities are:

Maintain knowledge of key systems (CAO, FIM, ISP/POS, Kronos, etc.) in all applicable banners in order to properly analyze data
Share knowledge with other team members to maximize overall team effectiveness in supporting change and usage of key systems
Triage questions from DOs, MROs on existing systems and tools
Ensure optimal customer service standards are upheld in team call center by fielding questions related to reports issued by the team
Participate in continuous improvement of team analytics by ensuring that any system changes that may impact reporting is identified and managed
Ensure all reports are accurate and issued to the business on time
Ensure accurate maintenance of store lists and distribution lists for reports we issue
Monitor compliance and performance of all stores/banners/formats and engage with format leads on opportunities
Actively identify opportunities in the business and work with team to propose changes to maximize profits for the business
Collaborate with Finance team to ensure alignment on potential opportunities
Support Director of Operations & District Operator and assist in removal of barriers to the execution of superior customer service
Participate and drive engagement within the team
Deliver a useable product to stores and on time
Identify stores/banners/formats are not using systems properly
Collaborate with and support project team members to achieve success with their assigned work
Ensure adherence to government regulations (including OHS Standards)





 Job Requirements




What your resume and experience will demonstrate to us:

Merchandising or retail experience
High School Diploma and / or a minimum of 3 years experience in category or product management, or equivalent combination of education and experience
Working knowledge of store operations (business acumen)
Proficient use of Microsoft Office suite
Solid communication skills (both oral and written) and ability to influence positive change
Experience with data management and dashboarding tools (Tableau)




 Sobeys is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process.


While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged.


We appreciate the interest from the Staffing industry however respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from Agencies.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  As one of the largest independent technology companies in Atlantic Canada, Mariner has a team of over 200 IT, Software Professionals and Management Consultants working with clients both regionally and across the globe. With extensive capabilities in the areas of analytics, automation software, information security, change management and IT consulting, Mariner has been delivering innovative solutions with a strong emphasis on productivity and customer experience since 2003.



 Job Description
  Mariner is actively recruiting for a Senior Business Analyst to be a key leader in our IT Professional Services team in Nova Scotia or New Brunswick. In this role, you will be responsible for client-based projects and, in collaboration with our delivery and sales teams, you will deliver best of breed solutions to new and existing customers.
 You are passionate about customer experience – and are not afraid to ask the hard questions and challenge the status quo to deliver the right solution. You can balance your love of detailed analysis with your drive to meet deadlines – and can guide the process from idea through to the testing phase.
 Major Responsibilities:

 Facilitate stakeholder sessions, interviews, and analysis to identify areas for process and systems improvement
 Prepare Business Requirements Documents, including functional/non-functional requirements
 Prepare integration plans for deployment of system changes into existing environments
 Collaborate in the development of test plans and test cases
 Interact with the solution team to ensure that requirements are correctly understood and implemented
 Communicate key insights to client team and clearly identify impacts of changes




 Qualifications
 

 10 years of experience in Business Analysis as a part of multifunctional team, preferably in public sector (government), healthcare, SAP/S4Hana, and utilities.
 Demonstrated success with business requirements analysis, group facilitation, gap analysis, process mapping and design as part of a business transformation.
 Knowledge and experience with large scale multifunctional IT implementation initiatives
 Experience in working in a formal systems development lifecycle methodology environment involving such artifacts as functional and detailed design documents, business use cases, and requirements traceability
 Demonstrated skill in building consensus among stakeholders
 Exceptional communication skills and experience in working with business at all levels including technical SMEs
 Experience with both Agile and Waterfall project delivery methodologies
 Demonstrated project experience across some combination of the following:
   
 digital strategy/digitalization of services
 enterprise systems (ERP, CRM, HRIS)
 IT infrastructure & cloud
 business intelligence & analytics, data management
 IT risk management
 cybersecurity
 emerging technologies (AI, ML, IoT, etc.)

 Experience working in client-based consulting role is highly desirable.
 Post-secondary education in business, computer science, or a related field.
 CBAP and/or Prosci certifications considered an asset.

 Additional Information
  Why Mariner Partners?
 We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work – our team is located in major cities all across Canada, throughout the US and internationally. We are proud to be headquartered here and are passionate about growing a strong technology sector here in Atlantic Canada and beyond. We offer competitive compensation, benefits packages and training and development.
 We recognize that empowered employees are more innovative, more efficient, deliver better customer service and can flat out-perform conventional organizations. Our people have built products for national deployments at the world’s largest TV and Internet companies and leading real estate, financial and government organizations.
 We are looking for passionate IT professionals who love solving problems for customers and who want to grow their careers.
 Join our growing team!

Title: Analyst, Asset Management
Description:
YOU will assist in carrying out the team’s strategy to grow and drive results within a multi-residential portfolio. They will perform an analysis of the current asset portfolio, complete financial analysis on value-enhancing strategies, assist in developing operating budgets, and collaborate with different departments to determine how to maximize the value of assets.
 WHAT WILL YOU DO:

 Establish and foster strong relationships throughout the organization as a multifamily asset management expert.
 Oversee and interact with the property management team at Avenue Living Communities; support the operations team in understanding the asset strategy and performance expectations required to achieve financial targets.
 Prepare and present reports on asset performance to executives and various stakeholders, recommend and implement approved revisions as necessary.
 Develop pro-formas and budgets to align asset level strategies to financial goals and valuations; including scenario analysis of different strategies to present suggestions to executives
 Gather detailed market, historical, and asset information including rents, ancillary revenues, operating costs, and margins.
 Developing asset strategy plans for individual properties including long-term plans, projected performance, risk assessment, and market influences. Evaluate alignment of the capital plan and financial targets for the properties.
 Assist the investment team with acquisition assumptions and due diligence to support underwriting. Prepare detailed information for executives and the capital market team as required on asset performance.
 Assisting with budget preparation; support in setting operational and financial targets that achieve organizational goals; helping to develop and refine assumptions with the property management team; reviewing and refining budgets to improve quality; and, preparing presentation materials for field and executive levels.
 Analyzing, collecting, and presenting data from various sources, this includes using SQL to gather information from our internal software, collecting data from webpages, and other sources
 Develop and strengthen relationships with industry peers.
 Ah hoc projects as required.


 WHAT WILL YOU NEED:


 Prior experience in real estate and/or a strong interest to learn about the industry is required
 Undergraduate Degree in Finance, Accounting, Data Analytics, or Commerce
 Advanced Microsoft Office skills, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
 Enrolled or willing to purse a financial designation is an asset (CFA, CPA etc.)
 Knowledge of SQL, Python, or R is considered an asset
 Effective communication: developing relationships within the organization is key. This role relies on successful collaboration across departments making effective communication skills essential
 Creative problem-solving: there are multiple ways to analyze data and solve problems; this role caters to someone who is curious, creative, and a good problem solver.
 Passion for real estate: this role is heavily involved in the day-to-day operation of multi-family assets.


 WHAT DO WE OFFER:


 We live and breathe our core values. We go the extra mile. We’re honest. We always have each other's back. We have tons of integrity. And we always own it and adapt - no matter the challenge.
 With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there's no limit to the impact you can make.
 We provide a competitive compensation package composed of a group benefits plan, and discretionary profit-sharing program.
 We are committed to a strong safety work environment.


 What makes us different makes us stronger. We want Avenue Living to be a great place to work for everyone; where people feel safe, included, inspired, trusted, and supported so they can be, and bring, their best. We’re committed to creating a respectful and inclusive workplace where unique perspectives, experiences, backgrounds, cultures and attributes are valued and utilized to help achieve better results. As an organization with operations across different geographies, we celebrate the fact that our workforce is made up of people with diverse demographics. We are committed to ensuring our workplace is fair, equitable and free of discrimination and harassment.

 Subject to reasonable accommodation, this position will require the successful candidate to show proof of vaccination.

 By submitting your application, you are giving your consent for us to contact you by phone, text or email.

Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD
 With a broad spectrum of technology talent and a keen focus on small, non-critical, non-external facing, low risk applications. CRD provides high-quality, low-cost, time-effective System Development Lifecycle (SDLC) services, including Business Analysis, Project Management, Solutions Design, Development, Support and Application Hosting capabilities. CRD work closely with TD Businesses to ensure applications are developed and hosted in a cost-effective and timely manner. Working with technology and business partners, CRD delivers and maintains 50+ internal (employee facing) applications and technology solutions that support the bank. 



Job Description

About This Role 
The CRD Team is seeking Business System Analyst (BSA) with Planning, Requirement Elicitation, Analysis, Documentation, and Communication skills to join our group. This role mandates that includes (but not limited to) proposing technical system to accomplish business requirements enterprise wide and accountability for quality assurance. The primary accountabilities for this position are:

 Respect TD's technology delivery practices and standards, project management disciplines.
 Strong customer orientation and a professional approach with the ability to interact with all levels within the organization.
 Stay on top of state-of-health during software development life cycle.
 Access client needs and recommend the right technology, offer right technology, and process related analysis and support.
 Work with technology partners (e.g., Solution Designers and Architects) to research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
 Define, document, and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, considering non-functional requirements.
 Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
 Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks, and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
 Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
 Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
 Incident Management, Triaging, and provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
 Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
 Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
 Work with vendors to support business case development (consistent with technology requirements and guidelines) including benefits identification, RFI/RFP, and service level agreements.
 Coach new or less experienced colleagues and serve as a reference point throughout requirements management life cycle.




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:

 Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.
 5-7 years relevant experience.
 Experience with MS Project and MS Office Suits.
 Basic knowledge in MS SQL Server to triage the incidents.
 Commitment to applying advanced to expert knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards and related expertise, including design, development, testing and project management.
 Advanced to expert knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
 Ability to work independently as the senior or lead system analyst and coach or guide team.
 Experience and comfort level acting as a subject matter expert and consultant.




Additional Information

Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:

 Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
 Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking.




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
