Title: Student Information System Business Analyst
Description:
Applications are invited for the position of Student Information System Business Analyst in the Enrolment Services Division, located at the Welland Campus. The starting salary is $35.83/hr for a 35-hour work week. Additional hours may be required, as necessary.
 Reporting to the Associate Registrar, Systems & Reporting, working closely with Directors and Senior Managers at the College, the incumbent supports students, staff, student information system users and Information Technology Services. The incumbent plans, provides business requirements, process mapping and leading projects of core functions in Enrolment Services, aligned with strategic and operational goals of the College.
 The SIS Business Analyst evaluates business requests against existing system functionality to develop and recommend best practice methodology for the College SIS system and other student-related applications, considering and recognizing the impact on other enterprise resource planning systems.
 Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Acts as a functional lead and ITS liaison to meet all business needs for the Student Information System
Working directly with stakeholders to define clear and measurable business needs across Niagara College
Facilitating collaborative sessions with multiple stakeholders across Niagara College to extract business requirements using best practice methods and tools, across our SIS systems
Creating business systems requirements documentation in a form which is clear to the functional teams and to the ITS Systems Analysts
Testing all processes to ensure that all are functioning as expected in the new environment with Niagara College
Documenting problems or inconsistencies in processes and provide information and test data to ITS and continuing to work with them to test until problems are solved
Making recommendations to the management team when testing is complete
Documenting new and revised processes and features and create training materials as per user groups (e.g.: Enrolment Services staff)

Qualifications:

Three (3) year post-secondary diploma or degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Programming, Social Sciences, or a similar field of study
Minimum of five (5) years’ related experience in an analytical role in a large multiuser network
Experience in business process and business analysis, along with leading projects/people
Demonstrated experience developing technology solutions in business applications in collaboration with colleagues
Strong planning, organizational and analytical skills
Knowledge/familiarity with PeopleSoft Campus Solutions, and or other Student Information Systems as well as other software applications and databases
A demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office Word and Excel at an advanced level is required
Experience with PeopleSoft is an asset

Close Date: July 12, 2022
 The Position Description Form is available for review from Human Resources during the posting period. Please contact humres@niagaracollege.ca to request a copy.
 If selected for an interview, candidates must present proof of education (original transcripts/credentials). Note: Credentials obtained outside of Canada require an evaluation to determine the Canadian educational equivalence. This evaluation must support the educational requirements for the position as a condition of employment. For further information, visit: World Education Services http://www.wes.org/ca/.
 While we thank all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 Niagara College is strongly committed to diversity and inclusion within its community. We offer an inclusive work environment and welcome applications from all qualified individuals who feel they can further enhance campus diversity and equity efforts.
 If requested, accommodations will be made to support applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process.

Title: Replenishment and Supply Chain Analyst
Description:
iWear Inc. is a leading fashion eyewear company located in midtown Toronto that designs, develops and distributes fashion eyewear to retailers across North America. Our team is talented, creative and detailed-oriented as well as knowledgeable and passionate about the industry.
What are we looking for?
The Replenishment and Supply Chain Analyst is a key member of the Operations team that is accountable for the completion of selected customer replenishment reports, analyzing and monitoring purchases, inventory and service level trends and results to assist the team in achieving optimal service levels and supply chain efficiencies. The incumbent will focus on reviewing data from our systems and preparing various reports that aid in decision-making for the business. This role supports the company in achieving optimal inventory levels, flow of merchandise and forecast accuracy.
What will you be doing?

Own/Manage the Order Review Process for assigned categories and brands.
Develop allocation plans that meet the needs of our customers at both store-level and distribution centers to maintain optimal inventory levels and assortments.
Analyze current and historical sales trends to optimize inventory levels, maximize sales, improve gross margin, and mitigate obsolete inventory.
Work with the Supply Chain Coordinator to manage order lead times ensuring product in-stocks are maintained at the warehouse- and customer-level.
Analyze product assortment performance and suggest exit strategies for any poor performing SKUs
Collaborate with the Product Developers & Sales to determine optimal assortment plans and buy quantities for new product launches, promotional activities and replenishment inventory programs.
Perform analysis on sales, inventory, seasonal and promotional program post-mortems and recommend course of action to management.
Monitor and maintain data integrity, involving the manipulation of large datasets from multiple sources

What qualifications and skills do you need?
We are looking for someone with the following skills who a critical thinker, is hands-on and can roll-up their sleeves to get the job done.

2+ years experience in supply chain analysis, replenishment, inventory and demand planning, reporting, buying, assortment planning and retail planning
Exceptionally strong Microsoft Office skills especially in Excel / Advanced Excel
Detail-oriented with high sense of urgency, and ability to multitask and to adapt to quickly changing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Ability to both think strategically and execute tactically, persistent attention to detail, and extremely comfortable with numbers with sound business acumen
Outcome focused, a critical thinker with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across the entire business
Strong math, analytical and statistical skills
Post-Secondary education in business, mathematics, and/or statistics is a definite plus

Are you interested in joining our team?
We would love to hear from you. Only the candidates who have been shortlisted will be contacted.
iWear Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please let us know.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Company events
Flexible schedule
On-site parking
Work from home

Schedule:

8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:Daily screening, social distancing, encouraging masks to be worn and frequent handwashing and sanitizing.
Experience:

supply chain: 2 years (preferred)
supply chain management: 2 years (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-07-04

Title: BI Architect
Description:
A Business Intelligence (BI) Architect is required to support the definition of the technical, data and functional architecture. This architecture must initially support a scope-limited ‘minimum viable product’ (MVP), and effectively scale to meet a wide array of future needs. The successful candidate will work closely with the Senior Data Strategist to identify and elaborate the overall architecture.
 Main tasks for the BI Architect include:

Developing architecture documentation, leveraging frameworks/templates based on the company’s standards, and/or provided by the Senior Data Strategist.
Collaborating on the development of a detailed schedule/plan for architecture activities.
Scheduling, scribing and documenting architecture-related interviews and working sessions.
Performing external architecture-related research as requested by the Senior Data Strategist.
Collaborating with the Senior Data Strategist and the Architecture Advisory Group to develop criteria, evaluate and recommend an appropriate technical architecture/platform and subsequently document the platform configuration.
Collaborating with the Senior Data Strategist and the Architecture Advisory Group to develop an appropriate data architecture (how data in the environment will be modeled, managed and protected) that will meet short term MVP requirements and scale to meet an array of future needs.
Collaborating with the Senior Data Strategist and the Architecture Advisory Group to develop an appropriate functional architecture (tools and applications and how they integrate) that will meet short term MVP requirements and scale to meet an array of future needs.
Privacy of personal information and security are of paramount importance for the company. The BI Architect will therefore collaborate with other team members including the Senior Privacy and Security Advisor and key project stakeholders to ensure ‘privacy by design’ through all relevant components of the architecture.
Providing input (e.g. architecture diagrams, etc.) to the to the companies RFP Writer/Analyst, Senior Business Analyst(s) and project team members as they work to define RFP content.
Working with the Senior Data Strategist to provide detailed information, expert advice, and recommendations on strategic direction to the project team members and oversight groups regarding the overall architectural environment.
Providing written status reports which outline activities completed to date. Reports to include any outstanding issues/risks that may impact the achievement of objectives at the current time or in the immediate future.
Facilitating access to all draft materials on request and ensure that adequate feedback is obtained from appropriate stakeholders prior to delivery of any final documents. Main deliverables/work products for this resource, under the direction of the Data Strategist, are focused in the following areas, recognizing that this may not represent a complete list of deliverables as this needs to be confirmed for the companies/Data Lake MVP:

 a) Technical Architecture diagrams and supporting documentation
 b) Data and Meta-Data Architecture diagrams and supporting documentation
 c) Functional Architecture diagrams and supporting documentation
 d) Architecture-related interviews and working sessions documentation
 e) Research notes
 f) Other deliverables as required.

Title: TALENT POOL - SERVICE LEVEL MANAGEMENT ANALYST
Description:
Our priority is the health and wellness of employees and the people of Ontario. As such, this position may involve working from home for part of the duration of this position. The WSIB model mixes working from home, office and field.
  
 About the Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB)
  
 We're here to help. When an injury or illness happens on the job, we move quickly to provide wage-loss benefits, medical coverage and support to help people get back to work. Funded by businesses, we also provide no-fault collective liability insurance and access to industry-specific health and safety information. We are one of the largest insurance organizations in North America covering over five million people in more than 300,000 workplaces across Ontario. For more information, visit wsib.ca.
  
 At the WSIB, you'll have the opportunity to:
  

explore many career paths and follow your passion
continuously learn and grow professionally
be recognized for the great work you do
participate in programs that support your health and wellbeing

 You'll also receive a competitive salary and may be eligible to participate in our health and dental plan.
  
 Salary Grade: 212 From: $79,613.31 
  
 2 Temporary Positions up to 12 months
  
 OPS Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Accessibility, and Anti-Racism: We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.
  
 We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.
  
 Visit the 
  OPS Anti-Racism Policy and the 
  OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.
  
 We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of Ontario's 
  Human Rights Code. Refer to the "How to apply" section if you require a disability-related accommodation.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role? Responsible for the planning, implementation, control, review and audit of IT service provisioning in the context of stated business and technology strategies for assigned portfolio. This includes negotiation, implementation and monitoring of services and operating level agreements, both from internal and vendor teams that support high-visibility, mission-focused, large dollar value enterprise IT services.
   Provide and maintain a single source of consistent information on net new and existing operational services and ensure that the Service Catalogue (end user-facing) is current and widely available to support stated business and technology strategies.
  
 How do I qualify?
 Major Duties & Responsibilities Operational Effectiveness and Controls
  

Lead the creation and management of the process and service improvement plan.
Develop and implement a communication plan for publicizing and promoting the process and service improvement plans via the IT Service Management roadmap
Develop and maintain strong working relationships by establishing clear points of contact, processes and procedures with key stakeholders, including IT Service Leads, IT Process Owners, supplier partners, and internal clients to refine the current IT support environment.
Ensure significant new services have metrics, reporting requirements clearly stated and reporting requirements are agreed to by IT Service Leads
Define triggers for event-driven service level management activities
Measure, collect, report, evaluate and analyze data on all integrated IT service provider processes, procedures and controls and identify opportunities for optimization in the context of stated business and technology strategies
Identify critical success factors, metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) in process analysis and design in the context of stated business and technology and strategies
Conduct ongoing, end-to-end service reviews with representatives of each integrated IT service provider to assess required measurements and process and service improvement plans
Analyze satisfaction across the entire client experience and assess service improvement plans based upon service level agreements (SLA) and operational level agreements (OLA)
Implement and maintain the capability for compilation, collation, maintenance, and publishing of service level and operating level measures for all integrated IT service providers, including the ability to:
 o Provide a view of service and operating levels by enterprise and client
   o Provide a view of source data and measures that accumulate into each service level and operating level measure
   o Provide a dashboard view of service levels and operating level status in real time and point in time
  
 Service Catalogue (user-facing)
  

Identify services that should be included in the Service Catalogue
Ensure catalogue of available services (end-user facing) is created, amended, and maintained, and that items are retired, as required
Document the service offering in terms familiar to business clients and end users
Ensure all stakeholders sign-off on their service offerings
Develop and implement a communication plan for publicizing and promoting the Service Catalogue to ITC and its clients
Lead discussions with the team responsible for the IT service management software tool (e.g. ServiceNow) to develop applications for routing, e.g. requests and incidents for new and existing services
Complete regular reviews of the Service Catalogue with internal stakeholders to ensure relevance to stated business and technology strategies
Develop and provide monthly deliverables which will: Assess and recommend updates to Service Catalogue entries for existing services; Identify and provide a report on existing services for addition to the Service Catalogue; Service Portfolio Reports; Service Portfolio Risk Management Plans

 Service Delivery
  

Ensure that each integrated IT service provider service delivery is monitored effectively and that identified actions to maintain or improve levels of service are implemented via facilitated meetings in accordance with the defined ITC supplier governance framework
Manage adherence to, and ensure effective reporting of, progress against targets in service level agreements (SLAs) and operating level agreements (OLAs), and Service Request Fulfillment
Actively manage service levels, with the primary focus on prevention of failures and swift corrective actions when necessary, and to understand requirements for proposed new services and changes to services, by working in close collaboration with the all other ITIL disciplines within ITC (e.g. Service Request, Incident, Problem, Change, Release Management)
Resolve/monitor client escalations as appropriate
Review service delivery to ensure that agreed targets are met and prepare proposals to meet forecast changes in the level or type of service levels
Diagnose service delivery problems and initiate actions to maintain or improve levels of service
Gather and document requirements in accordance with pre-approved standards / templates, negotiate, write, maintain, and obtain IT Service Owner and IT Process Owner (may be multiple stakeholders) sign-off for all new / developing / changing / retired service levels
Review and provide input during Underpinning Contract (UC) negotiations/renewals with integrated IT service providers to ensure contract commitments align with established internal OLAs
Develop and implement a communication plan for promoting awareness of change impacts

 Reporting
  

Research, produce, present routine management and client-facing reports that reflect integrated IT service provider performance and identify trends and improvement opportunities in accordance with the IT Service Management Governance Framework
Monitor, analyze and publish daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly/annual metrics demonstrating the effectiveness of the Service Management process
Interpret metrics for IT stakeholders, in the context of stated business and technology strategies
Reference specific metrics as agreed with IT stakeholders, and highlight critical service anomalies
Ensure service reporting is readily available for all IT stakeholders in formats which meet their needs
Ensure all integrated IT services are appropriately monitored so that the required KPIs can be tracked
Provide a suite of regular metrics reporting and analysis across multiple service areas
Provide consolidated service reporting for designated portfolio of integrated IT service providers using leading industry tools that show current period, prior periods, and data trends and results
Utilize the necessary measurement and monitoring tools and procedures required to measure and report performance against the applicable service levels
Design and develop IT service management dashboards and reports in compliance with the IT Service Management Governance Framework, ensuring data is formatted, processed into information, and analyzed to deliver timely, accurate, and continuous feedback to decision-makers across integrated IT service providers

 Perform other related duties as assigned or required.
  
 Job Requirements Education
  

University completion at undergraduate level with a specialty focus in Business, Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics with one or more of the following: Agile Service Manager certification, COBIT certification, DevOps certification, ITIL Certification, Supplier Relationship Management certification.

 Experience
  

Five years prior experience in IT service management.

Title: Senior Business Application Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Business Application Ownership and Management at TD is part of an enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. We strive to be the better bank, and in this role, we'll count on you to be our interface between business and technology.  We're looking for highly analytical, collaborative, and agile professionals who can merge and translate data to build business momentum and deliver results.  Using professional and experiential knowledge, the Business Application Ownership and Management team works in close partnership with corporate functions and technology, as well as aligns to project management, business analysis, business management, strategy, and governance.  If you get business application management, its potential and power, we think you'll love working with like-minded and innovative experts at TD, where you can help drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.



Job Description

About this Role
 Are you a conceptual and analytical thinker, comfortable working solo or together with a team? Are your leadership abilities emerging and ready to embrace bigger challenges? In this expert level professional role, you will lead specialized business application management activities for a designated functional area and support application/services changes through their lifecycle.
 As a Senior Business Application Analyst, you will:

 Elicit, analyze, document, communicate, and manage requirements/user stories with stakeholders and pod members by applying a variety of elicitation techniques to probe, challenge, and understand requirements according to the requirements management discipline and alignment to TD standards/processes, industry best practices and NEW Agile @ Scale framework
 Identify, document, and validate current state processes and work with stakeholders to design the desire future state
 Lead requirements management from high level, mid level to detailed level business requirements (including business use cases/scenarios, business rules, business process maps, customer data flows, themes/initiatives) and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications considering non-functional requirements and accessibility standards (i.e., epics, stories, tasks, etc.)
 Support PO in the development of story map and creation of epics and spikes/enablers that require additional technical expertise
 Lead and facilitate user story refinement ceremonies
 Bridge the communication between PO and development/QE members, and lead the delivery of requirements/user stories across the pod
 Active participation in all POD ceremonies including PI Planning, Sprint Planning, Daily Standups, End of Sprint Demo/showcases, and Retrospectives
 Establish and maintain full requirements traceability (Feature > HLR > Epic > WFs > detailed level User Stories)
 Collaborate with PO, DCX, risk and technology partners to refine, estimate, prioritize and break down user stories into consumable size (i.e., completed within one sprint)
 Proactively identify, communicate, and track requirement risks, issues, assumptions, dependencies, constraints
 Provide recommendation to support the development of system design, test plans, and necessary artifacts to ensure business needs are met
 Adhere to Enterprise project governance controls to ensure projects meet all performance, quality and compliance standards and conforms to appropriate disciplines
 Contribute to Quality Assurance activities by supporting the development of test scripts and testing of developed solutions, including communication of issues and resolution
 Provide sound technical knowledge and foundational understanding of the various components of the applications, supported by the team in relation to system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules (ex. UI, native vs web based, API, mid-tier/backend)




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD?
 Share your most relevant experience, credentials, and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
    
 Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
 Five (5) or more years relevant business analysis experience
 Expert knowledge of business-supported applications and PDLC/Agile methodology along with policies, procedures and practices, competitors, and market trends
 Proficiency in using analytical software tools, MS Office, process modeling, data analysis methods and reporting techniques, and Atlassian (Confluence, Jira, and its installed add-ons)
 Ardent to work multi-functionally and independently, communicate (both in speaking and writing), provide direction or assistance and build positive working relationships across teams and functions through strong analytical and problem-solving skills
   


Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Studio Business Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  SSENSE, pronounced [es-uhns], is a Montreal-based fashion platform with global reach. Founded in 2003, SSENSE is pacing the vanguard of directional retail with a mix of luxury, streetwear, and avant-garde labels. We produce industry-leading original content and take pride in building our own technology solutions and systems from scratch. Our field of focus has grown beyond that of a typical e-commerce entity as we explore the nexus of content, commerce, and culture.
 Currently serving 150 countries, generating an average of 88 million monthly page views, and achieving high double digit annual growth since inception, SSENSE is becoming a cultural protagonist in its own right.



 Job Description
  Reporting to the Manager of Studio Planning & Strategy, the Studio Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing requirements to support all projects and strategic initiatives across Studio operations. This role will directly partner with various business units to help develop long-term strategies in key initiatives that drive growth and profitability improvements. The Analyst is responsible for formulating clear recommendations on how to improve internal processes, and enhance our production by analyzing data from various sources, creating dashboards and mapping out operational processes. The ideal candidate will work cross-functionally, and have a collaborative style, with the ability to influence and motivate to drive performance results.
 Reporting & Data Analysis (60%)

 Actively participate in assessing current and future data needs that can scale with the the business
 Evaluate and improve the data quality and completeness of the data available to Studio
 Establish key performance indicators, and streamline and improve internal and external reporting dashboards to provide visibility to the business on operational performance, as well as ensuring methods for reporting are maintained
 Translate all Studio strategic and growth initiatives into operational metrics and dashboards to monitor project performance results
 Carry out ad-hoc reporting and data analysis requests, articulate metrics and establish analytical models for various forecasting needs
 Work in close collaboration with Data Operations team to build dashboards and reports

 Strategy & Growth Support (20%)

 Participate in developing business cases for studio initiatives relating to new ways of working, including new or improved technology solution and corporate initiatives that are supported by studio operations
 Suggest thoughtful methodologies to analyze business requirements within a project `
 Liaise and collaborate with various SMES and business stakeholders of the Studio, including Finance, Technology, Product, and Real Estate, to socialize strategy, to gather project requirements, and to understand user needs
 Document needs and business requirements from internal and external stakeholders for assigned projects

 Business Processes & Integration (20%)

 Streamline and optimize internal processes and interaction flow with various stakeholders of the Studio, including Finance, Technology, Product, and Real Estate, to contribute to data alignment and to ensure integration of growth initiatives
 Maintain and improve the Studio Planning Team knowledge base through standard, concise and relevant documentation




 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field
 2-3 years of experience in business analysis, data analysis or project management
 Prior experience in data processing, manipulating large datasets, querying databases, data analysis, and reporting
 Experience with data management and visualization software such as Tableau or similar data discovery and visualization tools, an asset
 Knowledge of process mapping software (Lucidchart, Visio)
 Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint
 General knowledge of programming concepts and logic
 Excellent English written and verbal communication skills, French an asset

 Skills

 Capacity to synthesize and simplify complex information
 Detail oriented with a results-driven mindset
 Highly analytical with the ability to present exec-level recommendations and influence through sound quantitative and qualitative analysis
 Ability to thrive in a fast-paced performance-driven environment, juggling multiple projects/multi-task and work effectively under pressure
 Strong interest in retail and e-commerce and a passion for shaping the future of e-commerce an asset
 Knowledge of fashion, styling and photography, an asset
 Solution-oriented mindset and can-do attitude to overcome challenges
 Team player with a natural ability to build relationships and collaborate

Title: Senior Solar Analyst - Remote Canada
Description:
About Clir:

 Clir Renewables is on a mission to reduce humankind's impact on the planet. We do this by accelerating the transition to renewable energy by improving the economics of projects and empowering owners to maximize financial returns. Combining 200 GW of contextual operational dataset with powerful AI that is built, designed, and supported by decades of renewable energy expertise, Clir provides insights and tools needed to assess and optimize wind and solar projects.

 Named one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies by the Globe and Mail’s Report on Business, Clir was founded in 2017. Headquartered in Vancouver, with hubs in Glasgow and Calgary, we’re a remote company with employees located across the globe and from the entire energy supply chain. Clir has empowered owners across Europe, Africa, the Americas, and Asia to achieve multi-million dollars in cumulative gains.

 You are:


 Passionate about our core values (communication, sustainability, inclusion, impact, and innovation).
Genuinely interested in renewable power and excited to help drive output up and operating costs down.
Eager to understand our varied clients’ motivations and needs.
At ease talking with both solar farm site supervisors about their weekly. maintenance plans, while equally at ease talking with OEMs about the performance challenges of their equipment.
Motivated to contribute to the design, processes, and growth of a software start-up.


What you’ll be doing:


 Perform analytics to identify production-increasing improvements to customers’ farms, monitor asset health, and manage technical and financial risks
Drive and manage customer analytics objectives, tasks, and new methods & innovations projects [for Clir’s core products and services]
Develop, test, and provide feedback on analytics workflows, tools, prototypes, and processes
Drive optimization realization, operator and OEM discussions, and growth opportunities
Provide technical leadership, mentor the team, and cultivate cross-functional knowledge sharing



 This position is remote-friendly and open to candidates across Canada, however we will also accept candidates located in the UK.

 What you’ll need:


 An understanding of technical and commercial aspects of solar farm operations.
Experience in the design, service, and/or operation of solar farms 
   
SCADA systems, historians
Preconstruction or operational yield assessments
Knowledge of solar inverter operation is beneficial

A technical and data analytics mindset.
Strong analytical skills, including some of: 
   
Excel, Tableau, SQL, Python, PVSyst

Written and verbal English language communication skills.


Bonus:


 Experience working for a solar farm developer, OEM, or engineering consultancy
Experience assessing technical risk of solar farm assets
Fluency in another language


What’s in it for you:


 Opportunity to work in an inclusive and diverse workplace
Be part of a team who are focused on reducing our impact on the environment
A chance to grow your skills and career alongside a supportive team of mentorship-focused developers
Medical insurance & dental care
Professional development benefits
Flexible schedule
Work from home friendly



 At Clir Renewables, diversity and inclusion are not words we take lightly. These are words we take to heart, we drive to better understand our biases, and recognize that we have more work to do to create a workforce that truly represents those who our product serves. We strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, and life experiences to apply.

 As a partially remote organization, Clir works hard to ensure the safety of all clients and employees through the authentication of prospective employees and their backgrounds. Successful candidates may be subject to a background check conducted by Clir, and will need to demonstrate the legal right to work in Canada, the UK, or any area in which they wish to conduct work by showing proof of a valid work permit, visa, residency, or citizenship.

Title: Supply Chain Analyst
Description:
About the Role 
We are seeking an experienced Supply Chain Analyst to join our Supply Chain (SC) department. 
Reporting to Team Lead, the Supply Chain Analyst will be responsible for ensuring on time delivery, inventory optimization, and customer satisfaction in order to achieve the corporate objectives. 
The Supply Chain Analyst will work directly with customers, overseas and local manufacturers, to coordinate supply. Along with working on day-to-day supply chain planning activities, the Analyst will ensure that Avnan’s customers are provided with the information they require to be successful. 
Additionally, the Supply Chain Analyst will participate and drive supply chain solutions that will provide value to Avnan’s customer’s business. 


In this role, the Supply Chain Manager is responsible for:
 On Time Delivery 


Prime contact with the factories, own on time to delivery/customer commit
Address issues when they arise aiming for minimum disruption
Closely coordinate and communicate customer action plans with supply factories and/or logistics
Log customer delays and analyze trends for root causes
 Forecast & Inventory 


Interact with sales, the customer, and finance to understand demand forecast drivers
Review historical sales trends, understand the product, prepare forecast data
Analyze data to identify problematic areas and suggest improvements
Discover the most cost-effective shipping modes and schedules
Inventory, review component, and finish goods inventory levels and adjust to match current demand
Developing inventory strategies on existing items, new products, and product phase-outs
 System & Data Accuracy 


Finish Goods P.O. - create, maintain accuracy, verify supplier invoice and receipt entry
Jobs - create, maintain accuracy, verify supplier invoice/ inventory consumption and receipt entry
Customer, Supplier and parts master data
Component and finished goods inventory accuracy
 Continuous Improvements 


Plan and implement supply chain optimization projects that reduce cost, improve performance and/or delight customers
Track KPIs and report on supply chain’s performance, and work towards continues improvements of the KPIs
 Account & Relationship Management 


Develop strong relationships with key customer contacts at designated accounts
Proactively anticipate customer questions and plan ahead of time
Tactfully probe to gather information regardless of customer issues and problems
Work to resolve issues, utilizing internal departments as required
Communicate clearly with customers to keep them updated on their order status and any changes that arise
Develop a productive relationship with suppliers working toward a partnership
 About You 


Our ideal candidate has:


Post-secondary education in Supply Chain, Material Management or Logistics
CSCP, CPIM, CLTD, CSMA, CITT or P.Log complete or scheduled to complete within the next year
Proficiency in Supply Chain concepts, APICS CPIM or equivalent certification is an asset
Lean/Six Sigma, Continuous Improvement or equivalent experience
Experience working in electronics manufacturing, EMS, ODM or OEM is an asset
Minimum 1 year experience in Forecast, Planning, Purchasing, Inventory Control or other Supply Chain roles
 Skills 


Able to review and setup supply chain management solutions and contracts
Able to provide strong customer-facing supply chain support
Suggest continuous improvement projects and lead small projects
Able to write process and training documents
Understanding SCM and ERP systems
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft office applications (Excel)
Basic understanding of electronic components familiar with manufacturing
Strong communication skills (writer and spoken)
 About Avnan 

 Avnan is an award-winning global electronics engineering company that works in partnership with original equipment manufacturers to deliver best-in-class customized product design solutions, supply chain logistics management and manufacturing. 

 Headquartered in Canada for over 25 years, Avnan leverages its global network of manufacturing partners along with its engineering expertise to provide a single point of accountability for electronic product solutions that is cost effective, high quality and simplifies operational logistics. Avnan operates in a wide variety of industries including consumer appliances, commercial and residential building systems managing the process from design to assembly and final delivery. 

 At Avnan, you’ll have the opportunity to work on a variety of different projects. You’ll become a part of our close-knit team, with the opportunity to see how your work directly impacts our business and our customers’ business. We believe in promoting a progressive, forward looking, growth mindset setting high standards for quality and providing our teams with the support to achieve their performance goals. 

 Our flexible work arrangements allow you to enjoy a work-life balance that ensures you are at your most productive. With our focus on diversity, you are exposed to various types of culture and work styles providing you with the opportunity for personal growth and professional development. 

 Please note while we thank you for your interest, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls or agencies please. 

 We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to building a work environment that is both diverse and inclusive. You will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, creed, disability, or age.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Husky Technologies TM a company with a strong foundation built on innovation, close customer relationships, a strong sense of community and a unique culture and values. We are looking for people with the inspiration and talent to develop with us as we pursue our ambitious growth strategy.
 Husky Technologies TM offers a wealth of opportunity for personal growth and development. Most importantly, Husky Technologies TM offers an opportunity to work with – and be challenged by – a team of great people. Our success is possible because of the creativity, intelligence and passion of our people around the world and their desire to lead change. At the same time, we are not afraid to expect a lot and strive for leadership in all of our key markets. We are a company taking on new challenges and for the right people this means exceptional career development opportunities, the chance to be part of a team that is the best in the world at what we do and the experience that comes from working in an environment that demands constant transformation and innovation.
 Husky Technologies TM Canadian manufacturing facilities and global headquarters are located in Bolton, Ontario on a large, beautiful campus located just 20 minutes north of Toronto’s Pearson International Airport. Features include a fitness and wellness center, intramural sports activities, on-site cafeteria, and clean, state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities with outstanding safety records. We offer a great work environment and competitive total compensation package, including above market retirement savings plan and market competitive group benefits.
 Husky Technologies TM is an exciting company with tremendous potential. We have a great team and great expectations. If you are attracted to bold goals, believe in uncompromising honesty, support mutual respect, care about environmental responsibility, have a passion for excellence and a desire to make a positive contribution – then we want you to join the Husky Technologies TM team!










JOB PURPOSE
 Responsible for building the business intelligence system for the company, based on the internal and external data structures. Responsible for leading the design and support of enterprise-wide business intelligence applications and architecture. Works with enterprise-wide business and IT senior management to understand and prioritize data and information requirements. Solves complex technical problems. Optimizes the performance of enterprise business intelligence tools by defining data elements which contribute to data insights which add value to the user. Creates testing methodology and criteria. Designs and coordinates a curriculum for coaching and training customers in the use of business intelligence tools to enhance business decision-making capability. Develops standards, policies, and procedures for the form, structure, and attributes of the business intelligence tools and systems. Develops data/information quality metrics. Researches new technology and develops business cases to support enterprise-wide business intelligence solutions.
 OTHER KEY RELATIONSHIPS Operational Business Leads, Business Analysts, Data, Architecture and Technology leads, Software Developers, Digitization Stream Leads

                 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
                

Leading BI software development, deployment and maintenance
Report curation, template definition and analytical data modeling
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements
Translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources
Identifies and resolves data reporting issues in a timely fashion, while looking for continuous improvement opportunities.
Build solutions that create value and resolve business problems
Provide technical guidance to designers and other stakeholders
Work effectively with members of Digital Solutions Team
"Installs, configures, deploys, and tunes analytics toolsand servers"
Troubleshoots analytics tool problems and tunes for performance
Develops semantic layer and analytics query objects for end users
Translation of business questions and requirements into reports, views, and analytics query objects



                 CRITICAL CAPABILITIES
                

Strong problem-solving and metadata skills
Teamwork and commitment to reaching the goals of the project and Husky
Ownership, accountability and speed of execution
Knowledge of analytics tool architectures, functions, and features


 EDUCATION University Degree or Community College Diploma: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent experience
 QUALIFICATION

                 Understanding of ERP and Operational systems databases, knowledge of database programming 
                

Highly skilled at writing SQL queries with large scale, complex datasets
Experience in data visualization and data storytelling
Experience designing, debugging and deploying software in VSTS (Azure Dev/Ops) development environment
Experience with Microsoft BI stack - Power BI and SQL Server Analysis Services


 EXPERIENCE 2+ years of Business Intelligence or Report development experience











Husky Technologies TM offers a competitive compensation and benefits package and excellent opportunities for growth and advancement. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and respect, value and welcome diversity in our workplace. Husky Technologies TM also values being a great place to work and strives to maintain a safe workplace. Accordingly, Husky Technologies TM conditions all offers of employment on satisfactory completion of background checks.

 Husky Technologies TM is committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the member of the Talent Acquisition team in a timely fashion of any disabilities that requires accommodation measures in order to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner.
 Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
 No agency or telephone inquiries please.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
BI Developer, Intermediate 
Working within the Corporate IT team you will design, implement, and maintain BI and analytics Solutions including data mapping, design, development, testing and technical documentation. You will also maintain and troubleshoot new and existing BI Solutions. 

About Linamar 
Linamar Corporation is a Canadian diversified global manufacturing company of highly engineered products across global industries & markets. From the entrepreneurial seeds planted by our dynamic founder, to the support provided along the way, all Linamar employees are poised for success in this fast-paced and rapidly growing environment. With access to the tools you need to succeed, you will make an impact along with other motivated and engaged people. 
Key Accountabilities 
· Provide 2nd tier support to existing BI Solutions. 
· Develop reports to designed specifications. 
· Work collaboratively with the business and IT to analyze requirements, propose, execute, and support BI and Reporting projects. 
· Support the team with analyzing business needs and determining appropriate data, report design, and processes to deliver relevant BI solutions that leverage best practices. 
· Design and build BI user interfaces. 
· Design and build data models to support self-service BI. 
· Asist with end-user training as needed. 
· Act as primary ongoing owner for support of implemented reports and reporting tools. 
· Support Data Warehouse enhancements and operations. 
· Work with Business SME and Business and Systems Analysts to define reporting requirements and goals and to identify the data needed for meeting business requirements. 
· Develop and maintain report blueprints documentation, data dictionary and related meta-data stores. 
· Develop routines and procedures for end-users to facilitate best practices use of reporting tools and applications. 
· Assist Global BI Team members with the design and development of reports and usage of self-service BI tools. 
· Researches, analyzes, recommends, and implements new methods, standard processes, best practices, and techniques for developing BI Solutions. 
Minimum Requirements 
· University degree in computer science, information sciences, data science, or a related field. 
· Microsoft database certifications are recommended. 
· Microsoft Power BI Services, Power BI Desktop, Power BI Reporting Server. 
· Must have excellent hands-on experience working with Microsoft Power BI 
· A minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience working with Microsoft Power Query and M query language. 
· A minimum of 3 years of experience with Tabular data models, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) and Data transformations (measures, calculated, columns, joins) 
· A minimum of 5 years of experience with Data Modeling, Excel and relationship building. 
· Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SISS) 
· Proven documentation skills. 
Desired Characteristics 
· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. 
· Ability to work both independently and in a team environment. 
· Abe to work in a fast paced environment. 
· Critical thinking to analyze and clearly identify the root cause of any issue. 

Why Linamar 
· Opportunities for career advancement 
· Assistance with approved professional designations and fees 
· Community based outreach supporting both local and global initiatives and charities 
· Social committees and sports teams

Title: Analyste en éthique et en conformité - Ethics Compliance Analyst
Description:
Role and Responsibilities
 


 (English will follow)



   Sommaire du rôle
 


   La personne choisie au poste d’analyste en éthique et en conformité fera partie du Bureau mondial de l’éthique et de la conformité, et interagira avec des collègues des services des affaires juridiques, du contrôle des exportations, de finance, de l’approvisionnement et des unités d'affaires, sur un large éventail de questions de conformité essentielles pour atténuer les risques juridiques et de conformité.
 

   Plus précisément, l’analyste en éthique et conformité assumera des responsabilités importantes relativement à nos processus de diligence raisonnable, à la gestion des ententes contractuelles avec nos partenaires d’affaires, à la revue de leurs rapports d’activités et au processus de renouvellement de leur relation d’affaires avec CAE. L’analyse en éthique et conformité assumera aussi un rôle conseil auprès des collègues de CAE relativement à la mise en œuvre de processus de diligence raisonnable pour les tiers. Enfin, la personne choisie assistera les membres du bureau mondial de l’éthique et de la conformité dans l’exécution de certaines tâches liées aux enquêtes internes et à la gestion des risques juridiques et de conformité.
 


   Tâches et responsabilités
 

 Responsable d’exécuter les demandes de diligence raisonnables pour les partenaires d’affaires ainsi que pour les clients et fournisseurs à haut risque.
 Recueillir tous les renseignements nécessaires pour mener à bien nos processus de diligence raisonnable fondés sur les risques.
 Effectuer une revue de premier niveau des questionnaires de diligence raisonnable et autres renseignements recueillis afin d'identifier les signaux d'alarme potentiels et les domaines nécessitant une revue .plus approfondie.
 Agir comme personne-ressource et point de contact pour toute questions des collègues de CAE concernant nos processus de diligence raisonnable fondé sur les risques.
 Compiler et analyser les données afin de produire des rapports de diligence raisonnable qui mettent en lumière les risques juridiques et de conformité.
 Gérer les ententes contractuelles avec les partenaires d’affaires et s’assurer que ces ententes soient renouvelées ou résiliées à échéance conformément à nos politiques.
 Exécuter certaines tâches liées aux enquêtes internes, comme la revue et l’analyse documentaire et la préparation de comptes-rendus lors d’entrevue.
 Assurer le suivi et la coordination des activités de formation relatives aux programmes d'éthique et de conformité de CAE.
 S'assurer que les exceptions relevées Code d’éthique professionnelle et aux politiques et procédures corporatives de CAE ou les violations présumées aux lois et règlements sont documentées de manière appropriée, cohérente et complète.
 Effectuer d'autres tâches à la demande du leader mondial, Éthique et conformité.



   Expérience et qualifications
 

 Minimum de 1 à 3 ans d'expérience dans la réalisation d'activités ou de tâches de conformité dans un environnement commercial.
 Expérience dans la préparation de rapports de conformité et le traitement de nombreux jeux de données.
 Expérience dans le suivi et la mise en œuvre de programmes de conformité.
 Une expérience dans les processus de diligence raisonnable fondée sur les risques pour les tiers est préférable.
 Une expérience dans l'administration des contrats est préférable.
 Une formation/qualification en droit ou en comptabilité est un atout.



   Connaissances
 

 Compréhension des programmes de lutte contre la corruption.
 Compréhension des exigences en matière de sanctions, de contrôles d’exportation, de droits humains, de concurrence et de lutte contre le blanchiment d'argent.



   Compétences et attributs
 

 Accorde une grande importance à l'intégrité dans les affaires.
 Sûr de soi et confiant dans une variété de contextes, avec une forte croyance en ses propres capacités.
 Capacité avérée à présenter efficacement des informations à d'autres personnes.
 Capacité avérée à résoudre les conflits entre des groupes ayant des perspectives, des objectifs ou des priorités opposées.
 Solides compétences en communication orale et écrite - Français et Anglais.
 Compétences en matière de planification, de gestion de projets, de résolution de problèmes et de gestion du changement.
 Familiarité avec la résolution de problèmes et l'adoption d'une approche proportionnelle et fondée sur les risques.
 Maîtrise de PowerPoint, Excel et des outils connexes de Microsoft Office.
 Faire preuve d'un haut niveau d'objectivité, d'intégrité, de motivation, d'esprit d'équipe, de professionnalisme et de fiabilité.



   ********************
 


   Summary of the role
 


   The successful candidate for the Ethics and Compliance Analyst position will be part of the Global Ethics and Compliance Office, interacting with colleagues in Legal, Export Control, Finance, Procurement and Business Units on a wide range of compliance issues critical to mitigating legal and compliance risks.
 

   Specifically, the Ethics and Compliance Analyst will have significant responsibilities in relation to our due diligence processes, our contract management process with business partners, the review of activity reports and the renewal of business relationships. The Ethics and Compliance Analyst will also assume an advisory role with CAE colleagues in the implementation of third- party due diligence processes. Finally, the successful candidate will assist members of the Global Ethics and Compliance Office in performing certain tasks related to internal investigations and risk management.
 


   Duties and responsibilities
 

 Responsible for performing risk-based due diligence on business partners as well as high risk customers and suppliers.
 Gather all information necessary to conduct the due diligence process.
 Conduct a first level review of due diligence questionnaires and other information collected to identify potential red flags and areas requiring further review.
 Act as a point of contact for any questions from CAE colleagues regarding our risk-based due diligence processes.
 Compile and analyze data to produce due diligence reports that highlight legal and compliance risks.
 Manage contractual agreements with business partners and ensure that agreements are renewed or terminated upon expiration in accordance with our policies.
 Perform certain tasks related to internal investigations, such as document review and analysis and preparation of interview reports.
 Monitor and coordinate training activities related to CAE's ethics and compliance programs.
 Ensure that exceptions to CAE's Code of Business Conduct and corporate policies and procedures or suspected violations of laws and regulations are documented in an appropriate, consistent and complete manner.
 Perform other duties as requested by the Global Leader, Ethics and Compliance.



   Experience & Qualifications
 

 Minimum 1-3 years of experience in performing compliance activities or tasks in a business environment.
 Experience in preparing compliance reports and handling large datasets.
 Experience in compliance program monitoring and implementation.
 Experience performing risk-based due diligence on third parties is preferred.
 Experience in contract administration is preferred.
 Legal or accounting education/qualifications are an asset.



   Knowledge
 

 Core understanding of the general principles of compliance, particularly as it impacts Anti-Bribery and Anti-Corruption programs.
 Understanding of sanctions, trade controls, and human rights is an asset.



   Skills & Attributes
 

 Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, and related Microsoft Office tools.
 Places a high value on doing business with integrity.
 Self-assured and confident in a variety of settings with strong belief in own capabilities.
 Demonstrated ability to present information effectively to others.
 Demonstrated ability to resolve conflict between groups with opposing perspectives, objectives, or priorities.
 Strong oral and written communication skills - French and English.
 Planning, project-management, problem-solving and change management skills.
 Familiarity with resolving issues and taking a proportionate and risk-based approach to compliance due diligence.
 Demonstrates personal traits of a high level of judgement, integrity, motivation, team orientation, professionalism, and trustworthiness.



   #LI-ND1
 


   Position Type
 

 Regular
 

   CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.
 


   Equal Employment Opportunity
 

   At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.
 


   As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.
 


   At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.
 


   The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

Title: Supply Chain Analyst
Description:
About the Role 
We are seeking an experienced Supply Chain Analyst to join our Supply Chain (SC) department. 
Reporting to Team Lead, the Supply Chain Analyst will be responsible for ensuring on time delivery, inventory optimization, and customer satisfaction in order to achieve the corporate objectives. 
The Supply Chain Analyst will work directly with customers, overseas and local manufacturers, to coordinate supply. Along with working on day-to-day supply chain planning activities, the Analyst will ensure that Avnan’s customers are provided with the information they require to be successful. 
Additionally, the Supply Chain Analyst will participate and drive supply chain solutions that will provide value to Avnan’s customer’s business. 


In this role, the Supply Chain Manager is responsible for:
 On Time Delivery 


Prime contact with the factories, own on time to delivery/customer commit
Address issues when they arise aiming for minimum disruption
Closely coordinate and communicate customer action plans with supply factories and/or logistics
Log customer delays and analyze trends for root causes
 Forecast & Inventory 


Interact with sales, the customer, and finance to understand demand forecast drivers
Review historical sales trends, understand the product, prepare forecast data
Analyze data to identify problematic areas and suggest improvements
Discover the most cost-effective shipping modes and schedules
Inventory, review component, and finish goods inventory levels and adjust to match current demand
Developing inventory strategies on existing items, new products, and product phase-outs
 System & Data Accuracy 


Finish Goods P.O. - create, maintain accuracy, verify supplier invoice and receipt entry
Jobs - create, maintain accuracy, verify supplier invoice/ inventory consumption and receipt entry
Customer, Supplier and parts master data
Component and finished goods inventory accuracy
 Continuous Improvements 


Plan and implement supply chain optimization projects that reduce cost, improve performance and/or delight customers
Track KPIs and report on supply chain’s performance, and work towards continues improvements of the KPIs
 Account & Relationship Management 


Develop strong relationships with key customer contacts at designated accounts
Proactively anticipate customer questions and plan ahead of time
Tactfully probe to gather information regardless of customer issues and problems
Work to resolve issues, utilizing internal departments as required
Communicate clearly with customers to keep them updated on their order status and any changes that arise
Develop a productive relationship with suppliers working toward a partnership
 About You 


Our ideal candidate has:


Post-secondary education in Supply Chain, Material Management or Logistics
CSCP, CPIM, CLTD, CSMA, CITT or P.Log complete or scheduled to complete within the next year
Proficiency in Supply Chain concepts, APICS CPIM or equivalent certification is an asset
Lean/Six Sigma, Continuous Improvement or equivalent experience
Experience working in electronics manufacturing, EMS, ODM or OEM is an asset
Minimum 1 year experience in Forecast, Planning, Purchasing, Inventory Control or other Supply Chain roles
 Skills 


Able to review and setup supply chain management solutions and contracts
Able to provide strong customer-facing supply chain support
Suggest continuous improvement projects and lead small projects
Able to write process and training documents
Understanding SCM and ERP systems
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft office applications (Excel)
Basic understanding of electronic components familiar with manufacturing
Strong communication skills (writer and spoken)
 About Avnan 

 Avnan is an award-winning global electronics engineering company that works in partnership with original equipment manufacturers to deliver best-in-class customized product design solutions, supply chain logistics management and manufacturing. 

 Headquartered in Canada for over 25 years, Avnan leverages its global network of manufacturing partners along with its engineering expertise to provide a single point of accountability for electronic product solutions that is cost effective, high quality and simplifies operational logistics. Avnan operates in a wide variety of industries including consumer appliances, commercial and residential building systems managing the process from design to assembly and final delivery. 

 At Avnan, you’ll have the opportunity to work on a variety of different projects. You’ll become a part of our close-knit team, with the opportunity to see how your work directly impacts our business and our customers’ business. We believe in promoting a progressive, forward looking, growth mindset setting high standards for quality and providing our teams with the support to achieve their performance goals. 

 Our flexible work arrangements allow you to enjoy a work-life balance that ensures you are at your most productive. With our focus on diversity, you are exposed to various types of culture and work styles providing you with the opportunity for personal growth and professional development. 

 Please note while we thank you for your interest, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls or agencies please. 

 We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to building a work environment that is both diverse and inclusive. You will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, creed, disability, or age.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Husky Technologies TM a company with a strong foundation built on innovation, close customer relationships, a strong sense of community and a unique culture and values. We are looking for people with the inspiration and talent to develop with us as we pursue our ambitious growth strategy.
 Husky Technologies TM offers a wealth of opportunity for personal growth and development. Most importantly, Husky Technologies TM offers an opportunity to work with – and be challenged by – a team of great people. Our success is possible because of the creativity, intelligence and passion of our people around the world and their desire to lead change. At the same time, we are not afraid to expect a lot and strive for leadership in all of our key markets. We are a company taking on new challenges and for the right people this means exceptional career development opportunities, the chance to be part of a team that is the best in the world at what we do and the experience that comes from working in an environment that demands constant transformation and innovation.
 Husky Technologies TM Canadian manufacturing facilities and global headquarters are located in Bolton, Ontario on a large, beautiful campus located just 20 minutes north of Toronto’s Pearson International Airport. Features include a fitness and wellness center, intramural sports activities, on-site cafeteria, and clean, state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities with outstanding safety records. We offer a great work environment and competitive total compensation package, including above market retirement savings plan and market competitive group benefits.
 Husky Technologies TM is an exciting company with tremendous potential. We have a great team and great expectations. If you are attracted to bold goals, believe in uncompromising honesty, support mutual respect, care about environmental responsibility, have a passion for excellence and a desire to make a positive contribution – then we want you to join the Husky Technologies TM team!










JOB PURPOSE
 Responsible for building the business intelligence system for the company, based on the internal and external data structures. Responsible for leading the design and support of enterprise-wide business intelligence applications and architecture. Works with enterprise-wide business and IT senior management to understand and prioritize data and information requirements. Solves complex technical problems. Optimizes the performance of enterprise business intelligence tools by defining data elements which contribute to data insights which add value to the user. Creates testing methodology and criteria. Designs and coordinates a curriculum for coaching and training customers in the use of business intelligence tools to enhance business decision-making capability. Develops standards, policies, and procedures for the form, structure, and attributes of the business intelligence tools and systems. Develops data/information quality metrics. Researches new technology and develops business cases to support enterprise-wide business intelligence solutions.
 OTHER KEY RELATIONSHIPS Operational Business Leads, Business Analysts, Data, Architecture and Technology leads, Software Developers, Digitization Stream Leads

                 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
                

Leading BI software development, deployment and maintenance
Report curation, template definition and analytical data modeling
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements
Translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources
Identifies and resolves data reporting issues in a timely fashion, while looking for continuous improvement opportunities.
Build solutions that create value and resolve business problems
Provide technical guidance to designers and other stakeholders
Work effectively with members of Digital Solutions Team
"Installs, configures, deploys, and tunes analytics toolsand servers"
Troubleshoots analytics tool problems and tunes for performance
Develops semantic layer and analytics query objects for end users
Translation of business questions and requirements into reports, views, and analytics query objects



                 CRITICAL CAPABILITIES
                

Strong problem-solving and metadata skills
Teamwork and commitment to reaching the goals of the project and Husky
Ownership, accountability and speed of execution
Knowledge of analytics tool architectures, functions, and features


 EDUCATION University Degree or Community College Diploma: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent experience
 QUALIFICATION

                 Understanding of ERP and Operational systems databases, knowledge of database programming 
                

Highly skilled at writing SQL queries with large scale, complex datasets
Experience in data visualization and data storytelling
Experience designing, debugging and deploying software in VSTS (Azure Dev/Ops) development environment
Experience with Microsoft BI stack - Power BI and SQL Server Analysis Services


 EXPERIENCE 2+ years of Business Intelligence or Report development experience











Husky Technologies TM offers a competitive compensation and benefits package and excellent opportunities for growth and advancement. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and respect, value and welcome diversity in our workplace. Husky Technologies TM also values being a great place to work and strives to maintain a safe workplace. Accordingly, Husky Technologies TM conditions all offers of employment on satisfactory completion of background checks.

 Husky Technologies TM is committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the member of the Talent Acquisition team in a timely fashion of any disabilities that requires accommodation measures in order to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner.
 Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
 No agency or telephone inquiries please.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
BI Developer, Intermediate 
Working within the Corporate IT team you will design, implement, and maintain BI and analytics Solutions including data mapping, design, development, testing and technical documentation. You will also maintain and troubleshoot new and existing BI Solutions. 

About Linamar 
Linamar Corporation is a Canadian diversified global manufacturing company of highly engineered products across global industries & markets. From the entrepreneurial seeds planted by our dynamic founder, to the support provided along the way, all Linamar employees are poised for success in this fast-paced and rapidly growing environment. With access to the tools you need to succeed, you will make an impact along with other motivated and engaged people. 
Key Accountabilities 
· Provide 2nd tier support to existing BI Solutions. 
· Develop reports to designed specifications. 
· Work collaboratively with the business and IT to analyze requirements, propose, execute, and support BI and Reporting projects. 
· Support the team with analyzing business needs and determining appropriate data, report design, and processes to deliver relevant BI solutions that leverage best practices. 
· Design and build BI user interfaces. 
· Design and build data models to support self-service BI. 
· Asist with end-user training as needed. 
· Act as primary ongoing owner for support of implemented reports and reporting tools. 
· Support Data Warehouse enhancements and operations. 
· Work with Business SME and Business and Systems Analysts to define reporting requirements and goals and to identify the data needed for meeting business requirements. 
· Develop and maintain report blueprints documentation, data dictionary and related meta-data stores. 
· Develop routines and procedures for end-users to facilitate best practices use of reporting tools and applications. 
· Assist Global BI Team members with the design and development of reports and usage of self-service BI tools. 
· Researches, analyzes, recommends, and implements new methods, standard processes, best practices, and techniques for developing BI Solutions. 
Minimum Requirements 
· University degree in computer science, information sciences, data science, or a related field. 
· Microsoft database certifications are recommended. 
· Microsoft Power BI Services, Power BI Desktop, Power BI Reporting Server. 
· Must have excellent hands-on experience working with Microsoft Power BI 
· A minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience working with Microsoft Power Query and M query language. 
· A minimum of 3 years of experience with Tabular data models, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) and Data transformations (measures, calculated, columns, joins) 
· A minimum of 5 years of experience with Data Modeling, Excel and relationship building. 
· Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SISS) 
· Proven documentation skills. 
Desired Characteristics 
· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. 
· Ability to work both independently and in a team environment. 
· Abe to work in a fast paced environment. 
· Critical thinking to analyze and clearly identify the root cause of any issue. 

Why Linamar 
· Opportunities for career advancement 
· Assistance with approved professional designations and fees 
· Community based outreach supporting both local and global initiatives and charities 
· Social committees and sports teams 
· Discounts for local vendors and events, including auto supplier discounts 
Linamar is committed to promoting accessible recruitment as outlined in the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Linamar will attempt to accommodate persons with a disability in an appropriate and effective manner throughout all stages of the recruitment process. Accommodations will be provided upon request.
