Title: 1 year contract - Manager, Visualization and Business Intelligence, CB Analytics
Description:
Requisition ID: 156429  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose:
 The Manager, Visualization and Business Intelligence will be accountable for delivery of business intelligence and data analytics primarily in support of the deposit portfolio including Day-to-Day Banking, High Interest Savings products, GICs under Canadian Banking. Using analytics tools such as SAS, SQL and Power BI, this role will access a wide range of sophisticated data sources to uncover insights and support various business initiatives. The incumbent will also lead the creation of dashboard visualization standardization, to bring together industrial visualization best practices and design principles to the department.
 Accountabilities:
 Accountability 1 –Visualization Standardization


 Create best-in-class, visually attractive and engaging visualization standard that aligns the existing 200-300 Power BI dashboards under CB Analytics, to achieve high consistency of branding, layout, readability and design uniformity
 Apply understanding of the needs of different analytics discipline (Business Intelligence, Data Infrastructure, Data Science, Reporting), to gather requirements and incorporate ideas into a design that would cater the needs of various analytics deliverables, business partners and Executive audience
 Adopt design principal and visualization best practices to create visualization guidelines, dashboard templates and conduct presentation that arouse interest and promote adoption to analytics peers
 Effectively communicate to dashboard creators and end-users in order to provide guidance and assistance to the adoption of the visualization standard

 Accountability 2 – Data Analytics and Visualization


 Utilize a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (eg. SAS, SQL, Power BI) to access Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), Data Lake (EDL) and other platforms to perform complex analysis and reporting, including interactive dashboards, regular reports and ad-hoc requests as required
 Provide dynamic reporting on key performance metrics to various stakeholders in retail, product lines, channels, customer acquisition, marketing and external stakeholders for compliance and benchmarking studies
 Provide strategic analysis that will assist the business to optimize existing accounts and product mix from various channels, grow primary customer and optimize opportunity to acquire non-Scotiabank customers
 Effectively manage and prioritize multiple business initiatives, projects and ad-hoc analysis with business stakeholders and possible external partners.
 Document existing processes and workflows, and look for opportunities to optimize and automate work stream
 Participate in onboarding to any new data platforms and analytics tools such as Python, Bitbucket, MinIO, Cloud solution, etc.

 Accountability 3 – Business Impact


 Manage, design and create data cubes and interactive dashboards that support retail banking business partners
 Support the development and implementation of long-term data and analytics strategy that move towards high degree of automation and end-user self-help solutions
 Act as the advocate of CB Analytics to showcase analytics solutions and dashboards that helps business partners to gain insight, build business cases and make fact-based decisions
 Acquire and enhance knowledge in technical areas, product strategies, competitive practices, market insights to continuously improve analytics value


 Must have Qualifications:


 4+ years of analytical experience required
 Must be proficient with Power BI, SAS and SQL.
 Experience in leading data visualization and/or analytics initiatives
 Excellent communication skill and relationship-building skill with analytics peers and business partners
 Experienced with Excel pivot table and MS Office
 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing, Finance or Business

 Good to have Qualifications:


 Microsoft Power BI DA-100 or equivalent certificate
 Related design experience
 2+ years experience in financial industry


 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Transaction Analyst
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   What You’ll Be Doing
 

   The Senior Transaction Analyst within Enterprise Wires Modernization’s Global Money Operations (GMO) is responsible for the delivery of efficient operational support, accurately processing service inquiries and requests while upholding compliance with internal controls and procedures. The role uses judgement regarding priorities and approaches to obtain complete and accurate information of client issues, provides clients with detailed explanations of their recommendations, and verifies their understanding of the issue. The incumbent demonstrates strong technical and system knowledge to review and analyze data to ensure quality assurance of transactions and maintain customer satisfaction. In addition, the role assists in the management of day-to-day operation and overall efficiency of the unit, while seeking opportunities to streamline existing processes and procedures.
 


   The Specialist will also work in a team environment and will participate in project activities (requirements gathering, design feedback, and user acceptance testing).
 


   Due to the nature of this role, a criminal record check will need to be completed at least annually for the purpose of enhanced screening.
 


 At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.



   How You’ll Succeed
 

 Critical and Analytical Thinking –You will ensure complete and timely review and action for wire payment inquiries and identify root cause where possible.
 Cross training & flexibility – You will enhance your knowledge of the many types of payments(ISO20022, ISO20021) received at financial institutions, learn how to handle diverse payment inquiries, and problem solve. You will cross train to support and understand multiple processes and be able to jump from task to task all the while acting as a subject matter expert (SME)
 Relationship Building - Required to interact with internal business partners, external business partners, and correspondent banks globally. You represent yourself professionally and can clearly articulate your thoughts. You are able to foster mentorship relationships with your team and with others across the bank.
 Training and Relationship Building – Training other staff to ensure they understand processes, procedures and the importance of customer service quality.
 Transaction processing - Use your extensive knowledge of Wire payment processing and Investigations is highly desirable. This includes expertise on ISO20021/22 message types, COINS, CUP, GOW, ACH - and in lending expertise on Fraud and AML escalations. As well as the sound knowledge described above, a continuous improvement mindset is required to be able to actively/proactively participate in project activities



   Who You Are
 

 Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
 You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
 You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
 You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
 You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
 You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what's possible.



   What CIBC Offers
 

   At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
 

 We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
 Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
 We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  Toronto-595 Bay St., 7th
 
   Employment Type
  Regular
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Analytical Thinking, Banking, Building Relationships, Business, Continuous Improvement (CI), Creativity, Decision Making, Financial Institution Management

Title: System Analyst
Description:
Job ID #342592
 System Analyst
On behalf of our client in the Financial Services Sector, PROCOM is looking for a System Analyst
System Analyst – Job Description 

Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects and foster communication between business stakeholders and technology 
Creating system and data flow diagrams 
Lead the development of conceptual/architectural designs and user interface mock-ups. 
Collaborate with development staff on software designs 
Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommend solutions 
Support system change processes from requirements through implementation and provides input based on analysis of information 
Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment 
Technical analysis of product or application hardware and software to ensure that business and functional requirements can be met 
The Systems Analyst is a liaison and key communication bridge between the development and business teams 
Clear communication of technical requirements to the development team and development concerns to business stakeholders 
The Systems Analyst speaks the language of software development and product management 
Identify cross application/system enhancements 
Outline key dependencies and knock-on impacts of new development work 
Act as a technical consultant for Business partners during implementation of new products/services 
Lead review sessions of technical requirements 

System Analyst – Mandatory Skills 

5-8 years of relevant experience 
Advanced knowledge of Databases, SQL and Data analysis 
Proven experience using UML and creating system and data flow diagrams using industry tools 
Proven interpersonal, diplomatic, management and prioritization skills 
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication 
Proven ability to manage multiple activities and build/develop working relationships 
Proven self-motivation to take initiative and master new tasks quickly 
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and approach work methodically with attention to detail 
Problem Solver: Ability to solve complex issues and have a high ability to remove barriers, understanding internal and external organizational structures, dynamics and trade-offs 
Committed to a customer-first approach 
Growth Mind-set: Experience and passion for learning; implementing practices from others 
trying, failing, sharing practices and knowledge for others’ benefit 
Proficiency in using Jira and Confluence 

System Analyst - Nice to Have Skills 

Scrum Master certification (preferred) 

System Analyst - Assignment Start Date 
ASAP – 12 months to start 
System Analyst - Assignment Location 
Mississauga, ON – Work Hybrid

Title: Senior Analyst
Description:
Your Opportunity:
 Emergency Medical Services (EMS) is a complex, dynamic and evolving area of healthcare in Alberta. EMS responds to over 500,000 events/ year. A centralized dispatch model and utilization of a single electronic patient care record across the province provides a wealth of operational and clinical data. System Performance and Innovation (SPI) is the provincial team responsible for turning this data into information and insight. We have an SAP Business Objects based Business Intelligence environment for EMS data that allows us to quickly develop complex queries and reports. In addition, we utilize a variety of analytical tools and methods including ArcGIS and Tableau to meet our mandate. We have developed data linkages into the AHS data repository for reporting and are working to develop EMS industry leading clinical care measures. Our team works with and interacts with other analytical teams and service areas across AHS. We pride ourselves in providing a positive, results oriented working environment.
 Description: 
The Senior Analyst reports to a SPI manager and is responsible for developing operational reporting, responding to ad hoc requests from all levels of EMS (and AHS), providing complex data and analytical expertise to projects, research and programs, providing executive-level performance reporting and developing public reporting on EMS’ performance. Also will develop databases, perform complex data queries across multiple datasets and provide sophisticated analytics and measures (creates new data). Develops measures and defines performance indicators and reports; develops, implements and utilize business intelligence (BI) tools. This position is a lead resource for technical elements and specialized industry expertise related to analytics. This position requires an in-depth knowledge of EMS operations and associated EMS data sets. The position must complement this business knowledge with the technical analytical skills and experience to perform the required data querying, analyses and reporting. This will include multiple complex queries on multiple database(s) and linking data from disparate health data sets to support everything from relatively simple and routine reporting to high value-added analyses in support of research, audits, evaluations and EMS outcomes. EMS SPI utilizes a dedicated BI tool (SAP Business Objects) and various other analytical software tools including Tableau, ArcGIS and Oracle. This position must be able to effectively use these tools as EMS works to provide more information to a broader audience in a variety of self-serve and other readily accessible formats. The position leads and contributes to project teams; consults, advises and works with AHS clients, both within and beyond EMS. The position is expected to work independently with minimal supervision.


Classification: Senior Analyst
 Union: Exempt
 Unit and Program: Emergency Medical Services System Performance & Innovation
 Primary Location: EMS Headquarters - Calgary
 Negotiable Location: Provincial
 Employee Class: Regular Full Time
 FTE: 1.00
 Posting End Date: 12-JUL-2022
 Date Available: 22-JUL-2022
 Hours per Shift: 7.75
 Length of Shift in weeks: 2
 Shifts per cycle: 10
 Shift Pattern: Days
 Days Off: Saturday/Sunday
 Minimum Salary: $28.20
 Maximum Salary: $48.45
 Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable

 Required Qualifications: 
Minimum required Bachelor’s degree with a strong quantitative focus (e.g., health economics, mathematics, statistics, operations engineering, health sciences, epidemiology, etc.) Master’s degree preferred. Minimum Five (5) years progressive experience in data, analytics, reporting, program evaluation or similar. Excellent analytical skills, problem solving ability and attention to detail. Able to create new datasets and information by aggregating, manipulating and linking data from EMS and other health system datasets. Able to create descriptive statistics with higher-order or compound measures. Education and demonstrated skill in data query and report building using various tools (e.g., SQL, MS Access, Oracle, Tableau). Demonstrated skills using analytical or statistical software such as SPSS. Education and demonstrated skills in developing and using database software and the ability to apply skills and knowledge to new database environments (for example, be able to learn to work with SQL if used to Oracle). Strong working knowledge of computer systems, web-based environments and the entire MS Office suite.
 Additional Required Qualifications: 
Strong track record in establishing and maintaining productive working relationships with internal stakeholders and clients. Basic knowledge of EMS operations and associated Dispatch and Patient Care data. Strong written and verbal English communication skills. Proven ability to work and make decisions independently. Able to deal with time pressures, uncertainty, shifting priorities and complex work assignments. A pattern of professional development is expected. Equivalencies of education and experience would be considered.
 Preferred Qualifications: 
As required.

Title: Lead Revenue Operations Analyst
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY  As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

 The Opportunity:
 The Lead Revenue Operations Analyst, WW Renewals is a member of a global and dynamic team that is responsible for over 2b of recurring revenue each year across Off Cloud, Cloud and SMB. This role contributes to a key operational process and supports consolidated reporting across the 3 renewal business units, building out visibility for the overall global business.
 This position assists in the achievement of Renewals revenue growth by driving key reporting capabilities and deliverables:

Systems & Business Analysis: Business Intelligence, Dashboarding, and Trending for the complete renewals business, with a focus on Power BI
Development of reporting prototypes during the design phase and actual development of the tools during the construction phase
Provide thoughtful analysis on management dashboards to facilitate effective understanding of progress, achievements, and gaps. Communicate key information and analysis to WW Renewals management

 What You Are Great At:

Working independently on assignments of a complex nature where initiative and creativity are required in resolving problems and/or developing recommendations with special focus on KPI measurement
Building tools and providing analysis to develop a deep understanding of overall business landscape
Translating business requirements into functional/technical requirements working within the framework of the tools available
Security Administration for reporting tools: managing roles & permissions
Showcasing excellent business acumen, aligning data quality standards and best practices to support the mission and activities of the WW Renewals Teams



 What It Takes:
  

University Degree or College Diploma in a business or technical discipline
10+ years of relevant business experience, ideally within a fast-paced technology environment
Expertise in report development: SQL, DAX, Power Query/Power BI
Proficiency in MS Excel (expert level), Power Point, Outlook, and Word is a must
OLAP knowledge is an asset
Advanced expertise in report creation, leveraging multiple large data sets to perform complex data analysis and modeling, as well as an aptitude for systems
Experience with detailed business requirement gathering and creating functional specifications
Ability to deliver to multiple deadlines and prioritize effectively
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to make sound decisions and influence results
Adaptable and flexible
Experience with subscription / license-based products highly preferred



 OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com.

 Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Senior Risk Analyst
Description:
Senior Risk Analyst
 Toronto

 About Citco
 Citco is a global leader in fund services, corporate governance and related asset services with staff across 80 offices worldwide. With more than $1 trillion in assets under administration, we deliver end-to-end solutions and exceptional service to meet our clients’ needs.
 For more information about Citco, please visit www.citco.com
 About the Team & Business Line:
 Fund Administration is Citco’s core business, and our alternative asset and accounting service is one of the industry’s most respected. Our continuous investment in learning and technology solutions means our people are equipped to deliver a seamless client experience.
 As a core member of our Risk and Transparency team, you will be working with some of the industry’s most accomplished professionals to deliver award-winning services for complex fund structures that our clients can depend upon.
 Your Role:

 Produce quantitative portfolio risk reports (market/credit/liquidity) using a wide variety of proprietary technologies and data sources for Buy-Side institutional investment clients
 Design quantitative portfolio risk dashboards and reports for Buy-Side institutional investment clients
 Prepare regulatory reports such as AIFMD, Form PF, and Open Protocol as it pertains to government regulatory bodies on behalf of institutional clients
 Analyze quantitative results and find potential for process improvements and automation
 Perform data entry and first level data validation and ad-hoc reporting as required
 Test new risk technology offerings for quantitative and qualitative assurance
 Frequently communicate with clients and internal stakeholders to respond to client queries independently, and own relationships for risk reporting on complex clients
 Perform data analysis and modification/cleaning as necessary


 About You:

 Bachelor’s Degree in any of the following (Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math) or equivalent and/or equivalent experience
 1- 3 yrs of Risk reporting experience
 Proven quantitative and analytical skills. Ability to learn a wide variety of new concepts quickly and investigate issues/problems independently
 SQL (Oracle/Sybase/SQL Server) queries (select, insert, update, joins, Stored Proc nice to have)
 Proven ability to break complex problems down into pieces and proactively narrow down a resolution
 Outstanding interpersonal communication skills
 Strong sense of accountability and ownership
 Exemplary command of the English language and effective professional communication style
 Attention to detail, commitment to accuracy and avoidance of errors
 Commitment to meet tight deadlines and multi-tasking
 Strong Excel (Vlookups, VBA functions, lookup tables)
 Highly desired : Understanding of financial products, risk-free valuation, Black-Scholes and risk metrics such as Value at Risk, Exposures and Stress Testing
 Ability and willingness to work over-time to meet business requirements


 Our Benefits
 Your well being is of paramount importance to us, and central to our success. We provide a range of benefits, training and education support, and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve success in your career while balancing personal needs. Ask us about specific benefits in your location.

 We recognize diversity as a source of organizational pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization.
 Citco welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection.

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Information Services
Description:
BE PART OF THE TEAM THAT BRINGS THE WORLD TOGETHER.
 Career Opportunity: Senior Business Analyst
 Join an organization that plays a critical role in Canada’s economy. The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is responsible for the stewardship of the Port of Vancouver, Canada’s largest and most diversified port.
 We are passionate about the work we do and what it contributes to our local communities, the region and our country. This is reflected in our values of collaboration, continuous improvement, accountability and customer responsiveness. It’s a workplace where the intrinsic value of your contribution to help foster the continued growth of the Canadian economy becomes a tangible reality.
 The Senior Business Analyst – Information Services works closely with business stakeholders and technology teams to create both business and functional requirements and guide the process from idea inception to delivery. Key tasks include coordinating cross-functional teams in mapping out and solving business problems, developing business requirements, work plans and technical specifications, as well as performing system and user tests, preparing documentation and training users.
 This role will:

 Convert ideas and hypothesis into concise business proposals to present to stakeholders
 Utilizing data analysis and business process tools, builds models and facilitates requirements alignment
 Oversight of external technology consultants involved in implementations
 Participates in the project close out and lessons learned activities to validate solutions with the business to ensure delivery and continuous improvement
 Participates in determining and acquiring resources (people, hardware and software)
 Designs systems specifications, modules, and process changes

 Education and Experience
 A post-secondary degree in computer science, business administration or another acceptable area, along with a minimum of five years related experience, including recent proven leadership on business analysis, project management and user requirement gathering in complex business environments.
 Strong preference for those with a passion and dedication to ongoing professional development (i.e. Business Analyst Certification). Must value maintaining their technology skills and acts proactively to stay abreast of advances in their areas of expertise.
 Must have demonstrated experience in the following:

 Working in agile/scrum environment
 Proficiency in tools like draw.io, Visio, Jira and SharePoint Online
 Complex technical and architectural documentation skills
 Conceptual understanding of and exposure to modern programming languages, data management, analysis and reporting tools


 The following will be considered as an asset:

 Experience with supporting or creating solutions for finance and accounting systems
 Exposure to no-code/low-code platforms such as ServiceNow, Microsoft Powerautomate/PowerApps, SAP, etc
 Development and programming experience/exposure
 Project management experience
 Data security principles, efficiency, quality, and governance
 The incumbent must obtain and maintain a valid Marine Transportation Security Clearance as this position is required to access restricted areas/information as defined by the Marine Transportation Security Regulations.
 

The health and safety of our employees is a priority and the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is committed to ensuring a safe workplace. Vaccinations, in combination with other preventative health and safety measures, offer the best available protection against COVID-19 and that is why port authority employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Providing proof of vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment.


Candidates may be accommodated for this requirement if they are approved for a legal exemption; accommodation may be requested only for religious and medical reasons, or other protected grounds under the Canadian Human Rights Act. If you’re seeking accommodation to the COVID-19 vaccination requirement, please indicate your request during the recruitment process.

 The Port Authority offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including an Earned Time Off program.
 
 This work is Canadian based employment and expected to be performed from our Vancouver office location.
 
 Please note this posting will remain open until filled.
 
 We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
 

At the port authority, we are dedicated to employment equity and a workplace reflective of the diversity of our port community.

 Learn more about us at www.portvancouver.com

Title: Senior Risk Analyst - Risk Analytics
Description:
Job Description:
  The BC Financial Services Authority (BCFSA) protects British Columbians during their most important financial transactions. We regulate BC ’s financial services market, including credit unions, trust companies, registered pension plans, insurance companies and mortgage brokers.
We uphold public confidence by impartially setting and enforcing standards for real estate professionals. We also ensure that consumers dealing with licensed real estate professionals are protected against wrongful actions. By overseeing the most significant financial transactions in BC we ensure fairness, legality and the prosperity of consumers and the province.
BCFSA is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all groups. This includes women, visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (LGBTQ2S+), and others who may contribute to diversity at BCFSA.
We recognize unique styles, perspectives, beliefs, and creativity that support a diverse, respectful, inclusive and collaborative work environment. To achieve this, we stay committed to:
Hiring team members who represent the population we serve Removing barriers that may prevent equitable employment Supporting respectful work environments where everyone feels included and able to produce excellent results
BCFSA is proud to be Great Place to Work Certified™ organization based on direct feedback from our team members.
WHAT WE OFFER:
Healthy living and work-life balance Comprehensive health and wellness benefits plan Opportunities for personal and professional development Competitive compensation A challenging and engaging team environment Defined benefits pension plan Flexible work arrangement for eligible positions A beautiful office location in downtown Vancouver
 SUMMARY This position is responsible for identifying and quantifying emerging or existing system risks, analyzing industry trends, and recommending solutions to mitigate, resolve or manage the risks.

ACCOUNTABILITIES


Examines emerging trends and institutional and system-wide information to identify risks to regulated financial sectors in BC.
Performs research and surveillance to identify possible sources of risk.
Evaluates and assesses risk and proposes actions to resolve or manage the risk.
Assesses the effectiveness of prudential metrics and proposes changes to improve their ability to reveal systemic risks.
Contributes to the team’s development of internal work practices (e.g., risk assessments and analytical tools).
Prepares rationales, briefing notes, decision letters and discussion documents to support decisions and recommendations.
Leads engagement with internal and external stakeholders.
Provides orientation and training to internal and/or external stakeholders within area of responsibility.
Contributes to, participates in, and supports organizational business transformation initiatives.



JOB REQUIREMENTS


Degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics/Statistics, Data or Actuarial Science, Engineering or Physics and experience in the financial services sector, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 Related experience includes:
   o Financial Risk Management
   o Financial Modeling
   o FRM, CFA designation
  

Working knowledge of data analytics, financial, and quantitative analysis techniques.
Working knowledge of computer programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL).
Knowledge of credit, market, liquidity, operational, and systemic risks as they apply to financial institutions.
Knowledge of the general economy, business practices, real estate, investments, and lending as they apply to financial institutions.
Experience in flood, wildfire or earthquake modeling is a plus.
Experience in translating climate risks into financial risks is a plus.
Knowledge of risk management principles and methods.
Ability to exercise judgement, initiative, and discretion.
Ability to write clear and concise documentation, reports, briefing notes, etc.
Superior oral and written communication skills.


PROVISOS
Please be advised that BCFSA requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of hire and ongoing employment. Candidates will be requested to provide proof of vaccination status, and may only be exempted from the requirements of proof and full vaccination if they request and are approved for a medical exemption or a Human Rights Code accommodation. Such a request must be made during, not after, the recruitment process.

Title: Business Intelligence Manager
Company: The Great Western Brewing Co. Ltd.
Description:
About Us‘Brewers with Heart’ is what we are known for. We thrive on the legendary passion and leadership that 16 front-line employees, ‘The Original 16’, demonstrated when they saved the brewery from closure in 1990 and founded the Great Western Brewing Company. We win brewing awards and have learned to reinvent ourselves. We are proud, independent and determined!
Why Work Here

Your work will be noticed, what you do matters.
We are the perfect sized organization to work for, big enough to do interesting work yet small enough that our CEO knows each of us.
Culture of bold ambition, delivering on our commitments
Leadership with passion and a great sense of humour.
You don’t need to just stay in your lane, in fact, initiative is what created the company we are today.

OverviewThe Business Intelligence Manager is responsible for overseeing the Business Intelligence department to ensure the streamlined operation of the department in alignment with the business objectives of the organization. Primarily supporting the needs of the Commercial Team, the BI Manager will work closely with decision makers in other departments to provide insight into internal and industry trends, identify challenges and opportunities, and recommend data-driven solutions, ultimately supporting these groups in making informed business decisions and executing against the long-term strategy.
ResponsibilitiesData Strategy and Governance

Operationalize and evolve the existing data strategy to ensure that data is valued as a strategic asset and is an integral element of decision making at Great Western Brewing
Be a thought leader on how data and analytics can be leveraged within Great Western Brewing
Work closely with different business functions and identify new analytics opportunities to help move the business forward
Prioritize and coordinate data or information requests
Drive Data Governance activities within the organization to ensure that data is available and reliable to support Business objectives

Business Intelligence

Build, improve and maintain the business intelligence (BI) environment that includes a suite of Power BI reports
Lead and execute Annual Volume Planning exercise
Ensure accurate, regular & timely completion and clarification of core internal reporting exercises that support
Prepare, manipulate and analyze data from internal and external data sources to help support fact-based decision making and identify key issues and opportunities across all markets
Leverage external or publicly available data sources alongside internal datasets to develop complete understanding of GWBC’s position within the competitive industry
Educate and train business users with adopting the appropriate report or data product in meeting their needs

Share & Present

Lead regular meetings to effectively communicate insights gleaned from reporting and analysis and work with key stakeholders to determine actionable take-aways. This includes:


Quarterly Business Review
Quarterly Competitive Industry Review
Annual Business Review
Support Commercial Leadership team in annual Top to Top meetings with key customers and Liquor Boards by providing and presenting relevant data and insights

Management

Coach and grow the BI Coordinator with clear direction and proactive leadership, strategic assignment of responsibilities, and other training opportunities.
Work closely with Commercial Leadership team, other departments, and external partners
Oversee and ensure effective management and completion of a variety of administrative tasks related to Sales and Marketing functions:


Maintain internal programming and promotional activity calendars for all sales regions
Complete and submit marketing program applications across all markets and channels; track and communicate results to relevant stakeholders
Update and maintain provincial price lists and communicate changes to relevant stakeholders
Execute price changes with provincial liquor boards on a regular schedule
Execute new product set ups with provincial liquor boards

Key Requirements and CapabilitiesEducation & Experience: 

Degree, diploma or certificate in data analysis, business administration or related field
3-5 years in Business Analyst role or data-related role, and/or consumer-packaged goods, beverage alcohol or beer
Certificate or course work in Project Management
Microsoft Excel expert (experience with pivot tables an asset)
Experience with Microsoft Power BI
Experience with CRM
A combination of education and experience will be considered

Skills and Capabilities

Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize a multitude of projects, track and manage multiple deadlines, and meet them consistently
Superior attention to detail and a desire to produce accurate work – you take pride in ensuring your work is accurate, complete and well-formatted
Strong analytic capabilities and business acumen; reviews data, see what's relevant, draws meaningful conclusions, and finds actionable takeaways.
Proficient in use of Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint
Strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to influence decisions
Agile and adaptable with the ability to quickly adapt to changes and learn how to work with new/changing data sources and platforms
Collaborative worker who can work across departments with different stakeholders and interests

Culture Fit

A high sense of responsibility where your word is your bond. Taking full ownership for anything you commit to, large or small, you feel compelled to follow it through.
Remarkably rally resources, configuring all the pieces to their best fit. Confidently and calmly orchestrate people, plans and tactics especially when things don’t go according to plan.
Quick to see alternatives and chart multiple paths to get to the destination
A drive for action and results, in fact, action is the only thing you know is real
Loves beer – you can wake up and want more Western Canadian consumers to have a better beer experience

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Application deadline: 2022-07-12

Title: Senior Analyst, Tax [Transfer Pricing]
Description:
Who we are
 You know those big cities that still feel like small towns? Where everyone’s friendly and helps each other out? That’s like Grant Thornton. Except here we’re all professionals and there isn’t a mayor or a general store. What we’re trying to say is that we’re a large and growing professional services firm that still feels like a community. We employ over 2500 people across Canada, and we truly care about our colleagues, our clients and the communities where we work and live. That’s what’s most important to us. We’re building a thriving organization that’s purpose driven and still want to remember what your favourite milkshake flavour is.
   

As a Senior Analyst, Tax [Transfer Pricing] some of your responsibilities will include, but not limited to:


Demonstrating a solid understanding of transfer pricing concepts and current practice
Interacting and communicating effectively with clients and colleagues, including leading or having a major role in routine client calls and meetings
Participating in fact gathering, industry research and analysis
Analyzing financial statements and data, including large sets of accounting and transactional data
Preparing economic analysis, including appropriately selecting and applying a transfer pricing method, and preparing benchmarking analysis with minimal guidance
Writing reports and other business communication
Developing presentations for clients, colleagues and other teams within the firm
Performing all aspects of engagement administration
Participating in or leading all aspects of engagement management
Supporting the team in the resolution of transfer pricing audits by tax authorities
Delegating, overseeing and reviewing work performed by analysts on all of the above
Regularly acting as a mentor and training analysts
Staying abreast of global transfer pricing, tax and business developments



Be Grant Thornton If you’re a bit like us, you’re driven to connect with how others are feeling and thinking. Here we walk in others shoes before taking action. Just imagine being part of a team that puts “we before me”, where flexAbility is a mindset, and where you trust your colleagues to have your back. At Grant Thornton, you’ll work with inspiring leaders who support your development, both personally and professionally. This is a place where your insatiable curiosity enables you to think, see and hear from a variety of perspectives, a place where every day is different and having the courage to grow is part of who you are. And when all this comes together, well that’s when the magic happens!

 Want to learn more about who we are and how we live our purple every day – read our colleagues stories at www.discoveryourpurple.ca


Think you’ve got what it takes to be a Senior Analyst, Tax [Transfer Pricing]? Like the color purple? Great! Here's a few more boxes we’re also hoping you can tick:


Post-secondary degree in Economics, Business (Finance), Law, and/or an Accounting designation, JD/LLB , LLM , CFA or CBV
2 + years' transfer pricing experience at a professional services firm
Proven analytical, problem-solving, communication (oral and written), organization and interpersonal skills
Experience with business writing
Proficient in MS Office tools such as Word, PowerPoint and Excel
Able to multi-task working with numerous deadlines
Eagerness to learn and a commitment to deliver an exceptional client experience

 At Grant Thornton we’re focused on making a difference in the lives of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. That’s our purpose. Or, as we like to say, living our purple.
   

Are you ready to Discover Your Purple?








#LI-HYBRID








Grant Thornton LLP is committed to employment equity, human rights and respectful workplace principles throughout the life cycle of employment, including at the recruitment and hiring stages. We welcome applications from members of all equity deserving groups, including persons with disabilities, women, racialized and/or Indigenous applicants. Should you require accommodation in relation to the recruitment process, please notify us by emailing careers@ca.gt.com and we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs.

Title: (Senior) Business Intake/Conflicts Analyst
Description:
Blake, Cassels & Graydon LLP (Blakes), one of Canada’s largest and most successful law firms, is currently looking for a Business Intake/Conflicts Analyst or Senior Business Intake/Conflicts Analyst to join the General Counsel’s Office in the Toronto office.
The preferred hours of work for this position are 8:00 a.m. – 4:00 p.m. Eastern Time (EST), with the request to be available for overtime from time to time, as required.
Primary responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to: 
· The timely execution of conflict searches and analysis of search data to ensure a thorough review of potential conflicts
· Conducting conflict of interest searches according to the Firm’s defined procedures and using the Firm’s new conflict searching software
· Defining appropriate search parameters, searching multiple databases to identify potential conflicts of interest and other risk issues such as sanctions, and preparing and curating conflict reports for the Firm’s lawyers to review
· Ensuring all relevant information is captured, recorded and maintained in accordance with defined policies and procedures in the Firm’s databases
· Providing coaching and assistance to legal assistants as needed to ensure all required information for new matter opening is captured and recorded accurately, and information for existing matters is updated in a timely manner
· Participating in ensuring policies, procedures and database structures are continuously reviewed and modified to meet changing requirements; the scope of initiatives can range from day-to-day small continuous improvements to the development of new tracking and reporting systems
· Supporting key projects and initiatives undertaken by the General Counsel’s Office as required to manage the Firm’s risk, as well as participating in all required clerical and administrative needs for effective functioning of the office
· Applying sound judgement to ensure effective review of conflicts and knowing when to escalate issues
· For senior role, exhibiting a keen understanding of Intapp Open, and assisting with project-specific testing for new software developments
· For senior role, providing support and guidance to junior team members, and sharing best practices
Qualifications
Education/Experience:
· Undergraduate diploma or degree preferred
· Three to five years of professional work experience in a law firm preferred
· For Senior role, working knowledge of Intapp Open and/or experience with conflict searches required
Skills/Abilities:
· Research and analytical experience
· Strong attention to detail
· Strong research and analytical skills
· Strong computer skills and demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies
· Excellent written and verbal communications skills
· Excellent customer-service attitude with the ability to handle difficult situations with tact and diplomacy
· Impeccable organizational and time management skills, and the ability to multi-task
· Sound judgement and decision-making abilities that can be relied on by all levels of management
· Strong relationship-building skills within the department and across departments
· Positive, professional disposition and flexibility to handle regular interruptions and unexpected changes to workflow
· Team player who is willing to assist peers as needed, troubleshoot problems and participate in developing solutions
How to Apply
To apply for this position, please submit your application and include your cover letter and résumé directly to our application portal.
Blakes wishes to thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Who We Are
At Blakes, we are all about our people. We are committed to not only providing exceptional client experiences, but also fostering an open and inclusive workplace culture for legal professionals and administrative professionals. As a winner of the Canada’s Best Diversity Employers award, as well as the Greater Toronto’s Top Employers award, we know that diversity and inclusion are not simply initiatives on the perimeter of our business — they are the core of our success. We understand the importance of cultivating an environment that brings out the best in each person. Our success as a Firm starts with the hiring, development and retention of top talent.
Blakes welcomes applications from all qualified applicants. The Firm is committed to maintaining an inclusive work environment comprised of people with diverse perspectives, backgrounds, identities and cultures.
The Firm provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities and in respect of other protected grounds during the recruitment process in accordance with applicable laws. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Title: Information Security Analyst
Senior Business Analyst
Description:
At Trulioo, we build and connect digital identity networks around the globe, and this framework of trust empowers businesses to assess the various risks associated with digital identities. Our mission is to build trust online. Digital services hold the promise of allowing anyone to interact and transact with anyone, anywhere. However, the threat of bad actors gets in the way of our connectedness; the global village only works if we trust each other.
We are a Silicon Valley-funded tech company solving the problems of trust and safety online. To realize that goal we've built the world's leading identity verification platform, enabling instant verification of 5 billion people and 330 million businesses in more than 195 countries. With offices in Vancouver, San Diego, Austin, Dublin and Copenhagen, we've fostered a world class team committed to building trust online. Our competitive advantage is, and always will be, our people. At Trulioo, we truly believe "everyone is someone" and we invite you to join our mission and celebrate the positive change we are making in the world.

 Position Summary
 As a Senior Business Analyst on the Program Management Office team, you will play a key role in the planning, execution and end to end delivery of key strategic and transformational projects that are cross-functional spanning across Marketing, Product, Sales and Customer Success. Areas of responsibility will include performing business impact analysis, process mapping and documentation, and working closely with cross functional primes to support as needed in achieving project milestones and deliverables.
 This is a full-time position in our Vancouver office.
 What you'll be doing

Work with Departments to understand, outline, and document the impacted processes/tools/systems
Lead and facilitate discovery and validation workshops with cross functional teams
Participate in the project planning to align your deliverables with project objectives and schedule
Development of Business Requirements Analysis, business process modeling and mapping
Leverage your ability to generate insights from various datasets to create a clear and compelling story from data and analysis suitable for a variety of audiences including Marketing, Product, Sales and CS
Support the PMO in the development of weekly project status reports and executive updates
Work closely with the BI/Data Science team to ensure the quality, accuracy, reliability, and timeliness of the data and reports required to measure project success

You have

Energy and thrive in a fast paced, and sometimes ambiguous environment
Ability to analyze and understand process mapping as a method of visualizing a business process
Strong analytical and problem solving skills and are able to generate multiple solutions to any problem
Self-motivated, positive, ambitious, detailed-oriented, and a big appetite for high achievement
Strong understanding of business process analysis methods
Ability to consider change management implications for changes to business processes.
5+ years in a Business Analyst role
Experience dealing/communicating effectively across different areas of the organization
Ability to manage and complete multiple tasks within tight deadlines
Expertise in Google Suite & Microsoft Office applications (MS Excel, MS PowerPoint)
Experience working in the Identity Verification space an asset
Experience working with with Business Intelligence software like Tableau is an asset

Nice to Have

Experience working in the Identity Verification space
Experience working with work management platform such as Asana is an asset
Agile certifications, PMP or equivalent


 Working at Trulioo
 You will be challenged to achieve, develop, and grow as part of a hyper-growth company.
We offer you the opportunity to make a difference and create a better world by revolutionizing how technology, trust, and identity intersect online. We are on a mission to make sure no one is left behind and everyone has the opportunity to participate fully in the modern digital economy. In order to do this well, diversity and inclusion have always been fundamental to our mission, our culture and our life. Trulioo is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and our commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, identity and experience connects us with the customers and communities we serve, attracting top talent and passionate changemakers across the globe. Our mission matters – for billions of people everywhere.
The diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of Trulioo's team members help us make better decisions and drive great results. We foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives.
We're committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. We hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and the freedom to grow into their roles.
You are naturally curious, invest time to better understand complex concepts and have strong attention to detail. You love working in a team where trust is key and want to make an impact everyday. If this sounds like you, please apply and come work with us.
 Studies show that minorities and members of underrepresented groups apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Trulioo encourages everyone interested in a role to apply. We look forward to your application!

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - #CStech’
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Business Systems Analyst - #CStech’
 





































 Job Description





































 What will you do? 

Elicit functional and system requirements for Control Room and Employee Monitoring projects for Capital Markets and Wealth Management Compliance
 Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of details and accuracy of estimates
 Analyze and document detailed business and system solution requirements using Agile methodology
 Define practical user experiences, including storytelling, personas, process flows and interactions
 Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards
 Apply advanced coverage analysis techniques to ensure relationship between scope, detailed requirements, and testing through to implementation
 Contribute to successful project completion within budget and on time by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.


 What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have 

7+ years fulfilling both Business Analyst and/or Business System Analyst roles
 Proficiency in Agile Methodology Framework
 Expertise in gathering, analyzing and documenting User Stories, Use Cases, workflow diagrams, and E2E requirements
 Experience with requirements elicitation techniques such as Document Analysis, Interviews, Facilitated Workshops, Observation, Prototyping, Focus groups, Surveys
 Experience in working with large projects with multiple stakeholders, data sources and system interfaces
 Knowledge of global securities industry, financial products, and functions


 Ability to communicates and build relationship with team members, stakeholders and business partners in order to complete deliverables.
 Experience in generating new and effective ideas, approaches and solutions to complex problems & opportunities; openly question traditional assumptions track and manage changes to requirements throughout the project life cycle
 Familiarity with relational databases, and query languages


 Nice-to-have 

Good understanding of capital markets compliance is an asset.
 Knowledge of North American and international securities trading and data related to complete trade life cycle.
 Knowledge of wireframe and prototype design tools such as Balsamiq
 Experience with JIRA, and Confluence


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 A world-class training program in financial services
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
 Enjoy a comfortable work environment with the option to dress casually







































 Job Summary




































 As a Senior Business Analyst in the Compliance IT team, you will execute all aspects of requirement delivery- planning, elicitation, analysis and documentation, and requirements management. You will be a part of a multi-disciplinary scrum team, working closely with requirements stakeholders to make decisions about requirements approach – requirements deliverables, activities, effort estimates and will recommend best courses of action.
 




































 Address:




































 TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
 




































 City:




































 CAN-ON-TORONTO
 




































 Country:




































 Canada

 37.5

 Technology and Operations
 




































 Job Type:




































 Regular
 




































 Pay Type:




































 Salaried
 




































 Posted Date:





































2022-07-11-07:00
